loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a very hard working married man who lives in Hoima Uganda. He started his business of selling phone accessories alongside operating farming in order to raise income to support his family. He desires to expand and develop his business, however inadequate capital hinders the achievement of his desires. He is seeking a loan to buy more phones and cables for resale.

loans.use: to buy more phones and cables for resale.

loans.name: Mira

texts.en: Mira is a 40-year-old woman from Calape, Bohol. She is married and has three sons. Her oldest son is 16 years old while her youngest son is seven years old. Her husband is a chainsaw operator while she is engaged in retailing purified water. They work hard together to earn a living. In the future, Mira wants to improve her business so they could have a better means of living. Thus she is asking for a loan to buy lumber.

loans.use: to buy lumber

loans.name: Joash

texts.en: Joash is a Kiva borrower. He has 2 children. He operates a retail business where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful.

loans.use: buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Merlinda is from Calape, Bohol. She is married and has five children, two of whom are still in school. Her husband owns a vulcanizing shop, while she is running a sari-sari store business. In the future, Merlinda wants to improve her business for sustainability. Thus she is asking for a loan to buy additional grocery items such as soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, biscuits, chips, toiletries, cooking oil, spices, coffee, sugar, powdered milk, juice and chocolate drink.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, biscuits, chips, toiletries, cooking oil, spices, coffee, sugar, powdered milk, juice and chocolate drink.

loans.name: Mwanauba

texts.en:
Mwanauba is a married woman with four children, two of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors staying for long to repay for goods taken on credit.

With the requested loan she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Irene Nalih

texts.en:
Irene Naligh is married with seven children. They live in a three-bedroom house in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced difficulties in life, which have been early pregnancy and school drop out, the loss of her loved one and the responsibility of taking care of her children.

She will use this money to buy chicks, feed, drinkers and vaccines. She is confident that this business will succeed because people consume chicken on a daily basis, she has a good knowledge in the rearing of chicks, and she is very popular. With this business activity, the community will benefit from reduced distance to go and buy in the market. Also, farmers will benefit from fowls dropping which serves as manure.

With the profit made from this loan, she will cater for the family and diversify her livestock farming. She prefers GHAPE loan because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and the sociability of members.

loans.use: To buy chicks, feed, drinkers and vaccines

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is from Calape, Bohol. She and her husband have been engaged in fishing business. They have been doing this business for 19 years. They work together to provide the needs of their five children, ages 19, 17, 14, 4 and one year old. Nida is asking for a loan to buy additional fish to sell. In the future, Nida dreams to improve their livelihood for a better means of living.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en: Pilar is from Talibon, Bohol. She is a 28-year-old married woman with an eleven month old baby girl. She helped her husband in their fishing business to support the needs of their family. She is asking a loan of PHP8000 to buy a boat engine so that their boat can fully function. Pilar dreams of expanding their business so she can afford to send her child to school when she grows up. Their income will pay for healthy meals and pay for household expenses.

loans.use: to buy a boat engine.

loans.name: Lisper

texts.en: Lisper is a married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be innovative. She operates a retail business where she sells beauty products. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor transport. She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena is a 47-year-old woman with six children.  Three of them are still attending school and are 18, 16 and 14 years old. To earn a living, Rowena sells snacks to the community of Calape, Bohol.  She has been doing this for three years. She works hard on her own to provide the needs of her children. Thus she is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar and yeast. In the future, Rowena’s greatest dream is to improve her business to have a better means of living.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and yeast

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a married man with one child. He describes himself as dynamic. He operates a retail business where he sells movies. He has been involved in this business for six years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of movies. His business goal is to have a large scale business within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of movies

loans.name: Semora

texts.en: To earn a living, Semora is engaged in a food vending business.  She sells dried fish to the community of Calape, Bohol. She has been doing this for 11 years. Her husband works abroad to give them a better means of living. In the future, she wants to improve their livelihood for sustainability. She has two school aged children who are 11 and 5 years old. They work hard for the children so that they can send them to school. As for now, Semora is asking for a loan to continue running her business. She is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy dried fish

loans.name: Venuscyllene

texts.en: Venuscyllene is from Calape, Bohol. She is married and has three school aged children ages 7, 3 and 5 months old. Her husband works abroad while she is planning to put up a new business like selling foods to the community. Aside from this, she buys and sells shoes and clothes. Thus she is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar and yeast. She also buys shoes, pants, shirts, and dresses to sell. Venuscyllene dreams to improve their livelihood for sustainability in the future.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and yeast

loans.name: Newton

texts.en: Newton is a married man with one child. He operates a retail business where he sells chicken. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His primary customers are hotels. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of chicken. He hopes that in the future he will be successful. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of chicken

loans.name: Isobel Sirri

texts.en:
Isobel is a widow with six children. They all live in a seven-bedroom house in the northwest region of Cameroon. She has faced so many difficulties in life, which have been sickness, death, accident, and inadequate finances to start up a business for herself. She was motivated by her friends to join GHAPE. She became a member of GHAPE in 2007 and she has taken and repaid EC four times. 

With this new loan, she will buy a shoe stand, shoes and rent a shop. She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has been doing the business for a long time and she treats customers well. With this business activity, the community will buy long-lasting shoes at a moderate price. With the profit made from this loan, she will buy cement, plaster the rooms and rent some out, and she will also take care of her children and plough back some of the profit into her business.

She prefers a GHAPE loan because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and because the members are trained in marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: To buy a shoe stand, shoes and rent a shop

loans.name: El Quds Group

texts.en:
Amal is the featured borrower for El Quds Group. She got along with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Amal is a 43-year-old married mother of four children and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. She started six years ago working in preparing and selling "Mouneh" to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary raw materials (thyme, Sumac, red spices, etc..) to increase her production and satisfy her customers' requests.

Amal is the lady sitting in the middle. With respect to the other group members, Nadia is the first lady on the left, and Nour is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to buy raw materials (thyme, Sumac, red spices, etc..) to increase her production

loans.name: Carla

texts.en:
Carla sells clothes to earn some money. Carla needs a loan to buy more men's and women's clothes for her business. Carla travels a lot with the merchandise and she goes to many places to offer the products; for example she goes to offices to sell her products.

Carla is a divorced mother of 2 kids, pays rent, and she is the only support for her family. She hopes you can help her.

loans.use: to buy more men's and women's clothes for resale.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: Tessie is a 32-year-old woman from Calape, Bohol. She is married and has five school-aged children. The oldest child is 14 years old and the youngest is 4 years old. Her husband is a fisherman, while she is engaged in seashells craft. She is making souvenir items and house decorations from seashells. Tessie is asking for a loan to buy seashells used for crafting. In the future, she wants to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy seashells

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be dynamic. She operates a retail business where she sells bread. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of bread. Her business goal is to be a large scale supplier of bread within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a married woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Las Rosas Y El Clavel Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS ROSAS Y EL CLAVEL” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ximena es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de pan, venta de ropa, venta de verduras, tienda de barrio, venta de artículos de limpieza, venta de leche.
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ximena es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra  Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años, de su mamá, y con el poco ahorro con el que contaba más la ayuda de su mamá y hermana es que ella pudo iniciar este negocio, en la actualidad quien le ayuda en este negocio es su esposo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que brinda la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Las Rosas y El Clavel” will begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Cascada.  It is made up of eight members, and it is directed by a board of directors, of which Ximena is the President.  The businesses which the members of the communal bank carry out are varied; among them are bread sales, clothing sales, vegetable sales, a convenience store, cleaning product sales, and milk sales.

The loan they will take out will benefit the small micro-enterprises of which Ximena is a member.  She says that it’s been a year since she joined Pro Mujer, by the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution.  Currently, she has a clothing sales business.  She observes that she learned this business several years ago from her mother.  With the small savings she had, as well as the help of her mother and her sister, she was able to start this business.  Currently, her husband helps her in this business.

The loan she is taking out now will be used to increase her capital (buying clothing at wholesale), which she will acquire from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz.  Later, she will sell it in her retail space.  This form of working allows her to generate resources to economically support her family, since she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the range of health offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy clothing at wholesale

loans.name: Nanuli

texts.en:
Nanuli is a 46-year-old married woman from Pasanauri borough. She has a son, daughter-in-law, and husband who works at the military service and gets a fixed salary of 400 GEL. Nanuli is a choreographrapher and has private pupils. She gets a small income that is hardly enough to meet even the basic needs of her family. 

Because of this situation, Nanuli decided to be involved in a baking business and open a confectionery locally. She received credit in the framework of the joint initiative of Kiva and the Credo - Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  Nanuli will finish building the confectionery and will purchase all needed tools and merchandise and will start baking various kind of confectionery products that will be sold among local people, and Nanuli will have her own costumers. 

She is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to ensure her family with a good lifestyle. This credit will be a great support for the family. Nanuli is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving her a chance to generate income.

loans.use: To open a confectionery  and get business income

loans.name: Maximiliano

texts.es:
Maximiliano, de 76 años de edad, es un campesino muy trabajador, desde que era un niño ayudaba a sus padres en las labores agrícolas y alimentar las tres vacas que tenían, por esta razón que no pudo ir a la escuela, está casado y tiene 7 hijos, de los cuales solo uno vive en la casa, porque los demás están casados.

Maximiliano, siempre ha trabajado con ganado y sembrando granos básicos.

Maximiliano, necesita el dinero del crédito para pagar mano de obra y comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, pesticidas y herbicidas para sembrar; debido a los problemas del cambio climático, hubo sequía en nuestro país y lastimosamente perdió más de 7,000 metros cuadrados de cultivo.

Su mayor sueño, es volver a sembrar y recuperar lo perdido en la nueva siembra que haga, así como también desea comprar una vaca.
texts.en:
Maximiliano, age 76, is a very hard working farmer.  Since he was young, he helped his parents in agricultural labor and in feeding the three cows that they had.  For this reason, he couldn’t go to school.  He is married and has seven children, out of whom only one lives in his house, because the rest are married.

Maximiliano has always worked with cattle and growing staple grains.

Maximiliano needs the money from the loan to pay for manual labor and buy agricultural supplies such as compost, pesticides, and herbicides, in order to sow crops.  Due to the problems of climate change, there has been a drought in his country, and regrettably, he lost more than 7,000 square meters of crops.

His biggest dream is to sow crops again and regain what he lost in the new sowing he will make.  He also wants to buy a cow.

loans.use: to pay for manual labor and to buy agricultural supplies such as compost, pesticides, and herbicides, in order to sow crops.

loans.name: Estrellas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLAS” iniciará el vigésimo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Leocadia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras. 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Leocadia  es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su hermana hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de mantas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.

En la foto aparecen nueve integrantres ya que tambien aparece la hija de doña Leocadia quien es la señorita que esta con una gorra beige y esta cargado una mochila negra.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Estrellas” will begin its twenty-second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Panamericana.  It is made up of eight members, and it is directed by a board of directors, of which Leocadia is the President.  The businesses which the members of the communal bank carry out are varied; among them are vegetable sales.

The loan which they will take out will benefit the small micro-enterprises of which Leocadia is a member.  She says that it has been four years since she joined Pro Mujer, by invitation from a friend who is a client of the institution.  Currently, she has a blanket sales business.  She observes that she learned this business from her sister several years ago.

The loan she is now taking out will be used to increase her capital (buying blankets at wholesale), which she will acquire from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto.  Later, she will sell them in the fairs in the city of El Alto.  This form of work allows her to generate resources to economically support her family, since she is single and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the range of health and trainings offered by the institution.

Nine members appear in the photo, since Leocadia’s daughter is also shown.  She is the young woman with a beige cap, holding a black backpack.

loans.use: to buy blankets at wholesale.

loans.name: Marvin Kenedy

texts.es:
Marvin, de 31 años de edad, se dedicada a los trabajos agrícolas, específicamente siembra maíz, frijol y café y también hacen actividades de mecánica o de transporte, está acompañado y tiene un hijo, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, ya que su bebe está muy pequeño y eso le dificulta poder salir a trabajar.

Marvin, ha crecido con principios morales y religiosos, actualmente trabaja en el servicio de transporte con una moto-taxi desde hace 3 años, Marvin, para construir su casa y comprar su moto taxi, tuvo que viajar a los Estados Unidos.

El dinero del crédito lo necesita para reparar la moto taxi, porque cada 6 meses le da mantenimiento general, para que su equipo de trabajo le dure más, ya que es de ahí de donde sostiene a la familia.

Él sueña con una familia grande y que sus hijos se gradúen de la universidad y tengan un empleo excelente.
texts.en:
Marvin, who is 31 years old, work in agriculture, specifically, he farms corn, beans, and coffee, and he also works in the mechanic and transport occupations. He has a partner and a son. His wife is in charge of the home, because their baby is very small and this makes it difficult for her to go out to work.
Marvin has been raised with moral and religious principles. He has worked for three years in transport services with a mototaxi (a motorcycle with a cabin to transport people). Marvin had to travel to the United States to build his house and buy his mototaxi.
He needs the loan money to repair the mototaxi because every six months he gives it general maintenance, so that his work equipment can last longer, because it is in that way that he supports his family. 
He dreams of having a big family and that his children graduate from university and have an excellent job.

loans.use: to repair his mototaxi (transport unit).

loans.name: Soledad Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SOLEDAD” iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Vanessa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantillas, venta de mantas de alpaca y vicuña, venta de ropa deportiva, venta de tienda de barrio, venta de juguetes, venta de pan, servicio de construcción de viviendas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Vanessa es integrante, ella indica que hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de pan; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió en un Centro de Apoyo, hace cuatro años, con esta habilidad que aprendió y la necesidad económica en la que atravesaba decidió emprender este negocio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de harina por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal association "Soledad" will begin its eighth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Regional Center. It consists of nine members and is led by a board of directors where Señora Vanessa is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal association run are varied. Among them are: selling shawls, selling alpaca and vicuña blankets, selling sports clothing, neighborhood store, selling toys, selling bread, and home construction service.

The loan that they will take out will benefit these micro-entrepreneurs, of whom Señora Vanessa is one. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer six years ago, entering because of the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. At this time she has a business of making and selling bread. She lets it be known that she learned this business at a support center four years ago. With this skill that she learned and the economic necessity she was going through, she decided to set up this business.

The loan that she will take out now will be to increase her capital to buy flour wholesale, which she will acquire from the wholesale vendors of the city of La Paz, and after making her bread she will sell it at her sales stall. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she is married and has three children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training and the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy flour wholesale

loans.name: Khojalbi

texts.ru: Хочалбиби замужняя женщина из городка Исфара. Ей 45 лет. Она живет вместе с мужем и двумя детьми (дочка и сын). Хочалбиби занимается земледелием. В этом году она посадила кукурузу. Теперь ей надо обработать урожай минеральными удобрениями, чтобы получить качественный урожай. Также она имеет фруктовый сад. Хочалбиби обращается за кредитом, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения для обработки урожая кукурузы и деревьев. Поддержите ее.
texts.en:
Khojalbi is a married woman from the small city Isfara. She is 45 years old. She lives with her husband and two children (a daughter and a son). 

Khojalbi works in agriculture. This year she planted corn. Now she needs to go over the crops with mineral fertilisers, in order to receive a high quality harvest. She also has a fruit garden. 

Khojalbi is applying for a loan in order to buy mineral fertilisers for tending to the corn crops and trees. Please support her!

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilisers.

loans.name: Norma Calex

texts.es:
Norma, de 39 años de edad, está casada, tiene 2 hijas y 2 hijos, de los cuales solo 3 asisten a la escuela, el mayor de sus hijo le ayuda a trabajar a su padre en los trabajos agrícolas.

Norma, se dedicó desde pequeña a trabajar en fincas, pero debido a que ha decaído el cultivo ya no ha podido seguir haciéndolo, es por eso que actualmente se dedica a lavar ropa, barrer, hacer comida o tortillas para sus vecinos, labor por la que le pagan y cubre algunas necesidades de su hogar, mientras que su esposo trabaja como jornalero y cultiva maíz y frijol para su familia.

El dinero del crédito lo necesita para comprar abono y herbicidas para la milpa, con este préstamo se le estará ayudando mucho, porque con los pocos ingresos que tienen como familia, no les alcanza para comprar estos insumos, porque anteriormente debido a la sequía que atraviesa el país, perdieron el primer cultivo.

Ella sueña con mejorar su casa, porque es de bahareque y también desea que sus hijos puedan por lo menos estudiar hasta bachillerato, porque por los ingresos que tienen como familia cree que no podrán hacerlo.
texts.en:
Norma is 39, married and has two girls and two boys, only three of whom are in school. Her oldest son helps his father with the farm work. 

Norma has done farm work since she was a little girl but because of a  decline in production she has not been able to continue. That is why she is currently washing clothes, sweeping, and making meals or tortillas for her neighbors who pay her for her work and so she is able to cover some household expenses.  Her husband works as a day laborer and grows corn and beans for the family.

She needs the loan to buy compost and herbicides for her corn field. By giving her this loan you will be helping her a lot because the small income her family earns isn't enough to buy supplies because they lost their first crop due to the drought throughout the country. 

She dreams of fixing up her house because it is built out of bahareque (a construction material made of sticks mixed with wet earth and straw). She would also like her children to at least get their high school diplomas because with the income her family has now she doesn't think they will be able to.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides for her cornfield.

loans.name: Kyzzhibek

texts.ru: Кызжибек, 26 лет, в разводе, есть ребенок. У Кызжибек среднее образование, она занимается торговлей мыломоющими, косметическими и парфюмерными изделиями. Изначально продавала фрукты и овощи. В обороте есть товар на сумму 250,000 сом (KGS). Кызжибек  обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) с целью развития ее бизнеса, за счет увеличения ассортимента. Доходы от кредита Кызжибек будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и покупку автомобиля.
texts.en:
Kyzzhibek is 26 years old, divorced, and has a child. Kyzzhibek has secondary education. She sells soap and detergent products, cosmetics, and perfumes. Initially, she used to sell fruits and vegetables. She has goods of 250,000 som (KGS) in circulation. 

Kyzzhibek has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) with the aim of developing her business, by increasing the assortment of goods. Kyzzhibek will invest the funds from the loan in the further development of her business, and will also buy a car.

loans.use: to increase turnover in her shop.

loans.name: Kondjiti

texts.fr: Mère de deux enfants, Kondjiti est une femme mariée âgée de 45 ans habitant à Tokoin. Kondjiti est une revendeuse de boissons alcoolisées, vins et fruits qu’elle achète au marché une fois par mois et les revendent dans sa boutique. Kondjiti sollicite ce prêt pour commander des vins et des boissons afin d’étendre son commerce et gagner plus de bénéfices en vue de soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Kondjiti is the mother of two children. She is married, 45 years old, and lives in Tokoin.

Once a month, Kondjiti buys alcoholic beverages, wine, and fruits in the market. She then resells them in her boutique.  

Kondjiti is asking for a loan so that she can order wine and beverages and grow her business. She wants to improve her profits so that she can help her husband with the family’s expenses and provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: buy three boxes of alcoholic beverages and seven boxes of wine.

loans.name: José Gregorio

texts.es: José en su Barbería, mantiene las tradiciones masculinas más antiguas “la afeitada con barbera”, sin embargo este lugar es la mezcla perfecta entre lo moderno y vanguardista,  ofreciendo un completo servicio para que sus clientes mejoren su apariencia.  José se inclinó por esta profesión al aprender de un peluquero conocido, al que recurrían su hermano y él, para que les ofreciera los servicios de peluquería, ellos observaban como realizaba sus trabajos y así aprendió.    Hoy en día cuenta con ocho años de funcionamiento y una clientela fidelizada, a quienes desea ofrecer un lugar más confortable y para ello está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en adecuaciones del local y un teatro en casa.  Con esta inversión José considera que su Barbería será más visitada por clientes y así incrementaran sus utilidades.  Su meta a futuro es que su negocio sea reconocido en Barranquilla, para tener más clientela y en lo personal desea estudiar mecánica automotriz.
texts.en:
José in his barbershop maintains the oldest masculine tradition: "a shave at the barber's." Nevertheless, this place is the perfect mix between the modern and trend setting, offering a complete service so that his customers can improve their appearance. José was inclined toward this profession on learning from a barber he knew, to whom he and his brother went so that he could offer them barber services. They observed how he did his work and thus he learned.

Now he has eight years of working and a loyal clientele, to whom he wants to offer a more comfortable place. To do this, he is applying for his first Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. He will invest the loan in modifications in his shop and a home theater. José considers that with this investment, his barbershop will be visited more by customers and thus his profits will increase. His goal in the future is that his business be recognized in Barranquilla, so that he has more customers, and his personal wish is to study automotive mechanics.

loans.use: to invest in modifications in his shop and a home theater.

loans.name: Zhyldyz

texts.ru: Жылдыз, 40 лет, не замужем. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав в 2000 году благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Жылдыз, на сегодняшний день у нее есть: 5 коров, 5 овец. На участке мерою 1,44 Га она выращивает фасоль для реализации. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет около 25,500 сом (KGS). Все накопленные средства Жылдыз старается вкладывать в развитие бизнеса. Однако, в этом году она решила сделать ремонт и обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) для закупки строительных материалов и проведение ремонтных работ в доме. Жылдыз намерена и дальше улучшать жилищные условия и развивать свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Zhyldyz is 40 years old and unmarried. She has secondary education. She is engaged in animal husbandry in order to bring in income for her family, having started in 2000. Thanks to the Zhyldyz's persistence, dedication to goals, and hard work, today she has five cows and five sheep. On a small land plot of 1.44 hectares, she cultivates beans for sale. Her monthly income from her business is about 25,500 som (KGS). 

Zhyldyz tries to invest all saved funds in the development of her business. However, this year she has decided to carry out renovations. She has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) in order to buy construction materials and carry out renovation works in her home. Zhyldyz intends to further improve her living conditions and develop her business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to repair her house.

loans.name: María Carlos

texts.es:
María, de 59 años de edad, está acompañada, es madre de 9 hijos, estudio hasta segundo grado, no continuo sus estudios debido a la situación económica que vivía su familia, en la casa solamente viven su hija y su compañero de vida.

María, se dedica a la siembra de café, trabajo que ha realizado toda su vida, y también realiza del trabajo de costurera, esta actividad la realiza desde hace más de 10 años, trabajos que aprendió de sus padres y los realiza en compañía de su hija.

El crédito será utilizado para comprar insumos agrícolas para la finca de café y para darle mantenimiento y reparar la máquina de coser ropa.

El sueño de María, es que su hija que vive con ella, se prepare académicamente para que tenga una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is 59 years old and is in a relationship. She is the mother of nine children and went to school until the second grade. She didn't continue with her studies because of her family's economic situation. Only her daughter and her partner live in her home. 

María grows coffee, work that she has done all of her life. She also works as a seamstress, she has been doing this work for more than 10 years. She learned both jobs from her parents and she does her work in the company of her daughter. 

The loan will be used to buy agricultural supplies for the coffee plantation and for the maintenance and repair of her sewing machine. María's dream is that her daughter who lives with her, will go to school so that she can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agriculture supplies.

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es:
Sabino, de 26 años de edad, está acompañada, tiene tres hijos, se dedica a trabajar como empleado en fincas de café por la mañana y por las tardes trabaja en sus propios cultivos.

Sabino, desde la edad de 10 años ya andaba con su papá trabajando en el campo y esto le ha servido porque ahora no teme trabajar todo el día, aunque eso hace que se aleje bastante de su familia, porque solo por la noche los ve; su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y a cuidar de sus hijos.

El dinero del crédito lo necesita para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrado de maíz y de frijol, específicamente comprara abono y fertilizantes para la milpa, porque no cuenta con los recursos económico para comprarlos.

Los sueños de Sabino son, tener una casa grande de bloque y bien amueblada, además  desea que sus hijos puedan ir a la universidad y puedan trabajar de manera diferente.
texts.en:
Sabino, 26 years old, is in a relationship and has three children.  He works as an employee on coffee plantations in the morning and takes care of his own crops in the afternoon.

From age 10, Sabino already went about with his dad working in the fields, and this has helped him since now he is not afraid to work all day, even though this means he must be away from his family.  He only sees them at night; his wife does the necessary work at home and cares for their children.

He needs the money from the loan to grow 7,000 square meters of corn and beans, and specifically, to buy manure and fertilizer for the corn field, because he doesn't have the financial means to buy these.

Sabino's dreams are to have a big, well-furnished cinderblock house; he also wants his children to be able to go to college and work in other ways.

loans.use: to grow 7,000 square meters of corn and beans, and specifically, to buy manure and fertilizers for the corn field

loans.name: Mariama Keba's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été créé le 23 Décembre 2014 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. Le groupe compte des femmes qui en majorité ont acquis de solides expériences dans le petit commerce qui se trouvent être leur activité principale.  Elles habitent toutes le même village, et partagent des valeurs de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles font aussi de la culture sous pluie. 

Madame Mariama Kéba (debout à droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 42 ans et  mère de 09 enfants dont 04 filles et 05 garçons. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des arachides et du mil.  Elle jouit d’une très bonne expérience dans ce domaine.

Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter des arachides d’une valeur de 50000f et du mil d’un montant de 35000f pour le revendre en détails.

Les bénéfices lui permettront de participer activement à la gestion des charges familiales l’habillement et aux soins médicaux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was founded on December 23, 2014 with the inauguration of the banc villageois. The group is comprised of women who have solid small business experience and for whom small business is their main activity. They all live in the same village and share values of solidarity and mutual assistance. They all also do farming during the rainy season.

Madame Mariama Kéba (pictured at right with her hand raised) is the star borrower of the group. She is married, 42 years old, and the mother of nine children (four girls and five boys). 

She buys and sells peanuts and millet and has a lot of experience in this area. Her new loan will allow her to buy 50,000 francs worth of peanuts and 35,000 francs worth of millet to resell at retail prices. 

The income she makes allows her to actively participate in the management of the family expenses and her children’s medical care.

loans.use: buy 50,000 francs worth of peanuts and 35,000 francs worth of millet that she'll sell for retail prices.

loans.name: Flor De Kantuta Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE KANTUTA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sabina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de dulces y frutas, venta de zapatos, venta de tarjetas telefónicas, venta de celulares, venta de condimentos, venta de abarrotes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sabina es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a  Pro Mujer por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de dulces y frutas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace dos años, por iniciativa propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de dulces y frutas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Flower Kantuta" will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the regional office of Collpani. It is comprised of eight members and is headed by a board where Sabina is the president. The businesses that the members of the bank have are varied and among them are the sale of sweets and fruits, shoes, phone cards, cell phones, condiments and groceries. 

The loan that they are requesting will benefit this group of small micro-entrepreneurs where Sabina is a member. Sabina says that she joined Pro Mujer through a large promotion that the institute had in her area. She currently has a business selling sweets and fruits. She disclosed that she learned this business 11 years ago through her own initiative. 

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy sweets and fruits wholesale which she will acquire from wholesalers in the city of El Alto. And she will subsequently sell them in her retail space. This type of work allows her to generate income to economically support her family since she lives with a partner and has two children. When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she says that she likes the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy sweets and fruit wholesale.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells chicken. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be outbreaks of poultry diseases. She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more chicken. Her business goal is to have a large farm within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more chicken.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzviminda is 57 years old and married. She manages and operates a store in a nearby university in Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. Her major customers are the students nearby. She sells various school supplies and groceries. She's making good sales from her business activity, knowing there are many students who buy because of her reasonable product prices. She credits receiving the capital for her business from Paglaum MPC, where she also nurtures her efforts by paying on time without due record of default. Currently, she avails of a loan from the cooperative to purchase inventory for sale, such as school supplies, condiments and other items.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for sale, such as school supplies, condiments and other items.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma, de 40 años de edad, depende de una familia pobre, ha crecido trabajando en fincas de café y en cultivo de maíz y frijol, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a trabajar en fincas de café y a cultivar maíz y frijol y de ahí sostiene la familia; Irma, tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales 4 de ellos asisten a la escuela, y en sus tiempos libres apoyan a la familia en el trabajo agrícola.

Irma, se dedica a lavar ropa y por este trabajo le pagan, pero además trabaja cultivando café y también en ocasiones hace pasteles, tamales y vende frutas.- Estos productos los sale a ofrecerlos a las personas de la comunidad donde vive, caminar alrededor de 6 horas para terminar de vender.

El dinero del crédito lo necesita para instalar el agua potable a su casa, porque por el momento le corresponde halar el agua en cantaros y en la cabeza, para poder lavar sus utensilios en casa; ella decidió solicitar el crédito porque solo cuenta con las mangueras para la instalación del agua, pero tiene que pagar el derecho y las personas que le ayudarán a hacer la instalación y no tiene el dinero suficiente. 

Ella sueña con que sus hijos estudien y tengan mejores oportunidades de trabajo.
texts.en:
Irma is 40 years old and comes from a poor family. She has grown up working in coffee plantations and growing corn and beans. She is in a relationship and her partner works in coffee plantations and growing corn and beans and supports the family with this work. Irma has five children of which four are in school. In her free time she does agricultural work. 

Irma works washing clothes and she is paid for this work. She also works growing coffee and occasionally makes cakes, tamales and sells fruit. She goes out to sell these products in the community where she lives. She walks about six hours to finish selling. 

She needs the money from this loan to install potable water in her home because she currently has to gather water in pitchers and on her head in order to wash her utensils at home. She decided to request the loan because she only has the hoses to install the potable water but she has to pay for the rights and the people to help her with the installation and she doesn't have enough money. Her dreams are that her children will study and have better work opportunities.

loans.use: to install potable water in her home.

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr: Agée de 45 ans, Adjovi est une femme mariée résidant à Baguida avec un enfant à charge. Adjovi achète ses provisions au marché, prépare et vend de la pâte bandée avec du poisson frit et viande  à son domicile. Espérant réaliser une bonne rentabilité, Adjovi sollicite ce prêt pour commander le nécessaire à la préparation de cette nourriture en vue de gagner des bénéfices  afin de venir en aide aux diverses charges quotidiennes éprouvées de la famille.
texts.en:
Adjovi is 45 years old, married, and lives in Baguida with one dependent child.

Adjovi buys her goods at the market. Then she prepares “pâte bandée” with fried fish and meat and sells it out of her home.

With the goal of being profitable, Adjovi is asking for this loan to buy the ingredients needed for this meal. 

She wants to earn profits in order to help with the family’s various daily expenses.

loans.use: buy 35 bowls of corn, 10 dozen fried fish, and 10 kilograms of meat.

loans.name: Margrate

texts.en:
Margrate is married with four children. They live in a four-bedroom house in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced challenges in life, such as the death of her parents and inadequate finances to start up a business of her own. She was motivated by her friends to join GHAPE and she has been a member since 2009. She has successfully taken and repaid a loan once before.

With this new loan she will buy manure, fertilizer, fungicide, herbicide, seeds, corn and yams seedlings, and hire human labor. She is very optimistic that the business will succeed because she has a good business site and the population is increasing every day; as such the demand for food is also increasing. The community will buy at a cheaper rate and she will also employ human labor.

She intends to use the profit to pay for her children’s education, and provide medication for her children. She prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and also the members are trained in marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers, fungicide, herbicides, seeds, corn and yams seedlings, and hire human labor.

loans.name: Salomat

texts.en:
Salomat is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1963. She is living in a small town with her family. She is married and has children. Her husband is a taxi driver. She is well known and a trustee client at IMON. She raised her children and they all now have their own families.

Salomat became old and needs to maintain her health. She is asking for financial support from IMON and KIVA lenders to pay for her general therapy at a hospital. She hopes to be understood and supported.

loans.use: to pay for her general therapy at a hospital.

loans.name: Tancio

texts.en: Tancio is 76 years old and married with 12 adult children. He lives in Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte, where he is a member of Paglaum MPC, Liloy branch. He enjoys the perks of being a member of the cooperative, knowing he can always turn to the cooperative whenever he needs financial assistance. Recently, he took a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy his regular prescriptions.

loans.use: to purchase his regular prescriptions.

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.en: Emiliano is in the process of completing the paperwork at City Hall to be the owner of the house of his parents. He needs a loan to pay for all the paperwork because he needs to legalize a lot of documents and that is something that is expensive. Emiliano is in good health and he needs your help to have a home of his own. You can see Emiliano at his house in the picture.

loans.use: to pay for the paperwork to legalize his home.

loans.name: Milagros2 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MILAGROS2” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Vaneza es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de coca, venta de medicamentos naturales, venta de flores, venta de jugos, venta de comida, venta de colchas.

El crédito que sacarán beneficiará a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Vaneza es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción que realizo la institución en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años de su mamá y a la necesidad que tenía decidió emprender este negocio por la necesidad económica por la que atravesaba. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la frontera Perú - Bolivia y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que brinda la institución.
texts.en:
The group “Milagros2” [“Miracles2”] will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Focal Center of Collpani. The group is composed of nine members and is led by a governing board whose president is Mrs. Vaneza. The businesses of the community association members that are supported are varied: clothing sales, coca leaf sales, natural medicine sales, flower sales, juice sales, food sales and quilt sales. 

The loan will benefit the group of small business entrepreneurs, which includes Mrs. Vaneza. She indicated that this is the first time that she has partnered with Pro Mujer, joining as a result of a promotional invitation about the work the institution does in the area. 

Currently, she has a clothing sales business. She learned the business several years ago from her mother, and she decided to start this business out of economic necessity.

The loan will be used for raising capital through the purchase of wholesale clothing that she will acquire from wholesale vendors on the border of Peru and Bolivia. Later, she will sell it at her clothing stall. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially as she is married and has a son.  

When asked why she likes Pro Mujer, Mrs. Vaneza replied that she likes the training provided by the institution.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Luka

texts.en: Luka is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be outgoing. He operates a tailoring business where he makes clothes. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His primary customers are locals. He will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock for his tailoring business. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business.

loans.use: buy more stock for his tailoring business.

loans.name: Arvin

texts.en: Arvin is 40 years old, single and lives in Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. He has owned and operated a bicycle & motor parts business for almost 12 years, and it gives him an approximate income of PHP 10,000.00 per month. He's doing well with his business and has local customers. He is grateful for his good sales because he can sustain the needs of his parents. Recently, he avails of a loan of PHP 30,000.00 to purchase spare parts for his motor parts business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Anthony Mbang

texts.en:
Loan Amount: 100,000 FRS
Loan use: CARPENTRY AND LIVESTOCK BUSINESS

Anthony is married and a father of three children. They all live in a three-bedroom house in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. He has faced so many difficulties in life, which have included the sickness and death of loved ones, blackmailing, matrimonial disagreements, and inadequate finances to start up a business of his own and cater to his family's needs.

With this new loan requested he will buy planks, nails, chair material, chicks, and extend his workshop. He is confident that this business will succeed because he has been a carpenter for quite a long time and he has many steady customers. He also has experience in rearing chicks and has many customers to whom he supplies these chicks. With this business activity, the community will benefit from his moderate selling and the distance to buy chicks from the market will be reduced. He will also produce long-lasting furniture to the public.

loans.use: to buy planks, nails, chair material, chicks, and extend his workshop.

loans.name: Verginis

texts.en:
Verginis is married with four children. They all live in a four-bedroom house in the North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many difficulties in life, which have included sickness, death, and inadequate finances to start up a business of her own and cater to her family's needs. She was motivated by her friends to join GHAPE; she became a member of GHAPE in 2014 and she has taken and repaid loans twice.

With this new loan request she will buy beans, flour, cocoyams, rice, plantains, chicks, palm wine, and beer of distinct brands. She will also pay rent. She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has been in the restaurant business for a long time. With this business activity, the community will benefit, she will provide food for the population and the local community at large.

With the profit made from this loan, she is planning to expand her business by buying land on which to operate, rather than renting, and increase its size by buying more food stuffs. She will pay her children's school fees and save some in order to undertake a bigger investment. She prefers a GHAPE loan because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and also the members are trained in marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: to buy beans, flour, cocoyams, rice, plantains, chicks, palm wine and beer of distinct brands, and to pay rent.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha runs a sari-sari store (convenience store) together with her husband. She is 49 years old with one adult-age child. This business venture enable her to provide for her family's needs. She learned about Paglaum MPC and accessed its financial assistance. Recently, she availed of a loan to buy piglets to start up a hog raising business. This other business venture will augment her monthly income.

loans.use: to buy piglets to start up a hog raising business.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona is a 34-year-old single lady who started nine years ago working as a teacher to cover her needs and expenses. She is an independent lady and a hard worker who is truly loved by her students. Despite her limited salary, Ramona is still in love with her job.

Ramona is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to maintain her car, which facilitates her life and makes her transportation to work easier.

Ramona hopes to open her own educational center in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to maintain her car, which makes her transportation to work easier.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is a young market entrepreneur from Melitopol. She is only 21 and married with a son. Irina sells women's footwear at the local marketplace. She rents her vending kiosk. She has been running this business for five years now.

Irina is planning to purchase additional merchandise to sell. She needs an additional 40,000 Grivnyas to buy seasonal female footwear, which is why she is asking for assistance from Kiva. Irina is a workaholic and she is responsible and determined. She is willing to invest much energy and effort in the further growth of her venture and the success of her business.

loans.use: to buy seasonal female footwear

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be God fearing. She operates a retail business where she sells wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, bread, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, bread, sugar, soap and other items. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, bread, sugar, soap and other items.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en: Dioscora is a well-known tailor in the Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte area. She is a widow with five children of adult age. This business gives her an income that provides for her needs and the needs of her other children who are still in college. Her membership with Paglaum MPC helps her financially to sustain her business. This time, she is availing herself of a loan to purchase more cloth, thread and other items for her tailoring business.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth, thread and other items for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Alvayeriz

texts.es:
Albayeris, es una joven mujer de treinta y un años de edad, madre de tres hijos y felizmente casada, con un hombre que la apoya para crecer como comerciante. Ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa usada, su tienda ha crecido notablemente en los últimos meses. Gracias a un primer préstamo de Kiva y MiCrédito, logro captar muchos clientes. 
Como la demanda de productos, con mejor calidad, ha aumentado para Albayeris, ella ha vuelto a recurrir un préstamo de Kiva junto a MiCrédito, con el cual pretende comprar una paca de ropa usada premium, que es lo mejor que hay en ese mercado. En un futuro desea introducir calzado a su tienda, además de hacerle mejoras a su hogar.
texts.en:
Alvayeriz is a 31-year old young woman who has three children and is happily married. Her husband supports her to grow as a saleswoman in her second-hand clothing business. Her store has grown significantly in the past few months thanks to a first loan by Kiva and MiCrédito, which allowed her to attract many clients. 

The demand for higher quality products has increased for Alvayeriz, which is why she has requested a loan to Kiva and MiCrédito to buy premium used clothes, the best product in the market. In the future she would like to sell shoes in the store and to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy a package of premium used clothes.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PRIMAVERA” iniciará el vigésimo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Isidora es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chompas, venta de medias, venta de dulces, venta de CD’s, venta de condimentos, venta de cosméticos, servicio de transporte.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Isidora es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio elaboración y venta de chompas de lana; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años de su vecina, posteriormente ella decide emprender un negocio independiente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de la fábrica de lana en la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y La Paz. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Primavera" group is starting its 22nd cycle at Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Collpani. It has 10 members and is led by a management team where Isidora is the president. The businesses represented are varied: sweaters, tights, candy, CDs, condiments, cosmetics and transportation. 

The loan will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs like Isidora. She has been a member of Pro Mujer for 5 years, after a friend who is client of the institution invited her. She currently makes and sells wool sweaters, a business that she started with her neighbor before working independently. She will use the loan to increase capital (to buy wool in bulk in the factory of El Alto), to produce and to sell in the tradeshows of El Alto and La Paz. Thanks to this she will be able to earn money and support her husband and six children. 

When asked about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the health services that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wool in bulk.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is 59 years old, married and lives in Doña Josefa, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. As a microfinance member of Paglaum MPC, she was given priority in financial services to alleviate her present financial conditions with the necessary financial literacy and other training in which she actively participated. Carmelita has seen the changes in her general living conditions from the moment she signed up for membership with the cooperative. This time, she is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase materials for boat making such as lumber, plywood, bronze nails, sealant, paint, bamboo, a boat engine and fishing nets.

loans.use: to purchase materials for boat making such as lumber, plywood, bronze nails, sealant, paint, bamboo, a boat engine and fishing nets.

location.town: Sindangan - Doña Josefa, Sindangan, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 54 years old, married and lives in Tabon, Jose Dalman, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. As a microfinance member of Paglaum MPC, she was given priority in financial services to alleviate her present financial conditions with the necessary financial literacy and other trainings in which she actively participated. Marilyn has seen the changes in her general living conditions from the moment she signed up for membership with the cooperative. This time, she is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase materials for boat making such as lumber, plywood, bronze nails, sealant, paint, bamboo, a boat engine and fishing nets.

loans.use: to purchase materials for boat making such as lumber, plywood, bronze nails, sealant, paint, bamboo poles and fishing nets

location.town: Sindangan - Tabon, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Nort

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a businesswoman from Tamil, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 44 years old, single and has expertise in selling. She runs a sari-sari store and earns an approximate income that sufficiently supports her family. Lydia is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, soy sauce, vinegar, milk, sugar, coffee and others. Lydia continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, soy sauce, vinegar, milk, sugar, coffee and others.

location.town: SINDANGAN-TAMIL, JOSE DALMAN, ZAMBONGA DEL NORTE

loans.name: Jose Noel

texts.es:
José, de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar y es padre de un hijo de 11 meses de nacido.

José, se dedica a la venta de pan desde hace más de 10 años, este trabajo lo aprendió de un amigo, pero también trabaja en la agricultura, la venta de pan la realiza en la mañana y en la tarde aprovecha el tiempo para trabajar en sus cultivos.

El crédito será utilizado para reparar la motocicleta donde sale a repartir el pan y para comprar reparar su vivienda porque tiene algunos daños.

El sueño de José, es mejorar y ampliar su vivienda, para que su hijo tenga una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
José is 28 years old and studied up until 6th grade. He lives with his partner who does the housework and he is father to an 11-month-old child.

José has been selling bread for over ten years, a job he learnt from a friend. He also works in agriculture. He sells bread in the morning and he uses the free time in the afternoon to tend his crops. 

He will use the loan to repair the motorcycle that he uses to deliver bread and to do some repairs to his house because there are parts that are damaged.

José's dream is to improve and extend his house so that his son has a decent place to live.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle that he uses to deliver bread and to do some repairs to his house.

loans.name: Eden Gladys

texts.en: Eden Gladys had once dreamed of operating a store that sells basic commodities. At the age of 28, she now operates the store she'd dreamed of. She is grateful for the financial assistance from Paglaum MPC to small time borrowers like her. Now that she's married with a child, Eden Gladys works hard for the future of her family. Recently, she availed herself of a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase bags of rice to sell. Eden Gladys wishes for more success in her business so that she can nurture her business and her membership.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice to sell.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe es un agricultor de 60 años de edad, casado con Asunción con quien tienen 2 hijos bajo su cargo. Felipe produce diferentes productos en su finca de café como plátanos y árboles maderables certificados Rainforest y Comercio Justo. Su principal fuente de ingresos financieros es el café. Felipe produce otros productos para subsistir como el maíz y el frijol, pero sólo lo suficiente para alimentar a su familia.
El café es la actividad principal en la región donde vive Felipe y deja buenas ganancias a las familias de sus productores.
Actualmente Felipe quiere ingresar al programa de certificación orgánica lo que le permitirá hacer de su cafetal un cultivo más sostenible y amigable con el ambiente, este programa de certificación orgánica también permitirá a Felipe optar por mejores precios por su café.
Felipe solicita un crédito para iniciar el proceso de conversión a orgánico lo mas antes posible, con las ganancias obtenidas por su café orgánico vendido Felipe espera mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Felipe is a 60-year old farmer who is married to Asunción and has 2 children. Felipe produces several products in his coffee farm, such as bananas and timber-yielding trees certifies Rainforest and Fair Trade. His main income source is coffee, but Felipe produces other products such as corn and beans to feed his family. 

Coffee is the main activity in the region where Felipe lives and provides families with good money. Felipe now wants to be part of an organic certification program, which will allow him to have a more sustainable and environmentally responsible plantation. This program will also allow him to increase prices. 

Felipe is requesting a loan to start his conversion to organic as soon as possible. He expects to improve the life conditions of his family thanks to the income obtained from the organic coffee sales.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers and insecticides, and to set up protection barriers necessary for the change to organic in his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Ada Luz

texts.es:
Ada, de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, no siguió estudiando debido a los bajos recursos económicos, creció trabajando en los oficios de su hogar, ella era la encargada de llevarle la comida a sus hermanos y a su padre al lugar donde trabajaban,  porque eran agricultores; ahora está casada y su pareja trabaja en una moto taxi, prestando servicio de transporte de pasajeros hacia el pueblo cercano.

Ada, tiene 14 años de dedicarse a la costura, elaborando camisas, faldas y pantalones y es de ahí de donde obtiene los ingresos para cubrir algunos gastos de su casa.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar tela, hilo, botones, zipper, broches, para elaborar la ropa.

Ella sueña con aprender a hacer vestidos de novia y de quinceañeras, pues considera que ha de ser satisfactorio ser parte de esas etapas en la vida de una mujer.
texts.en:
Ada, who is 37 years old, studied up to the fifth grade but did not continue studying due to low economic resources. She grew up doing jobs around the home, and she was in charge of taking food to her brothers and her father where they worked, because they were farmers. Now she is married and her partner has a motorcycle taxi, offering transport services towards the nearby town for passengers .
Ada has worked as a seamstress for 14 years, producing shirts, skirts and trousers, and it is from there that she obtains the income to cover some household expenses.
She needs the loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers and clasps to make clothing.
She dreams of learning to make dresses for weddings and quinceañeras (fifteenth birthday parties), because she considers that it has to be fulfilling to be part of those stages in a woman's life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers and clasps to make clothing.

loans.name: Anabel Estefania

texts.es:
Anabel es una joven emprendedora, tiene 21 años, no tiene hijos  y actualmente trabaja atendiendo un local de ropa en la ciudad de Atuntaqui, pero también  se dedica al comercio de chanchos que es una actividad que aprendió de su madre y de su abuela que también se dedican al comercio de chanchos. Vive en casa familiar con sus padres y su hermano menor.
Vive en Andrade Marín, por la zona las personas se dedican a la crianza de animales, a la agricultura y a la confección ya sea maquilando o confeccionando sus propios productos. Cerca de su domicilio se encuentra el Museo fabrica Imbabura, que es muy visitado por turistas locales y nacionales. Andrade Marín pertenece a la ciudad de Antonio Ante que es conocida por las grandes fábricas textiles y por ende los productos textiles que ofrece, y además porque aquí se expende la fritada, un plato típico del lugar.
Su fuente de ingresos principal es el comercio de  chanchos, ella compra los chanchos pequeños los engorda y luego los pone a la venta, en la ferias locales los días martes y sábados. Se dedica a este negocio desde hace 3 años aproximadamente.
Solicita el crédito para invertir en la compra de más chanchos y el arreglo de la chanchera, ya que con el pasar del tiempo estas se han ido deteriorando y necesitan ser arregladas para evitar que en algún momento ser víctimas de un robo. Con el crédito ella espera tener las chancheras más seguras y como incrementara su capital de trabajo tendrá mejores ingresos, para poder apoyar a su madre con los gastos de hogar. Agradece a KIVA por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Anabel is a 21-year old young entrepreneur who does not have children and works as a sales attendant in a clothing store in Atuntaqui. She also sells "chanchos" (pigs), an activity that she learned from her mother and grandmother. She lives with her parents and younger brother in Andrade Marín, an area where people work in animal breeding, farming and dressmaking. The Museum-factory Imbabura is close to her house and is visited by many local and national tourists. Andrade Marín is part of the city Antonio Ante, known for its big textile factories and its clothing products, as well as for its "fritada" (fry-up), a typical dish in the area. 

Her main income source is the sale of "chanchos". She buys small pigs, feeds them and then sales them in local tradeshows on Tuesdays and Saturdays. She has been in this business for 3 years, approximately. She is requesting a loan to buy more "chanchos" and to fix the "chanchera" because it has deteriorated and needs to be repaired to avoid being stolen. Thanks to the loan, she expects to have safer "chancheras" and to increase her income to help her mother with household expenses. She is grateful to Kiva for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy more "chanchos" (pigs) and to fix the "chanchera", so that she can help her mother with household expenses.

loans.name: Aries Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ARIES” iniciará el décimo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Alicia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de cerveza, venta de papas fritas, venta de celulares, venta de verduras, venta de verduras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Alicia es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de unas amigas que son clientas de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años con el apoyo de su mamá. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la confraternidad con sus compañeras de Banca Comunal, el ahorro y la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Aries" communal bank is beginning its second loan cycle through the Alto Lima region office of Pro Mujer. The group has eight members and is run by a board of directors where Alicia is president. The members have various business, including: selling clothes, selling beer, selling chips, selling mobile phones, and selling vegetables.

This loan will benefit small-time entrepreneurs in Alicia's group. She says that she joined Pro Mujer eight years ago following an invitation from a friend who was already a member. Alicia currently has a business selling vegetables. She says that she started this business a few years ago with the support of her mother.

This loan will be used to increase assets by buying vegetables in bulk from wholesalers in El Alto city. Alicia will later sell the vegetables, allowing her to earn an income to support her family financially. Alicia has a partner and three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Alicia responds by saying that she likes the camaraderie between the members of the communal bank, as well as the savings and training offered by the organisation.

loans.use: to buy vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Bharati

texts.en:
Bharati, age thirty-eight, lives with her life companion and their three children, all of whom are in school in a small town of Kandhamal district. She has a bakery shop and her specialty is fruit buns. She has acquired many customers lately, as the bread is made with first-quality ingredients, and she sells it at an affordable price. In addition, she has the best service in the zone. 

Bharati is a very active woman who is always more than willing to devote herself to her work, and she is always thinking of her main objective in life—improvement. That is why she is requesting this loan of 15,000 INR to renovate her toilet which is not in a good condition.She will install a new commode, renovate the roof of her toilet and get it in proper working condition.

loans.use: to install a new commode, renovate the roof of her toilet and get it in proper working condition.

loans.name: Arati

texts.en:
Arati is a 29-year-old woman from a village in Kandhamal district. With her effort and dedication, she was able to open her first business, a sewing workshop, which she runs out of the living room of her home. She learned this trade thanks to her mother's lessons. This way, she has been able to get ahead with her two small children, who were recently abandoned by their father. 

However Arati lacks an appropriate toilet in her house and faces a lot of difficulty to go far to a open field to attend nature's call. Therefore Arati is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR. She will use the loan amount to build a toilet and incorporate steel pipes to facilitate water supply. Ultimately she will be able to protect herself and her children from harmful contagious diseases.

Arati dreams of providing a better life for her children and fulfilling their needs.

loans.use: to build a toilet and incorporate steel pipes.

loans.name: Sathi

texts.en:
