Sathi is 26 years old and lives in a town of Kandhamal district, Odisha, India. She is married and has two children neither of whom are currently in school. 

For the past six years, Sathi has been working hard to manage her catering business, which offers catering services. Her husband helps her in her catering business and they hardly get any savings after meeting all the household expenses. They do not have a toilet in their house and depend upon the open field to attend nature's call.

Sathi is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR to build a toilet and install a commode, shower and other sanitary equipment. This step will enable her to safeguard her family's health and promote hygiene.

Sathi aspires to provide the best education to her children and make them financially independent.

loans.use: to build a toilet and install a commode, shower and other sanitary equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, nails and purlins to repair the roof of his home, which is currently in bad condition.

loans.name: Kuntala

texts.en:
Kuntala is 41-year-old who lives in a village of Kandhamal district, Odisha, India. She is a married woman with three children. Kuntala is a responsible, welcoming and pleasant woman and she is working hard to help her husband with the household expenses. She started her business, which is selling bakery products like cakes, cookies, buns, breads etc., three years ago. Her husband works doing compounding in a veterinary hospital near the village.
  
After meeting all the household expenses and paying for the education of her children, she is hardly able to save any amount in order to build a new toilet. Therefore, Kuntala is asking for a loan amount of 15,000 INR to Kiva's partner People's Forum in order to build a toilet and install steel pipes to facilitate the water supply.

She is eagerly awaiting your help.

loans.use: to build a toilet and install steel pipes to facilitate the water supply.

loans.name: Padmini

texts.en:
Every second brings a fresh beginning. Every hour holds a new promise. Every night, dreams are brought with hope and every day is what a man chooses to make. 

This is what inspires Padmini, 41, a resident of Kandhamal district, who is married and blessed with two children. From nothing, Padmini now owns a grocery store. But before she stood where she is right now, it took her a long road of sweat, tears, pressure, faith and persistence. But ceasing never occurred in Padmini's vocabulary, instead, without hesitation, she chose to continue pressing forward.

Padmini does not have access to a toilet in her home.Therefore,she is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR to build a toilet and install all the necessary sanitary equipment.

She hopes that you will understand her need and will extend your helping hands.

loans.use: to build a toilet and install all the necessary sanitary equipment.

loans.name: Minati

texts.en:
Minati is a wonderful woman from Kandhamal district, Odisha, India. She is 30 years old. Minati is kind, sociable, charming and pleasant. She has two children. Her children are currently pursuing their studies in school. Minati's husband works as a driver on a private school bus. The income of her husband is used to meet the household expenses. 

The locality where Minati lives does not have access to a proper water source and the water supply in that area is very erratic and irregular. As a result, Minati faces a lot of difficulties.

Minati is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR in order to install a water pump and overcome the problems that she faces due to irregular water supply. Minati aspires to start cultivating green vegetables on her own piece of land and make herself financially self-sufficient so she can add to her husband's income.

loans.use: to install a water pump.

loans.name: Carmen Del Rosario

texts.es:
Carmen, es una mujer que se ha ganado su lugar como comerciante, tiene veintidós años de dedicarse a vender comida, ropa y cosméticos, entre otros. Ella es una fiel cliente de los financiamientos de MiCrédito, de hecho ha tenido once préstamos y uno con Kiva. Esta muy agradecida, porque gracias a esto ella logro fortalecer su negocio y verlo hoy en día totalmente exitoso. 
Esta ejemplar mujer, ha vuelto a recurrir a Kiva y MiCrédito, esta vez solicitando un préstamo que le permita comprar mesas y sillas, para mejorar una parte de su negocio, dado que si ofrece a sus clientes comodidad y buena atención, garantiza que regresaran. En un futuro desea poder hacer de su negocio un restaurante que ofrezca desayuno, almuerzos y cenas.
texts.en:
Carmen has earned her living as a trader. For 22 years, she has worked selling meals, clothes, cosmetics, and other products. Carmen is a loyal borrower to MiCrédito, and in fact has taken out eleven loans with the organisation, and one with Kiva. Carmen is very grateful as, thanks to this, she has managed to strengthen her business and see it become a total success.

This exemplary woman has come back to Kiva and MiCrédito, this time to apply for a loan that will allow her to buy chairs and tables. This will improve part of her business as, if she offers her customers comfort and good service, they will come back. In the future, Carmen would like to be able to turn her business into a restaurant offering breakfast, lunch and dinner.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables.

loans.name: Diego Homero

texts.es:
Diego es un   joven ecuatoriano de 28 años de edad, nació en el cantón Latacunga conocida como Pensil de los Andes perteneciente a la República del Ecuador y conocido así ya que sus habitantes,  vive en este mismo sector  en casa de los padres  desde hace varios años, es  soltero, actualmente trabaja como Guía Turístico para algunas empresas de turismo y hoteles , desde hace algún tiempo atrás, pero por la difícil situación económica y por cumplir uno de sueños que es el poder emprender con su propio negocio está solicitando un crédito, el  mimos que será invertido en la creación de un pequeño galpón de pollos, esta actividad la conoce porque su madre también se ha dedicado a lo mismo.
Su familia siempre le apoya en cualquier decisión que  tome. Al ver la situación económica de su hogar  Diego  a más de seguir trabajando se hará cargo de su propio negocio, y luego contará la ayuda de uno de sus hermanos,  por el momento no cuenta con el apoyo de ninguna entidad financiera, vino a Fundacion Alternativa por recomendación de otro cliente.
Además a Diego le gustaría en el futuro comprarse un vehículo que le permita llegar a más clientes que demandan el producto.  Hace llegar un cordial y efusivo  agradecimiento a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal ya que con el dinero que le financiemos podrá cumplir con uno de sus mayores sueños.
texts.en:
Diego is a young Ecuadorian of 28 years old, born in Latacunga Canton, known as "Latacunga Pensil de los Andes", in the Republic of Ecuador. He has been living in the same area, in his parents' house, for some years. He is single and has been working for some time as a tourist guide for some tourism businesses and hotels. However, because of the difficult economic situation, and so that he can fulfil one of his dreams and start his own business, he is requesting a loan to invest in building a small chicken coop, a business he knows as his mother also kept chickens.

His family support him in all of his decisions. Given his household's financial situation, Diego will keep working and will also take care of his own business; soon he will have the help of one of his brothers. At the moment they are not supported by any financial institution; Diego came to Fundación Alternativa through another client's recommendation.

In the future, Diego would also like to buy a vehicule so that he can reach more customers with his product. He would like to offer his warm and sincere thanks to Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador, and to Kiva, for making it possible to develop in his working and personal life; with the money being funded, he will be able to fulfil one of his greatest dreams.

loans.use: to set up a business raising chickens and thereby realise his dreams

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheets, nails, wood and wire in order to improve the roof of her home.

loans.name: Suma Sartawi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SUMA SARTAWI” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lizeth es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de polleras, venta de moldes de sombreros, venta de helados, tienda de barrio, venta de ropa, venta de carne y abarrotes, venta de comida, venta de turriles. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lizeth es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una vecina que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de polleras; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años, y lo aprendió de su mamá. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de polleras por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo venderá en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank, "Suma Sartawi," will begin its first loan cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de German Busch. It is composed of eight members and is lead by a board where Lizeth is the secretary. The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are varied, and between them are: selling skirts, selling hat molds, selling ice creams, a neighborhood store, selling clothing, selling meat and groceries, selling food, and selling barrels. 

The loan that they will get will benefit the small businesses where Lizeth is a member. She says that it is the first time that she has been in Pro Mujer. She joined from an invitation from a neighbor who is a customer of the institution. At the moment, she has a business selling skirts. It's disclosed that she started this business several years ago and she learned it from her mother. 

The loan that she is now taking out is to increase her money by buying skirts at wholesale, which she will get from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto, and later she will sell them in her stall. This form of work allows her to get resources to support her family economically, since she is single. When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy skirts at wholesale.

loans.name: Lilia Noemi

texts.es:
Lilia es una mujer ecuatoriana de 45 años de edad nació en la provincia de Bolívar, cantón Guaranda perteneciente a la república del Ecuador,  vive en la ciudad de Latacunga en un barrio casi céntrico de la ciudad este barrio se llama Gualundún, barrio muy  reconocido por los habitantes, ya que es muy comercial , aquí vive en casa propia junto a su hijo.
Lilia es estilista y tiene su propio gabinete de belleza, esta actividad la ejerce desde hace mas de 1 años, es muy reconocida por su buen trabajo, tiene clientela  fija , su local está ubicado en el centro de la ciudad, está solicitando un crédito para la compra de un sillón de peluquería, mostradores y productos.
Trabaja desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las diez u once de la noche, de lunes a sábado, sus clientes son hombres y mujeres ejecutivos, además trabaja a domicilio, 
Lilia agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida personal y familiar.
texts.en:
Lilia, 45, is from Ecuador, born in Guaranda, province of Bolívar. She now lives in the city of Latacunga, in the well-known commercial neighborhood of Gualundún, close to the city center. She has her own home and lives with her son.

Lilia is a stylist with her own beauty salon located in the center of the city, where she's worked for over a year now. She is recognized for her excellent work and has a loyal customer base of executive men and women. Her work hours are from nine in the morning to ten or eleven at night, Monday to Saturday. She also works on call at her clients' homes.

She is applying for this loan to buy a stylist chair, display cases and beauty products. Lilia is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for making it possible for her to grow both personally and professionally.

loans.use: to purchase a stylist chair, display cases and beauty products. This will support strong growth in her life professionally and personally.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to build a pen for pigs, and to buy feed for the same animals.

loans.name: Ana Alberta

texts.es:
Ana, de 24 años de edad, es una persona muy luchadora, que debido a los escasos recursos económicos solo estudio hasta sexto grado, está casada y solo tiene un hijo.

Ana, desde pequeña se ha dedicado a trabajar haciendo petates, para ayudar con el gasto en su familia, porque su madre se dedicaba a la elaboración de petates también, a ella no le ayuda nadie en la elaboración de los petates y para comprar los materiales camina 20 o 35 minutos para llegar hasta el lugar donde cosechan el tule y desde ese lugar tiene que cargar el material hasta su casa.

Ana, no tiene dinero para comprar el tule, es por eso que está solicitando el crédito para comprar tule y poder elaborar sus petates, con esta ayuda se le está dando la oportunidad que siga con su negocio.

Ella sueña con mejorar su casa, porque se encuentra en mal estado y también sueña con que su hija estudie y sea profesional.
texts.en:
Ana is 24 years old. She is a struggling person who, due to the lack of economic resources, only went to school until the sixth grade. She is married and has only one child. From the time she was young, she has worked making woven mats to help with the expenses in her family because her mother also makes a living making woven mats. Nobody helps her in making the woven mats and to buy the materials she walks 20 to 35 minutes to get to the place where they harvest the wicker and from that place she has to carry the material to her house. 

Ana does not have money to buy the wicker, so she is asking for a loan to buy wicker and be able to make her woven mats. With this help, you are giving her an opportunity to continue with her business. She dreams of improving her house because it is in bad shape, and she also dreams that her daughter goes to school and becomes a professional.

loans.use: to buy wicker.

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres De San Lorenzo Group

texts.es: La señora Catarina de 64 años de edad quien es viuda  y  desde hace más de 6 años se dedica a la elaboración de muñequitos quitapenas las cuales son utilizados para decorar  artesanalmente  portarretratos, libros, llaveros etc. También se dedica a la agricultura cosechando manía y camote ya que donde ella vive es un área donde se cosecha mucho de estos productos, ella actualmente solicita un crédito para invertir una parte en la compra de materiales (esponja, tul, medias, telas, resistol, alambre, tijeras etc.) para trabajar con los muñequitos y otra parte del crédito lo utilizara para mano de obra para cultivar camote ya que es viuda y no cuenta con el apoyo de nadie para preparar la tierra  ella agradece por el apoyo que se le ha brindado ya que ha sido un gran apoyo para ella y solicita que nuevamente la apoyen con  financiar su negocio ya que ha logrado solventar sus gastos económicos y ha podido ahorrar y desea seguirlo haciendo.
texts.en:
Catarina is 64 years old and has been a widow for more than 6 years. She makes a living making worry dolls, which are used to decorate handmade picture frames, books, keychains, etc. She also works in agriculture, growing peanuts and sweet potato because she lives in an area where they grow a lot of these products. 

She is now asking for a loan to invest one part into buying materials (sponge, tulle, socks, fabric, glue, wire, scissors, etc.) to work with the dolls, and another part of the loan will be used for labor to grow sweet potato, since she is a widow and does not have any help from anyone to prepare the land. 

She is thankful for the support that she has been given, as it's been a great help to her. She is asking that you help support her again to finance her business, because she has been able to cover her economic expenses and to save money, and she wants to keep doing that.

loans.use: to buy tools to make worry dolls to sell, and to pay labor for cultivating.

loans.name: Dúo San Pédranas Group

texts.es: Dúo San Pédranas La encargada de este grupo es la señora María Elena quien tiene una tortillería desde hace 1 año y también se dedica a la venta de ropa típica variada como blusas de tela, algunos güipiles y cortes típicos.  Su sueño es seguir creciendo tanto en su tortillería y la venta de ropa,  para así poder ayudar  a sus hijos que están trabajando y  pagando sus estudios al mismo tiempo ya que ella no les puede pagar todo.  Tiene varios pedidos de blusas de tela típica y le hace falta comprar maíz por quintal en la tortillería, pero el dinero que tiene no le alcanza y por eso ella está pidiendo un préstamo para comprar lo que le hace falta.
texts.en:
Dúo San Pédranas 

The one in charge of this group is María Elena. She has had a tortilla business for 1 year. She also sells traditional clothing such as blouses made from traditional fabric, some güipiles and traditional styles. Her dream is to keep growing both in her tortilla and clothes business, so that she can help her children. They are working and paying for their education at the same time, since she can't pay for everything for them. She has several orders for blouses  made from traditional fabric and she needs to buy corn by the quintal for her tortilla business. The money she has isn't enough and that is why she is asking for a loan to buy everything she needs.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell, and corn to makes tortillas to sell.

loans.name: Carmen Alicia

texts.es: Carmen es una ama de casa que inició su negocio de venta de pasabocas, pasteles y hayacas en la terraza de su vivienda, su principal motivación para ésta oportunidad de negocio fue una situación de separación que estaba enfrentando con su compañero sentimental  y para poder tener sus propios ingresos  y velar por el sustento de sus hijos, emprendió el negocio muy comprometida y dedicada.  Con el pasar del tiempo decidió que sería mejor instalarse en un kiosko que se encontraba en una calle principal en donde podría ampliar su línea de productos, allí estuvo instalada un tiempo, pero posteriormente viajo a la ciudad de Bogotá y a su regreso dos años después, volvió a iniciar nuevamente el mismo negocio.  Todos los días a partir de las 5 de la mañana,  Carmen abre las puertas del negocio y ofrece pasabocas de masa de maíz, como arepas de huevo, empanadas, papas rellenas, patacones y también hayacas y pasteles con cerdo y pollo.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar un asador, un freidor y víveres para la preparación de las comidas. Con esta inversión ella considera que mejorarán sus ventas y ampliará su línea de productos. Su meta a futuro es volver a tener un negocio tan prospero como en años anteriores, para así poder cumplir con su meta personal de construir dos apartamentos en su vivienda y arrendarlos.
texts.en: Carmen is a housewife who started her business selling snacks, pastries and hallacas from the terrace of her home. Her main motivation for the business was a situation she was facing with her significant other and in order to have her own income and care for her children. She opened the business and is very committed and dedicated. Over time she decided it would be best to set up a kiosk on a main street where she could expand her product line. She was there for a time, but later she travelled to the city of Bogotá, and when she returned two years later, she started the same business again. Every day, starting at 5 in the morning, Carmen opens the doors of her business and offers snacks made from corn, such as egg arepas, empanadas, stuffed potatoes, patacones as well as hallacas and pork and chicken pastries. Right now, she is applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to buy a grill, a fryer and produce to make the food. With this investment, she thinks she will improve her sales and expand her product line. Her goal in the future is to have a business as prosperous as she had in previous years, so that she can achieve her personal goal of building two apartments in her home and rent them out.

loans.use: to buy a grill, a fryer and produce to make food.

loans.name: Ana Ofelia

texts.es:
Ana, de 64 años de edad, es una persona muy luchadora, debido a los escasos recursos, no asistió a la escuela, pero aprendió a firmar, desde pequeña le ayudaba a sus padres a elaborar petates y les ayudaba en los trabajos agrícolas, en su casa solo vive con su nuera, un hijo y un nieto, porque su hijo mayor emigro a los Estados Unidos hace poco tiempo.

Ana, actualmente se dedica a elaborar petates y para comprar los materiales que necesita tiene camina una hora hasta el lugar donde cosechan el tule y como no tiene ningún medio de transporte, tiene que cargar la materia prima en la cabeza hasta su casa.

Ana, está solicitando un préstamo para comprar tule, porque actualmente no tiene dinero para comprarlo, de esta manera ella podrá continuar con su negocio y su trabajo no se paralizara.

Ella sueña con volver a ver a su hijo que está en Estados Unidos.
texts.en:
Ana is 64 years old. She is a struggling person due to scarce resources. She did not go to school but she learned to weave. From the time she was little, she helped her parents to make woven mats and she helped them with the agricultural jobs. She lives with her daughter-in-law, one son and one grandson, because her older son moved to the United States a while ago. 

Ana currently works making woven mats, and to buy the materials that she needs, she has to walk an hour to get to the place where they harvest the wicker. As she has no mode of transport, she has to carry the material on her head back to her house. Ana is asking for a loan to buy wicker, because she does not have enough money to buy it. This way, she can continue with her business and her work will not stop. She dreams of getting to see her son, who is in the United States, again.

loans.use: to buy wicker.

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es: Rosa de 49 años de edad, vive en casa de su propiedad a lado de su hijo de 22 años de edad quien trabaja en una fábrica de ropa y con los ingresos que obtiene hace una aportación para los gastos del hogar, además por su parte Rosa se  dedica a la venta de productos medicinales de forma ambulante, desde hace varios años por lo que ha logrado crear un buen número de clientes, que prefieren sus productos por ser de buena calidad. Rosa con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para poder invertir en la compra de materiales para construir un cuarto dormitorio y así ampliar su vivienda para poder mejorar de esta manera su condición de vida y la de su hijo. Por lo anterior con el monto solicitado ella piensa comprar: arena, ladrillo, grava, hierro, lámina, etc.
texts.en: Rosa is 49 years old. She lives in a house she owns with her 22 year old son. He works in a clothing factory and with his income he contributes to the household expenses. In addition, on her part, Rosa sells medicinal products as door to door vendor. She has done this for several years and she has been able to create a good number of customers who prefer her products because they are of good quality. Rosa wants to improve her living conditions and she has decided to ask FUSAI for a loan to invest in buying construction materials to build a bedroom and thus add on to her home. This way, she can improve her and her son's living conditions. To do the foregoing, with the amount she has asked for, she plans on buying sand, bricks, gravel, iron, sheeting, etc.

loans.use: to buy sand, bricks, gravel, iron, sheeting, etc. to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Tripura

texts.en:
Tripura is a 39-year-old lady who hails from a small village of Kandhamal district. She has a small and happy family comprised of her husband and two grown-up daughters. Tripura has a ladies novelty corner store and sell different cosmetic items and jewelry in her store. Her husband works as an auto driver in that locality only.

Tripura enjoys a contended life with her family. But unfortunately she lacks a convenient toilet in her home for which she and her daughters have suffered from serious infections many a time.

Therefore she is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR from Kiva's partner, People's Forum, in order to build a toilet and incorporate necessary sanitary fittings into it. This will help her in maintaining health and hygiene and thus promote cleanliness.

loans.use: build a toilet and incorporate necessary sanitary fittings.

loans.name: .umugisha Sub Group A

texts.en:
Pelagie is a group leader; aged 36 years.She is married with 4 children aged between 5 and 10 years. The group is called UMUGISHA means “the blessing” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future. 

She has a shop and has been running in a business for 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to medical insurance.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale.

loans.name: Los Korys Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LOS KORYS” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Dionicia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, servicio de construcción, venta de lentes, venta de carne, venta de gelatina, venta de joyas, venta de papas fritas, venta de helados.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Dionicia es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por una promoción dela la institución en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de carne de res; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia y lo inició con el primer préstamo que saco de la institución.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de carne por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Los Korys loan group will being its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de German Busch. It is made up of eight members and is led by officers of whom Dionicia is the president. The businesses that the members of the loan group carry out are varied and among them are a neighborhood store, construction service, glasses sales, jelly sales, jewelry sales, french fry sales, and ice cream sales. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small business owners of whom Dionicia is one. She says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago, joining through a promotion of the institution in her area. Currently, she has a business selling beef, she explains that she learned this business by her own initiative and she began it with the first loan that get got from the institution.

The loan that she is now getting out is to increase her capital (purchase meat in bulk) which she will get from the wholesalers in the city of El Alto and later will sell in her retail space. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she is married and has four children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training and the health center that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase meat in bulk.

loans.name: Crecer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CRECER” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lucia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cosméticos, venta de ropa, venta de mantas, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, venta de carne, librería. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lucia es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su hermana que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años, con el apoyo de su esposo, ya que la señora aprendió este negocio al trabajar como vendedora. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "CRECER" [engl. to grow] will start its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer [engl. Pro Woman] as part of German Busch's Focal Point. The group consists of eight members and is directed by a board of which Lucia is the president.
 
The businesses run by the communal bank's members are various, for example: cosmetics sales, clothing sales, blanket sales, food sales, neighborhood stores, meat sales, and a library.

The loan they are receiving will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs, where Lucia is a member. She says, she has been a member of Pro Mujer for two years. She joined after being invited by her sister, who is a customer at the institution.

At the moment she runs a business of selling clothing. She started this business several years ago with the help of her husband and because she learned this trade by working as a saleswoman.

The loan she will receive is used to increase the capital (by buying clothing at wholesale). She will purchase from wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto and later sell it in her store. This type of work allows her to generate an income to financially support her family. She lives in cohabitation and has one son.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answer that she likes the health area and the training offered by the institution.

loans.use: to purchase clothing at wholesale.

loans.name: Yulduzhon

texts.en:
Yulduzhon is a hardworking woman who was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1990. She is living in rural small town with her family. She is married and has one child. She keeps house, takes care of her child and also looks after livestock. Her husband is working in Russia. Beside money transactions from his husband she has not additional income.

She only has her livestock with which she tries to do business and feed her family. She appealed to IMON asking financial support to buy calves and do business. She awaits Kiva lenders support and kindness.

loans.use: to buy calves and do business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chickens, concentrated feed and vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Bahovaddin

texts.en:
Bahovaddin is an active man. He was born in northern part of Tajikistan in the family of workers and is living and studying in small city. He had a dream to be a doctor someday. He studied with excellence at school and after graduation at 2014, he passed the exams at medical university at the capital of a country. 

He achieved his dream and recently started his studies with pleasure. He is happy to be a student at the medical university. 

He studies a specialty of pediatrician. He wants to be a children’s doctor and help his community. He likes children and taking care of them. He has appealed to IMON asking financial support to pay his tuition fee of studies. 

He awaits compassion and support of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee at Medical School to become a doctor with a speciality in Pediatrics

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan, a 57 years old Palestinian Refugee, and a married father of two children, who has been living and working inside the Palestinian Refugees camp since he was born.
Adnan has a wholesale clothes selling shop since 1991, he managed to develop his business in a very good way. 

He is working hard to move his house outside the camp, for this reason he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for his house's necessary legal documents to continue building it outside the Palestinian Refugees Camp.

Adnan is an ambitious man who is always working hard for developing his family's living.

loans.use: To pay for his house's necessary legal documents to continue building it outside the Palestinian Refugees Camp

loans.name: Rosina

texts.en:
Rosina is 58 years old. She is married and has 3 children to support. She  has been practicing tea farming for the last 7 years and she has been earning an income of KES10,000 per month. 

She has applied for  her first loan from KES25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase more firm input such as chemicals for spraying and fertilizers for better yields and the surplus to buy a dairy cow. 

She plans to use the anticipated loan to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase more firm input such as chemicals for spraying and fertilizers for better yields and the surplus to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is 45 years old. He is married and he has six children. He sells raw milk from his farm and also buying from other farmers. He has been in business for 11 years.

This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to increase his milk stock to bring more profit. He will use profits from the business to expand the business and service the loan.

loans.use: to purchase and increase his milk stock to bring more profit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more inputs such as chemicals for spraying and fertilizers for better yields and the surplus to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Arqilina

texts.en:
Arquilina, 64 years old, lives in Gusa, Calatunan, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte with her husband and two children. Her husband is a construction worker. Unable to sustain the needs of the family with only her husband’s income, she has found ways to attain income through snack & food vending. It began with selling a small amount of viand & snacks to their neighbors.

She joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari (small grocery) store in January of 2004. She became a microfinance member, which is why she has received loans several times already.

Now she applies for 6,000PHP to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store.

She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Luisa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Luisa, es una mujer trabajadora y esforzada, sus ansias por emprender un negocio la llevaron a abrir una comideria y pulperia en su casa de habitación, ella tiene experiencias con financiamientos, empezó a trabajar con créditos grupales, hasta que logro independizarse, su familia es su principal motor de energía, por la cual ella intenta ser mejor.
En estos momentos, Luisa, solo cuenta con su comideria, la pulpería tuvo que cerrarla, porque le es más fácil dedicarse a una sola cosa. Ella ha solicitado un préstamo de Kiva y MiCrédito, para comprar una cocina industrial, sartenes de acero, entre otros utensilios de cocina. En un futuro desea que su comideria se haya convertido en un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
Luisa is an energetic, hardworking woman. Her strong desire to start a business led her to open an eatery and small grocery store in her own home. She knows about loans, she began her work assisted by group loans until she was able to continue independently. Her family is her greatest source of energy and the reason to keep improving herself.

These days, Luisa keeps only the eatery going, she had to close down the grocery store because she found it easier to dedicate herself to just one thing. She is applying for this loan through Kiva and MiCrédito to buy a commercial stove, steel pans, and other kitchen utensils. In the future, she would like to see her eatery turned into a big restaurant.

loans.use: to buy a commercial stove, steel pans, and other kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima  is married with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a cashew nuts business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  
With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase ten sacks of cashew nuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase ten sacks of cashew nuts

loans.name: Emilio

texts.en:
Emilio is a married man with 2 children. He describes himself to be innovative. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, soap, cooking oil , cereals and other items. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

He will use the Kes 70,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, cereals, flour and other items. His business goal is to be the main supplier of household products within 5 years. 

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, cereals, flour and other items

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman is very hopeful that this Kiva partnership will be profitable for his farming. As in the village Tsovagyugh of Gegharkunik region both he lives with his family and runs farming and agriculture. In the farm Arman has cows, bull, pigs, piglets and chickens. From his farm he produces milk, meat, cheese and eggs as well as his land’s harvest (potato, tomato, cucumber, garlic, onion, radish and greens) which  Arman sells at the city’s wholesale market to his regular customers. Arman is married and he has two school-aged children.  

This loan of 700.000 Armenian drams he asks for the purchase of a piglet and also fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: for the purchase of a piglet and also fodder for all his farm cattle

loans.name: Binodini

texts.en:
Binodini is 23 years old. She lives with her partner and they have a 2-year-old son. She works as a farmer.

She is a good mother, reliable, independent, patient, helpful, a fighter, responsible and a very hardworking woman. She hails from a small village of Kandhamal district. Binodini is fully aware of the fact that using a degraded double-pit latrine has risks of potential adverse effects on the health of her family members, her community and environmental contamination. However, she has not yet been able to construct a septic tank latrine due to a shortage of funds.

Therefore, she is asking for a loan of 15,000 INR to build a sanitary toilet that will improve the quality of life for all of her family members and help the community avoid diseases and infections commonly associated with unsanitary toilets. She is in dire need of your help.

loans.use: to build a sanitary toilet.

loans.name: Sarojini

texts.en:
Sarojini is 30 years old. She is married and is a mother of one daughter. She has worked in agriculture, raising poultry, for more than 10 years. Sarojini lives in  Kandhamal district, a rural area in the state of Odisha, India. Her family is a low-income household in the village (moreover, the market need is low in this region).

One of the most critical challenges that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 INR to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet. This will prevent her from getting contaminated by harmful infectious diseases and will safeguard the health of her family.

Sarojini dreams of her only daughter marrying into a rich, well-settled house in a pompous manner.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Sry's Group

texts.en:
Aged 44, Sry is a farmer and a married father of three dependent children, two of whom are in school and the other one is helping with family’s business. He earns a living for his family via growing rice in Kampong Cham province. His wife help supplement family’s income via vending grocery items in their community. They have been involved in these businesses for 26 years. The decline in price of rice crops has been the main challenge for the business, which it has earned him only about 27,300KHR per day. 

Sry is now leading a group which consists of two members to take out a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which was helpful and enabled him to achieve his dream of upgrade the standard of living for the family, was fully paid back. As the group leader, Sry will spend his loan on paying for plowing fee and buying rice seeds for the farmland. He hopes to earn more income to improve his family’s living condition.

loans.use: To spend his loan on paying for plowing fee and buying rice seeds for the farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Mab's Group

texts.en:
Mab, 23, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of a small child. To earn family’s income, she grows rice as the main source of her family’s income. Selling grocery item is an additional source of income for her as well. She has been involved with her current business for several years. She is able to earn about 26,000KHR per day.

 Due to a lack of funds, she is now leading a small group to apply for a Kiva loan via VisionFund. This is the first loan cycle for her group and she is willing to use her loan portion to pay for labor fee and buy fertilizer to grow her crop better. She hopes this loan will help her to earn more income through the high yield of the crop.

loans.use: to pay for labor fee and buy fertilizer to grow her crop better

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Nayan

texts.en:
Nayan, 38 years old, is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband and three children in a small house and without a hygienic latrine in a small village of Kandhamal district. 

Her family’s income comes mainly from small business of a food stall which her husband runs. Her husband is the only breadwinner in her family. 

Unfortunately Nayan lacks an appropriate toilet in her house and they have to go outside for defecation and urination. She has often suffered from infections due to open defecation.

She would like to take a loan of 15,000 INR to build a latrine, which can help her to improve the health of her family members. With support from her husband, she is sure that she will be able to repay the loan in the due course of time.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their families

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Dúo Kairos Group

texts.es:
Dúo Kairos

Juana de 65 años de edad, tiene un negocio de telas y prendas que ella misma confecciona en el mercado de su localidad, ya hace muchos años ella tiene este negocio y ha sido el medio de ingresos que le ha permitido salir adelante. Juana agradece la ayuda que se le ha brindado por medio de FAPE y KIVA por el cual ella solicita un nuevo crédito para la compra de nuevas telas para poder brindarle una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes. El sueño de Juana es poder tener un negocio más grande y poder obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Duo Kairos

Juana, 65 years old, has a business of fabric and clothing, which she makes herself, in the local market. She has had this business for many years now, and it has been the means of income that has allowed her to get ahead. Juana is grateful for the help that has been offered to her through FAPE and Kiva, so she is asking for another loan to purchase new fabrics to be able to offer more product variety to her customers. Juana's dream is to be able to have a larger business and be able to get more income.

loans.use: to purchase fabric to make clothing to sell.

loans.name: Calacoto Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CALACOTO” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Eugenia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de zumo de naranja, venta de frutas, venta de comida, venta de material escolar.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Eugenia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de zumo de naranja; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace dos años por iniciativa propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de naranjas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “CALACOTO” loan group will begin its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de German Busch. It is made up nine members and is led by officers of whom Eugenia is the president. The businesses that the members of the loan group carry out are varied and among them are a neighborhood store, orange juice sales, fruit sales, food sales, and school supply sales. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small business owners of whom Eugenia is one. She says that this is the first time that she has joined Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently she has a business selling orange juice. She explains that she learned this business two years ago at her own initiative.

The loan that she is now getting out is to increase her capital (purchase oranges in bulk), which she will get from the wholesalers in the city of El Alto and later after making it will sell it in her retail space. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family economically, since she is in a common-law marriage and has two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the health center that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase oranges in bulk.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 46 years old with six children. Zenaida personally sells the catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities. Since she became a member of Paglaum MPC, she has been a member in good standing for almost three years.

She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to Php 7,000 for the purchase of new nets.

As much as possible, they have to have all the needed fishing accessories to minimize chances of a low or zero catch. She already has floaters to help guard their fish cages. She also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbors so she can sell more fish at the nearby fish market, where they will fetch higher prices.

In the future, she dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales. She wishes to see her children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: to purchase new nets.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda, 48 years old, is married and from Gampis, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is a microfinance member of Paglaum MPC, where she avails the necessary assistance for her own dried- fish processing business. She grabs opportunities as she makes good sales in her business.

Currently, she avails a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase fresh fish for her dried-fish processing business.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish for her dried fish processing business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a businesswoman who earns by retailing various items. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. Victoria wanted to augment her income and venture into building a boarding house since she lives near a school.

Recently she applied for a loan to purchase angle bars, cement, nails and galvanized iron sheets.

She is on her way to completing her boarding house.

loans.use: to purchase angle bars, cement, nails and galvanized iron sheets.

location.town: Sindangan - Dapaon, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is a strong willed woman who will do anything for her family. She is 62 years old, married and lives in Piao, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She operates a hog raising business which is primarily financed by Paglaum MPC and gives her a quarterly income of approximately PHP 10,000 that sufficiently provides for the needs of her family.

Recently she avails another loan of PHP 14,000 to buy heads of piglets & purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.use: to buy heads of piglets & purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.name: Las Alteñitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS ALTEÑITAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Olga es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de calzados para cholitas, venta de salchipapas, venta de ropa, salón de belleza, venta de frazadas, venta de verduras, venta de frutas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Olga es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez  que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de calzados para cholitas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace 10 años al apoyar en el negocio familiar de su hermana, posteriormente decide implementar un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de calzados por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “LAS ALTEÑITAS” loan group will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de German Busch. It is made up of eight members and is led by officers, of whom Olga is the president. The businesses that the members of the loan group carry out are varied and among them are a neighborhood store, shoe sales for women who dress traditionally, sausage and french fry sales, clothing sales, a beauty salon, blanket sales and vegetable sales. 

The loan that they will now get out will benefit the small business owners of whom Olga is one. She says that this is the first time that she has joined Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a massive promotion that the institution did in her area. Currently, she has a business selling shoes for women who dress traditionally. She explains that she learned this business 10 years ago to support her sister's family business. Later, she decided to establish an independent business.

The loan that she is now getting will be to increase her capital (purchase shoes in bulk), which she will get from the wholesalers in the city of La Paz and later will sell in her retail space. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically since she is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the health center that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase shoes in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in the genge store.

loans.name: Qorichuspa Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QORICHUSPA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. fanny ella es soltera y tiene 41 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de farmacia, la socia vende medicamentos, la socia trabaja en su farmacia desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 3:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de farmacia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar medicamentos para la farmacia.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de farmacia, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de librería.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The partners belong to the communal bank "Qorichuspa". This bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

Ms. Fanny is single and is 41 years old with 2 children. She works in her pharmacy business where she sells medicines. She works in her pharmacy from 8:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m. Through this business she wants to succeed and is doing very well. Her dreams is to expand her pharmacy business. She is requesting a loan to buy medicines for the pharmacy.

The other partners make a living in the pharmacy business, selling clothing, business, grocery store and library businesses.

She is thankful to those who from part of this dream through this medium and agrees to comply with the payment of her dues in the established term.

loans.use: to purchase medicine for the pharmacy.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is driven by passion in selling. At the age of 69, a widow in Bantayan, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, she runs a store that primarily supports her family. She never get tired of tending her store.

Estrella is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations, without records of default.

She has borrowed another loan to purchase maintenance medicines & vitamins. Having enough medicines & vitamins will make her more lively in tending her business.

loans.use: to purchase maintenance medicines & vitamins

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a widow from Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte where she does tailoring services. She is an active member of Paglaum MPC where she nurtures her membership with no records of default payments.

She applies a loan of PHP 14,900 to pay for her son's wedding.

Rosalinda is grateful to the cooperative because she's supported with her financial needs.

loans.use: to pay for her son's wedding.

location.town: Sindangan-Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Wencilyn

texts.en:
Wencilyn is 23 years old. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers.

She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails and sticks.

She hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for, when all the financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is from Gusa, Calatunan, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 40 years of age. She and her partner have three school-age kids. She joined Paglaum MPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the said co-op.

With her desire to help the family, she engages in selling fish in different barangays in the municipality of Gusa, Calatunan, Zamboanga del Norte. Their motorcycle was used as her only source of transportation to reach the different barangays and sell fish. Her source of income has existed for eight years now.

In need of additional working capital, she requested financial assistance from Paglaum MPC an amount of Php 10,000.00 to purchase more stock of fish.

Through this, she hopes to increase and/or has more income for she is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. She is also happy she can support the education of her children, which is the main priority of her hardship.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fish for selling.

loans.name: Matea

texts.en:
Matea is a strong-willed woman who will do anything for her family. She is 56 years old, married and lives in Tabon, Jose Dalman, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She operates a hog raising business which is primarily financed by Paglaum MPC; it gives her a quarterly income of approximately PHP 9,000 that sufficiently provides for the needs of her family.

Recently, she availed another loan to purchase bags of animal feed & vitamins.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed & vitamins.

location.town: Sindangan - Tabon, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Nort

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, es una mujer que ama a los animales, tiene vocación para cuidarlos, desde pequeña sus padres le inculcaron amor por el campo. Ella ahora tiene un negocio de cuido y venta de vacas y terneros. Gracias a un primer préstamo de Kiva junto a MiCrédito ella logro comprar terneros de raza especializada en producción de leche. Lo que hizo que se capitalizara y su negocio creciera. 
Dado que su negocio, fue tan bien, ha vuelto a recurrir un préstamo de Kiva y MiCrédito, para invertirlo en la compra de novillos de raza reproductora, los cuales engordara y luego revenderlos en un mejor precio. En un futuro desea ser dueña de su propia granja y poner criaderos de animales como gallinas, cerdos y conejos.
texts.en:
María is a woman who loves animals. She has a vocation to care for them, when she was young her parents instilled her the love for the countryside. Now she has a business raising and selling cows and calves. Thanks to her first loan from Kiva with MiCrédito, she managed to purchase calves of a specialized breed for milk production, which made her capitalize her business and it grew. 

Since her business went so well, she has come back to get a loan from Kiva and MiCrédito to invest it in the purchase of heifers of breeding stock, which she will fatten and later resell at a better price. In the future, she wants to be the owner of her own farm and to be able to establish breeding centers for animals like hens, pigs, and rabbits.

loans.use: to purchase a heifer of breeding stock.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is 28 years old, married with 4 children. She has a hotel and the business has been profitable. She will be using the loan to purchase bar furniture such as chairs and tables as well as utensils and hopes this will enable her to serve more customers and make more income to help her grow the business. Her hopes and dreams for the future are expand her bar business and be successful.

loans.use: To purchase bar furniture and hopes this will enable her to serve more customers and make more income to help her grow the business.

loans.name: Milton Eliezer

texts.es:
Milton es un joven de treinta años de edad, muy apasionado y trabajador, día a día pone todo su esfuerzo en su labor para sacar adelante a su familia, desde hace un par de años él trabaja en el negocio de venta de piedras canteras a grandes construcciones. Gracias a un primer préstamo de Kiva y MiCrédito, logro comprar un camión de bloques, los cuales revendió a buen precio. 
Como su negocio es de continuo movimiento, Milton, siempre utiliza el gran apoyo de financiamientos, por esto él ha solicitado otro préstamo de Kiva junto a MiCrédito, con el cual podra comprar una buena cantidad de piedras canteras, bloques, entre otras cosas que son su materia prima. El en un futuro pretende comprar más camiones para poder distribuir más su producto.
texts.en:
Milton is a young man, thirty years old, who is very passionate and hard-working. Day by day, he puts all his efforts into his work to get his family ahead. For the past few years, he has worked in the business selling quarry stone to big construction projects. Thanks to his first loan from Kiva and MiCrédito, he managed to purchase a truckload of concrete blocks which he resold at a good price.

As his business is in constant flux, Milton always uses the great help of loans, so he has asked for another loan from Kiva with MiCrédito, with which he will be able to purchase a good quantity of quarry stone, concrete blocks, and other things that are his raw materials. In the future, he plans to purchase more trucks to distribute his products more.

loans.use: to purchase a good quantity of quarry stone, concrete blocks, and more.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina, de 66 años de edad, es una persona muy luchadora y emprendedora, desde muy pequeña apoyo a sus padres en la agricultura y fue por motivos de escasos recursos económicos que no ingreso a la escuela, actualmente está acompañada y su pareja se dedica al trabajo jornal y a sembrar granos básicos, juntos tuvieron 2 hijos, el mayor tuvo que emigrar a otro país por la falta de trabajo y su hija está acompañada.

Catalina, se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa, la idea de dedicarse a este negocio fue para generar otros ingresos para cubrir sus necesidades, tiene más de 2 años de dedicarse a este comercio.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar más ropa para vender y poder comprar por mayoreo, para no estar viajando tanto para abastecerse.

Ella sueña con tener su negocio más surtido y no tener que andar vendiendo de manera ambulante.
texts.en:
Cataline is 66 years old and is a fighting and entrepreneurial woman. Since she was young she supported her parents in agriculture and it was for reasons of low income that she did not go to school. She is now accompanied by her parents who makes a living in wage labor and planting basic grains. Together they had two children, the oldest has to immigrate to another country for lack of work and their daughter is married.

Catalina makes a living in the purchase and sale of clothing. The idea to dedicate herself to this business was to generate other income to cover their necessities. She has more than two years working in this trade.

She needs a loan to buy more clothing to sell and be able to purchase wholesale, and not travel as much to stock.

Her dream is to have more variety in her business and not have to walk as a street vender to sell her clothing.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell and be able to purchase wholesale.

loans.name: Nim's Group

texts.en:
Nim, 37, is a local farmer living in remote area of Kampong Cham province and a mother of two dependent children, one of whom is in school while another one is working for others for a fee to supplement family’s income. The main income of Nim’s family is from rice growing, which she has been involved in for years. The rice farm has been growing slowly and produced low outputs. 

This is the third time for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and the past loans were completely paid back. Based on the previous loan, Nim has improved her family’s living condition. Leading a group of four members, Nim will use her entire loan portion to pay for the plowing fee and buying organic fertilizers to support the rice farming business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase more income so as to buy household appliances for her family.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing fee and buying organic fertilizers to support the rice farming business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Xiomara De La Cocepcion

texts.es:
Xiomara es una mujer luchadora, que junto a su esposo ha sacado a sus dos hijos adelante. Ella desde hace años tiene un pequeño puesto de venta de calzado, ropa y fajas. Ella inicio su negocio con un crédito grupal, luego con ayuda de financiamientos individuales logro hacer florecer su pequeña tienda. 
Ella ha recurrido, a la ayuda de Kiva y MiCredito porque confía en que un préstamo que se le otorgue para introducir a su puesto nueva mercaderia y comprar ropa y jeans de acuerdo a la temporada, la harán crecer como comerciante notablemente. Xiomara sabe lo que sus clientes demandan, se caracteriza por ser muy amistosa y carismática. En un futuro desea poner una tienda más grande en uno de los mercados más importante de su ciudad.
texts.en:
Xiomara is a fighting woman, who together with her husband has had her two children. For years she has had a small stall selling shoes, clothes, and girdles. She began her business with a group loan, and then with individual financial help her small shop was able to succeed and flourish.

She has resorted to the help of Kiva and MiCredito because she relies on a loan that is granted to introduce her new merchandise post and to buy clothing and jeans according to the season and so she will grow significantly as a trader. Xiomara knows what her customers demand, and is known for being very friendly and charismatic. In the future she wants to put a bigger shop in one of the most important markets of her city.

loans.use: to buy clothing and jeans.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina manages her restaurant business in Lawis, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She learned the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage, and it has supported the needs of the family well. 

Regina has local customers and would also accept catering for added income. Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her business. She wants to expand it and would be more happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en:
Paterna is 60 years old. She is known in the Lawis, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte area for her snack vending business. 

She actively participates in the various programs and services that the coop offers. She hopes to live comfortably, in a decent house, for which she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and wood. Paterna hopes to maintain her membership in the coop in good standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given priority, as a micro-finance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for: that her financing needs for her retail business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and wood for her house.

loans.name: Ana Maricela

texts.es:
Ana, de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado,  ella se dedica a los oficios domésticos y pero ha participado en talleres de costuras y de elaboración de productos mini industriales, actualmente está acompañada y en su casa solo vive su hija pequeña y su pareja que es músico.
 
Ana,  está solicitando el crédito para comprar un horno para colocar una pequeña panadería, porque en los talleres aprendió a elaborar algunos tipos de pan.

Su principal sueño es tener un horno y hacer crecer poco apoco su negocio, hasta lograr tener una panadería bien equipada y ser distribuidora de pan en la región.
texts.en:
Ana, 26 years old, went to school up to the ninth grade. She takes care of the domestic tasks but she has taken some courses in sewing and making mini-industrial products. Currently, she is partnered and only her young daughter and her partner, who is a musician, live in her home.

Ana is asking for the loan to purchase an oven to establish a small bakery because in the courses she learned to make some types of bread.

Her primary dream is to have an oven and grow her business little by little until she manages to have a well-equipped bakery and to be a distributor of bread in the region.

loans.use: to purchase an oven to establish a small bakery.

loans.name: Adan Eulises

texts.es:
Adán, de 24 años de edad, está soltero, estudio hasta octavo grado, no pudo continuar estudiando porque su familia no le podía ayudar, estuvo acompañado y es padre de 1 hijo, pero Adán se separó de su compañera de vida, porque ella emigro a otro país y se llevó a su hijo.

Adán, se dedica a la agricultura, pero actualmente trabaja manejando una moto taxi, este trabajo lo aprendió de un amigo y ahora tiene más de un año de dedicarse a esta actividad.

El crédito será utilizado para comprar una motocicleta, la cual utilizara para transportarse a su lugar de trabajo, porque su horario es variado y a veces sale muy noche de trabajar.

El sueño de Adán, es volver a ver nuevamente a su hijo y a su pareja, porque él está trabajando para poder apoyar a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Adán, 24 years old, is single, went to school up to the eighth grade, and couldn't continue his education because his family couldn't help him. He was partnered and is the father of 1 child, but Adán separated from his life partner because she emigrated to another country and took their child. 

Adán works in agriculture but currently he works driving a motorcycle taxi. He learned this work from a friend and now has been working in this job for over a year.

The loan will be used to purchase a motorcycle which he will use to get to his work site because his schedule varies and sometimes he leaves very late at night from his work.

Adán's dream is to be able to see his child and partner again because he is working to be able to support his young son.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Amelita was able to turn the tide in her favor and is now making good sales. 

She wants to take advantage of her good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
Charlita is an active member of Paglaum MPC who enjoys all the perks of a member. She is 56 years old and married with adult-aged children. Charlita is busy running her fishing operations and tilling their own land. Both business ventures were supported by the coop. 

She said she is secure financially, knowing she can always turn to the cooperative, but she also wants to be prepared for unexpected life events. So she purchased life insurance through the coop. Now that her one-year policy is expiring, she wants to borrow to buy a life insurance renewal for the family. Charlita believes that it is better to be prepared than to be held by the neck by unexpected events.

loans.use: to pay for life insurance renewal for her family.

location.town: Sindangan -  Motibot, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa has been a microfinance member of Paglaum MPC for almost ten years. She and her husband have been tilling their own land for farming that mostly provides for the needs of her family. 

Elsa found out that their income from farming is insufficient for the family needs, especially when their eldest child enters college. As a hardworking farmer, she had also worked to repay her loans from the cooperative. One time, she decided to expand her farm and asked for financial support from Paglaum MPC. Elsa is grateful that the trust the coop extended to her enabled her to buy the neighboring parcel of land. 

She successfully repaid the loan and this season, she asked for another loan to augment her production. The amount of PHP 10,000 is intended to purchase bags of fertilizer and bottles of insecticide. Elsa is hopeful that she can have a good harvest this season so that she can repay the loan ahead of schedule.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer and bottles of insecticide.

location.town: Sindangan - Doña Josefa, Sindangan, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Lilay

texts.en:
Lilay is a fishing operator at Delusom, Leon B. Postigo, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is supported by her fisherman husband as one of her fishing boat operators. Through this business, she able to feed and send her children to school. 

But Lilay is discontented with her meager income and wishes to have more fishing boats. Upon learning the financial services Paglaum MPC extended to members, Lilay sign up for membership. Her previous loans from the cooperative enabled her to purchase two additional fishing boats. 

Recently, she took another loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fishing nets for the business. She believes that replacing the old fishing nets with new ones will give her a good catch and thus continuously nurture her good membership with Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets for her business.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla operates a fishing business to earn her living. She has been engaged in this business for 12 years. She and her husband work hard to support their family. 

She requested a loan in the amount of PhP 23,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing netting and gasoline for her boat.

In the future, Perla would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish netting and gasoline for her boat

loans.name: Rosa Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam es una mujer honesta, madre de tres jóvenes y esposa comprometida por su hogar, su esposo hace cuatro años, le ayudo abrir una pulpería, para que desde su casa de habitación y sin descuidar a la familia, generara un ingreso que aliviara la economía que tenían, poco a poco su negocio ha ido creciendo y ella también como comerciante. 
En estos momentos, ella,  necesita surtir su negocio de nuevos productos y marcas, por eso ha recurrido a Kiva y MiCrédito, para que se le otorgue un préstamo que le permita comprar granos basicos, productos de aseo personal entre otros. En un futuro no muy lejano, esta trabajadora mujer pretende hacer de su pulpería una distribuidora importante de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Miriam is an honest woman, the mother of three teenagers and a wife committed to her home. Four years ago, her husband helped her open a general store so, from her home and without neglecting her family, she could generate income to alleviate the economic situation they had. Little by little, her business has been growing and she has, too, as a businesswoman.

Now, she needs to stock her business with new products and brands, so she has come to Kiva and MiCrédito so that they offer her a loan that will allow her to purchase basic grains, personal care products, and more. In the not-so-distant future, this hard-working woman plans to make her store an important distributor in her community.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, personal care products, and more.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Retailing helped Carmelita support her family. She sells charcoal and brings in a meager income of Php 8,500 per month. She has found the business of buying and selling charcoal easy and simple because all she needed to do is to weigh and repack the charcoal for her buyers. 

Carmelita wanted to expand her business. She applied for a loan from PMPC for the needed capital. She wants to purchase more charcoal to resell. Carmelita smiles at seeing all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to resell.

location.town: Sindangan-Talinga, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Anacorita

texts.en:
Anacorita is a businesswoman who makes a living through her farming and gardening activities. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. 

Recently, she applied for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. She is on her way to renovating her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace wants to prepare for the next farming season. She is preparing her farm located at Inuman, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. 

Grace is single and does not have a family to feed, but she wants to be productive and offer jobs to her neighborhood. She expanded her farm and employs more of her unemployed neighbors. 

This was made possible with the financial assistance extended by Paglaum MPC, where she nurtures her membership. Recently, she took a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase bags of fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 49 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lucena is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lucena has been raising pigs for 15 years and earns additional income from fishing.

She works tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky makes and sells candies to earn her living. She has been selling her handmade candies for the past two years, and she works hard to support her family. 

She requested a loan in the amount of PhP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase ingredients for candy-making, such as sugar, milk, and coconuts.

In the future, Vicky and her husband would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send their children to college.
