loans.use: to purchase ingredients for candy-making, such as sugar, milk, and coconuts

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden, age 56 and unmarried, runs a restaurant to earn her living. She earns an additional income by operating a general store. Eden has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. 

She is requesting a new loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 through NWTF in order to purchase ingredients for her restaurant, such as spices, vegetables, meat, and fish.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her restaurant, such as spices, vegetables, meat, and fis

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 38 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

Annabelle has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 19 years and also earns an income from fish vending, pig fattening and motorcycle transportation.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Rog Allah 2 Group

texts.fr: Fatoumata, âgée de 32 ans mariée mère d’un enfant socialisé dont mari garagiste. Elle exerce son activité depuis 7 ans. Ce qui fait marcher son activité ce sont : son emplacement ; l’accueil des clients, le respect et la qualité des marchandises. Elle  veut le prêt pour s’acheter 125 000 des condiments (choux, tomate etc..) l’utilité du prêt c’est de s’approvisionner en quantité et qualité suffisante afin de renforcer son activité. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt 2 fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues.
texts.en:
Fatoumata, age 32, is the married mother of one child who is socialized. Her husband is a car mechanic. She has been conducting her activity for seven years, and the keys to her success are the location of her business, greeting the customers, respect, and quality merchandise. 

She is seeking this loan to purchase 125, 000F worth of vegetables (cabbage, tomatoes, etc.). This credit will allow her to buy large quantities of good quality merchandise, which will help to strengthen her activity. 

Fatoumata previously received two loans that she repaid in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase 125, 000F worth of vegetables (cabbage, tomatoes, etc.).

loans.name: Luis Hernando

texts.es:
Luis Hernando es un hombre trabajador, humilde, servicial que tiene una legumbrera hace ya un par de años, comenzó su negocio buscando una alternativa para generar ingresos  para su sostenimiento, puesto que por su avanzada edad es difícil emplearse.

Se separó de su esposa con la cual tuvo 4 hijos, siempre que puede los ayuda con lo que necesitan.

El sueño que Luis Hernando ha perseguido toda su vida es comprar una vivienda propia y se reúsa a renunciar a este, por ello pone todo su empeño y ganas en crecer su negocio.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de vegetales y frutas para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Luis Hernando is a hard-working, humble and helpful man who has had a green grocery for a few years. He began his business looking for an alternative to generate income to sustain himself because at his age it is difficult to find a job. 

He separated from his wife, with whom he had 4 children, and whenever he can, he helps them with what they need.

The dream that Luis Hernando has chased his whole life is to purchase his own house and he refuses to give this up, so he puts all his determination and desire in growing his business. 

He asks for a loan to purchase an assortment of fruits and vegetables to stock his business.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of fruits and vegetables to stock his business.

loans.name: Nelson Antonio

texts.es:
Nelson, es padre de dos hijos, tiene bajo responsabilidad a cuatro personas, se dedica a trabajar en la crianza de ganado y brinda el servicio de transporte de carga en su camión, desarrolla estas actividades desde hace 6 años, de esta manera puede ir generando los recursos necesarios para que en su hogar existan menos carencias.
El capital le servirá para pagar el mantenimiento del camión y para comprar ganado, le permitirá tener en óptimas condiciones su equipo de trabajo y  seguir teniendo su fuente de ingresos en el mercado.
Sus aspiraciones son ir cancelando con puntualidad sus cuotas, aumentar su venta de ganado, mejorar su vehículo y darle el sustento diario de cada día a su familia.
texts.en:
Nelson is the father of two children; he has four people in his responsibility. He works raising livestock and offering hauling services in his truck. He has done these jobs for the past 6 years, and in this way he can generate the necessary resources so that his household lacks fewer things.

The capital will serve to pay for the maintenance of his truck and to purchase livestock, it will allow him to have his work equipment in optimal condition and continue having his source of income in the market.

His aspirations are to pay off his debt punctually, increase his livestock sale, improve his vehicle, and give his family their daily sustenance.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance on his truck and purchase livestock, which will allow him to have his work equipment in optimal condition and continue having his source of income in the market.

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita is a strong-willed woman who will do anything for her family. She is 66 years old, married and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. 

Marianita operates a hog-raising business which is primarily financed by Paglaum MPC. Her business provides a quarterly income of approximately PHP 15,000 that sufficiently provides for the needs of her family. Recently, she asked for another loan to purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.name: Celeste

texts.en:
In 2009, Celeste signed up for membership with Paglaum MPC and accessed all services offered by the cooperative. Celeste is 48 years old, and married with two adult-aged children. 

She operates a banana plantation where they live. She personally supervises the farming processes from land preparation, planting, and harvesting to even packing bananas for export. 

She uses the income from this business to support her family's needs and the needs of her two children who are now attending college. Recently, she took a loan from Paglaum MPC in an amount of PHP 14,900 to purchase bags of fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 38 years old, and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She is in the agricultural business of fattening pigs in the Philippines. 

Sarah requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase sacks of rice bran and feed. Sarah has been pig fattening for three years, and has borrowed four times from NWTF in the past to sustain support her business.

In the future, Sarah would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice bran and feed.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene, age 42, runs a general store to earn her living. She has been engaged in this business for four years. In her store, she sells grocery items such as noodles, coffee, eggs, and milk, as well as household products like soap and shampoo. 

She and her husband have two children, one of whom is still in school, and she works very hard to provide for them.

Arlene requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy grocery items and household goods to offer for sale in her store.

Her goal is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and household goods to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 56 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like shampoo, soap, chips, bread, soft drinks and noodles.

Erlinda has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from fishing.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like shampoo, soap, chips, bread, soft drinks and noodles.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia works hard to support her family. Arsenia is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fishing nets and bamboo for her fishing business.

Arsenia has been in this business for 45 years now.

In the future, Arsenia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fishing nets and bamboo for her fishing business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica, age 45, runs a general store to earn an income. In her store, she sells grocery items such as milk, sugar, and coffee, as well as household goods like soap and shampoo. She has been operating her business for 30 years now, and she earns an additional income from food vending. 

She and her husband have two children, and she works hard to provide for her family. 

Veronica has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She requested a new loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy grocery items and household goods to offer for sale in her store.
 
Her goal is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and household goods to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 50 years old, married and works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell.

Rosalinda has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Rosalinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 62 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

Loreta has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Loreta would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es:
María consuelo es una empresaria de 32 años de edad, humilde, carismática, servicial la cual tiene un negocio de venta de helados, con el cual genera el sustento y la calidad de vida para su hogar conformado por sus dos hijos de 15 y 9.

SU profesión la inicio pro gusto y vocación al trabajo independiente, aspira a generar empleo, tener perdurabilidad en el tiempo y conforme va adquiriendo ganancias permitirse comprar una vivienda propia o ir pagándola por cuotas.

María Consuelo busca aumentar sus ventas, una manera que se le ocurrió es tener mayor surtido de productos y preparaciones para ofrecer, pero todo va ligado a su capacidad de almacenamiento de sabores de helado, es por ello que para ampliar su capacidad, solicita un apoyo económico para la compra de una nevera de buena capacidad.

Anímate a participar en el proyecto a largo plazo de la empresaria que busco fortalecer su negocio para comprar en algún día una vivienda propia.
texts.en:
María Consuelo is a 32-year-old entrepreneur, humble, charismatic, and helpful, who has a business selling ice cream, with which she generates the sustenance and quality of life for her household made up of her two children, ages 15 and 9. 

She began her profession for preference and vocation to work independently. She wants to generate jobs, to have durability over time, and as she gets more earnings, to allow herself to purchase her own house or to pay for it in installments. 

María Consuelo seeks to increase her sales, one way that occurred to her is to have a better assortment of products and preparations to offer, but all that is tied to her capacity to store ice cream flavors, so to expand her capacity, she asks for a loan to purchase a freezer with good capacity.

Come on and participate in the long-term project of the businesswoman who seeks to strengthen her business to some day buy her own house.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer with a good capacity.

loans.name: Jhorman Alexis

texts.es:
Jhorman es un joven 24 años de edad que recorre las calles de Medellín vendiendo sus productos fritos, principalmente papas y plátanos, los cuales sirve con salsa o sal y limón y son un rico alimento que puedes disfrutar a cualquier hora del día.

Vive con su pareja, con la cual tiene una pequeña de 8 años de edad, su mayor preocupación es que a su hija no llegue a pasar necesidades, por tal motivo siempre está dispuesto a trabajar largas jornadas laborales para ganar el dinero necesario para el sostenimiento de su familia.

Jhorman en el momento está buscando un apoyo económico que le permita comprar su materia prima al por mayor, buscando reducir sus costos, entre que va a comprar es plátano, papas, salsas, limones, sal, aceite y gas.
texts.en:
Jhorman is a 24-year-old young man who goes through the streets of Medellín selling his fried products, primarily potatoes and plantains, which he serves with sauce, or lemon and salt, and they are a delicious food that one can enjoy at any time of the day. 

He lives with his partner, with whom he has a young daughter, 8 years old, his greatest concern is that his daughter doesn't want for anything. For this reason, he is always ready to work long workdays to earn the money necessary to support his family. 

Jhorman is now seeking a loan which will allow him to purchase his raw materials in bulk, seeking to reduce his costs. Among what he will buy are plantains, potatoes, sauces, lemons, salt, oil and gas.

loans.use: to purchase plantains, potatoes, sauces, lemons, salt, oil, and gas.

loans.name: Kolthoum

texts.en:
Kolthoum is a 50 years old conservative woman, she asked her husband to take her place in the photo.

Kolthoum is a mother of five children and she has always been a housewife, while her husband supports the family.  After getting old, the father decided to open his own business selling fruits and vegetables so that his children can continue doing later.  He started by selling on a small scale and expanded till he opened his own store. Their children are also helping around to give their father some time to rest. 

On the other hand Kolthoum wanted to also help in expanding the store by doing some renovations, so she applied for this loan to do so.

loans.use: to renovate his fruits and vegetables store

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba buys and sells rice to earn her living. She has been engaged in this business for six years, and she earns an additional income from raising pigs. She is a hard-working entrepreneur who has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She is borrowing PhP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional sacks of rice to to offer for sale.

She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to offer for sale

loans.name: Yuliana Andrea

texts.es:
Yuliana es una hermosa adolescente de 21 años de edad la cual ha base de trabajo quiere construir un excelente futuro para sus tres hijos, dos hombres de 4 y 2 años de edad y la princesa con tan solo 7 meses.

Yuliana es madre cabeza de familia, es una persona muy luchadora que con su negocio de venta de calzado genera el sustento de sus tres seres amados, claro ayudado de sus padres que siempre la apoyan.

Su sueño es salir adelante, demostrar lo que vale, tener siempre la fortaleza para desempeñar su papel como padre y madre y en un futuro brindarles educación a sus muchachos y comprar una vivienda propia.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de calzado al por mayor buscando sacar mayor rentabilidad en cada venta realizada.
texts.en:
Yuliana is a lovely 21 year old. Through her work she wants to build an excellent future for her three children. She has two boys, ages four and two. Her princess is only seven month old. Yuliana is the head of her household. She is a very tenacious person. With her business of selling shoes she generates the support for her three loved ones. She does this with help from her parents, who always support her.

Her dream is to get ahead, to prove her worth, to always have the strength to carry out her role as mother and father, to provide her children with an education in the future, and to buy her own house.

She is requesting a loan to buy shoes wholesale. She is looking to get greater profitability with each sale that is made.

loans.use: to buy shoes wholesale; she is looking for greater profitability in each sale that is made.

loans.name: Corazones De Oro Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CORAZONES DE ORO II” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Casada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Wenddy es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de joyas, venta de pan, servicio de transporte,  venta de sombreros, venta de mantas, librería, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Wenddy es integrante, ella que ingreso a Pro Mujer por la invitación de una vecina que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de joyas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace siete años con el apoyo de su papá.

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de perlas de fantasía por mayor) que adquirirá de tiendas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente, a la elaboración de las joyas, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Corazones de Oro II loan group will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Casada. It is made up of eight members and is led by officers of whom Wenddy is the president. The businesses that the members of the loan group carry out are varied and among them are jewelry sales, bread sales, transportation service, hat sales, blanket sales, a book store and a neighborhood store. 

The loan that they will get will benefit the small business owners of whom Wenddy is one. She joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of a neighbor who is a client of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling jewelry. She explains that she learned this business seven years ago with the help of her father.

The loan that she is getting out now will be to increase her capital (to purchase imitation pearls in bulk) which she will get from the stores in the city of La Paz and later, after making the jewelry, will sell them from her retail space. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically since she is single and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the training and the health center that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase imitation pearls in bulk.

loans.name: Julio Jr.

texts.en:
Julio Jr. has a banana farm in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. This is the primary source of income for his family. 

He makes it a point to prepare his land well to have maximum yield and a good income. Recently, he needed a loan from Paglaum MPC to pay for irrigation costs. Julio Jr. wishes to sustain his business and supply bananas to the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to pay for labor for irrigation.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella has a collection of ornamental garden plants. She finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities and earning money for her family. 

As a microfinance member of PMPC, she sought financial help to purchase a variety of ornamental plants to grow and sell. In the future, Estrella wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona has been a coco farmer for quite some time. Aside from her monthly pension, she also buys coconuts for copra production (coconut meat dried and converted to cooking oil) that gives her additional income. 

She lives alone because her husband died few years ago. Chona is active in attending various activities offered by Paglaum MPC where she is a microfinance member. Now that her youngest son has decided to settle down, she has asked for a loan from the coop to pay for the wedding.

loans.use: to pay for her son's wedding.

loans.name: Rechel

texts.en:
Rechel is 24 years old, and married with two children in school.  

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Rechel has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and rice barn for her pigs.

Rechel has been pig fattening for two years, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rechel would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and rice barns for her pigs.

loans.name: Juvie

texts.en:
Juvie works hard to support her family. She is married and raises pigs in the Philippines. Juvie has been in this business for three years.

She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice and feed.

In the future, Juvie would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice and feed.

loans.name: Ilse

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Ilse, quien con su credikiva surtió su negocio con nuevas referencias de productos para el cuidado personal, permitiéndole incrementar sus ingresos y acceder a mejores oportunidades de inversión.  Su oferta de productos ahora más variada y de mejor calidad, al haber explorado nuevas alternativas para sus compras y nuevos proveedores. Ilse está muy agradecida por los beneficios obtenidos con esta inversión y envía un mensaje a sus financiadores de Kiva “Que sigan apoyando a las personas trabajadoras”. En la actualidad está aplicando su segundo credikiva, con el cual comprará mercancías varias; prendas de vestir, colonias, cremas,  entre otros encargos de sus clientes, así mismo comprará víveres para su negocio de comidas típicas. Nuevamente su credikiva será todo un éxito gracias a su compromiso y dedicación.
texts.en: Thank you for supporting Ilse who, with her Kiva loan, stocked her business with new types of products for personal care, allowing her to increase her income and access more opportunities for investment. Her product offerings are now more varied and of better quality, having explored new alternatives for her purchases and new providers. Ilse is very grateful for the benefits she got with this investment and sends a message to her Kiva funders "Continue supporting working people." Currently, she is applying for a second Kiva loan, with which she will purchase a variety of merchandise: clothing, colognes, creams and other of her customers' orders, and also to purchase groceries for her business of traditional dishes. Again, her Kiva loan will be a success thanks to her commitment and dedication.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of merchandise: clothing, colognes, creams and other of her customers' orders, and also to purchase groceries for her business of traditional dishes.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. and is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to pay for laborers salaries and buy sacks fo fertilizers.

She supplements this income with earnings from her food vending.

Marilyn dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to pay for laborers salaries and buy sacks fo fertilizers

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita works hard to support her family. Amelita is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like, rice, meat, vegetables, etc.

Amelita has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Amelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like, rice, meat, vegetables, etc

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 43 years old and married with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, noodles, and personal care products.

Grace has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling bread.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, noodles, and personal care products.

loans.name: Yulia

texts.en:
Yulia, pictured on the left with her mother, moved to Israel from the former USSR with ‎her mother when she was 16. She has always taken great responsibility for her life and ‎her mother’s, making sure her mother gets along and is busy. While Yulia gained a good ‎education and adapted to her new language, her mother was not able to learn Hebrew as ‎well as a younger immigrant. 

At first, Yulia opened a store for housing goods in 2006 in ‎Beer Sheva’s old town to earn extra money and to have a place of employment for her ‎mother. After she observed the influx of large chains and saw profits diminishing, Yulia ‎wisely closed this store. In 2014 she opened a clothing boutique in a busy centre of Beer ‎Sheva. Yulia manages and owns the store and her mother is the ‎saleswoman. Yulia has a full-time job but owns the store both for extra income for ‎herself, and employment and independence for her mother. 

After making good contacts with ‎suppliers from Turkey, Yulia has been working to lower purchasing costs. Yulia has ‎developed a relationship directly with the clothing manufacturers in Turkey and is working ‎to build her fall stock. Yulia’s mother has become the brand of the store, which sells ‎clothes to mature women. She and Yulia together choose the pieces and have created a ‎well-loved neighbourhood store with a loyal customer base. Yulia recognizes the potential ‎of her store and now wants to include pieces that reach out to additional populations in ‎the area.‎

Yulia needed this loan to purchase stock directly from the suppliers in Turkey, enabling ‎her to save expenses on supplies and make this needed investment to upgrade her ‎stock.‎

Yulia is pleased with how her business is developing. It provides extra income for herself ‎and, most importantly, generates income for her mother. She wants to see the business ‎branch out and diversify its clientele in the future.‎

loans.use: To purchase stock directly from the suppliers in Turkey, enabling her to save expenses on ‎supplies and make this needed investment to upgrade her stock.

loans.name: Basma

texts.en:
Basma, age 34, is a conservative woman, so she asked her brother-in-law Amer to take her place in the photo.
 
Basma is married and is living with her husband and his family. She tells us that the family is built on love, and that the family members stick by each other. 

Her brother-in-law Amer is a university student in his last year of study. In addition to studying tourism and archaeology, Amer works in one of the local medical centers. Due to financial difficulty, Amer does not have enough to pay his fees for his final semester at the university. Therefore, Basma decided to take out this loan, so that she can pay for his last semester's fees. 

Her goal is help him graduate so that he can officially work in his field of study.

loans.use: to pay for her brother-in-law's last semester university fees

loans.name: Sofian

texts.en:
Sofian, age 22 and unmarried, lives with his family in Ajloun. It is a family of five. He is attending a private university near where he lives, and he is majoring in business administration. 

The family is experiencing some financial difficulty, and Sofian is currently unable to pay his semester fees at the university. For this reason, he applied for this educational loan in order to cover his semester fees.

loans.use: to cover his semester fees at the university

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Tea, who is 33 years old married woman, is from Kutaisi city, west Georgia. She lives with her sister-in-law, who is unemployed and parents-in-law, who are involved in their private activities. Tea has high education but in spite of this, she was unable to find any stable job. 

Nowadays, she is a private teacher and has 3 pupils, from whom she gets 150 GEL per month. The income is really small for this motivated woman to make a living-wage and she is eager somehow to increase it. 

Tea decided to start a clothing trading business with the requested loan amount but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers.  Tea’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she was unable to satisfy their requirements. She received the credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Startup Program that gives poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. 

She will purchase stock of various kind clothing at wholesale prices in the biggest market, located in the capital and will start selling in her community with price mark-ups. 
Tea will get the chance to generate additional income and tackle with the financial difficulties. She will be thankful to all the lenders for helping to maintain her trading business.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of clothing and to start trading

loans.name: Benjamin Bicente

texts.en:
Benjamin is a 37-years-old married man who lives in the municipality of Sincelejo in the Colombian Atlantic coast. He’s the father of 4 children, 3 boys and one girl, all of them are the reason why this responsible man works really hard and makes some many sacrifices, for example, the long trip he has to take every day to his place of work because is really far away from his home. He owns a food stand, where he cooks and sells amazing dishes.

This man has a big family and a lot of responsibilities.  That’s why he wants and needs to make his business grow, so he can improve his sales and increase his profits, by getting more clients. He asked for a loan so he can improve his food stand and to buy some more cooking implements. 

He’s willing to improve his business and work really hard to accomplish all of that. He dreams of having the opportunity of repairing his house because it is not in its best condition. You can help Benjamin by giving him the loan he needs and trust on his work.

loans.use: improve his food stand and to buy some more cooking implements

loans.name: Martha Nubia

texts.es:
Martha es una madre cabeza de familia de 35 años de edad, una persona trabajadora, honesta y servicial que tiene un negocio de producción de productos alimenticios en el cual pone todo su empeño y amor, quizás sea ese el secreto de su éxito ya que desde el año 2005 tiene el negocio y hasta la fecha sigue firme mejorando día a día, con el objetivo de construir un buen futuro para su familia, en especial a su pequeña adoración de 8 años de edad (hijo).
El sueño de Martha es asegurar la educación de su muchacho, tener un negocio  firme y perdurable en el tiempo.

La cliente en el momento desea renovar parte del entable del negocio y comprar materia prima para la fabricación de sus alimentos, por ello acude a un apoyo económico para ejecutar estas reformas y compras de insumos.
texts.en:
Martha, age 35, is a mother and the head of the household. She is a hard-working, honest, and helpful person. She has a business making food. She puts all of her effort and love into it. Perhaps this is the secret of her success. She has had the business since 2005, and to date she continues improving it day to day. Her objective is to build a good future for her family, especially for her adored little eight year old (son). Martha's dream is to assure her son's education, and to have a strong business that endures in time.

At this time she wishes to renovate part of the flooring of her business and to buy raw material to make food. That is why she turns to a loan in order to execute these changes and to buy supplies.

loans.use: to buy raw material to make food.

loans.name: Naser

texts.en:
Naser is a 44-year-old married father of four and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Seventeen years ago, he rented a van and started transporting people to cover the needs and expenses of his family.  Naser is a hard worker who is trying desperately to develop his business. 

Today, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy the van which will help him work independently and save more profit.
Naser hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions inside the camp.

loans.use: to buy his van to be able to work independently and save more

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf, age 34 and married, lives in the city of Rafah in the Gaza strip. He is a teacher at the refugee school, and he loves his job.

Ashraf earns a low income, and he can only just cover his household expenses. However, he wants to improve himself as a teacher and to be up-to-date with technology, so he decided to buy a new laptop for his work. With this investment, he will be able to prepare his students' exams, generate reports, and build curriculum materials more efficiently.

Ashraf requested a USD loan from FATEN in order to purchase his laptop.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for preparing student exams, generating reports, and building curriculum materials

loans.name: Ibraheem

texts.en:
Ibraheem is a young man with a barber shop which has been open for the past seven years. He now has good experience and is well known in his city, Gaza. Fadi loves his job and always thinks how to improve it.

Ibraheem took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new tools and decorate his barber shop. This will improve his business and make his barber shop even more attractive.

Ibraheem appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new tools and decorate his barber shop.

loans.name: Ibraheem

texts.en:
ibraheem is a young man with a barber shop which has been open for the past six years. He now has good experience and is well known in his city, Rafah. Fadi loves his job and always thinks how to improve it.

Ibraheem took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new tools and decorate his barber shop. This will improve his business and make his barber shop more attractive.

Ibraheem appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new tools and decorate his barber shop.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 54 years old and married with seven children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Susana is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Susana has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell veterinary products business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of veterinary products to sell for her buy-and-sell veterinary products business.

Myrna has been in this business for three years. Myrna earns more income from general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of veterinary products to sell.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer works hard to support her family. Jenifer is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net, gasoline, etc.

Jenifer has been in this business for 3 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets, gasoline, etc

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
As a parent of four children, Ma. Luz works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Ma. Luz is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish-vending business.

Ma. Luz has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Teodula

texts.en:
Teodula is 54 years old and married with two children, she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell for her business like, canned goods, noodles, rice, soft drinks, etc..

Teodula has been in this business for 15 years. 

In the future Teodula would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell for her business like canned goods, noodles, rice, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Inbal

texts.en:
Inbal is a 39-year-old mother of three. She opened her children's educational ‎store online in 2008 and established a physical store in 2014. Inbal has a Master’s ‎degree in child psychology and has applied her professional knowledge to the area ‎of games, toys and books to assist parents with healthy toys for their children. She ‎combines educational toys for different stages of growth along with natural materials. ‎While Inbal found a unique and important business niche where she has an important ‎expertise, she was lacking financial management skills and for too long overstocked her ‎store out of proportion with sales. She did training with KIEDF, gained skills and ‎has developed smarter business practices. Over the last six months she has doubled her ‎profits as a result.‎

Inbal needed this loan to pay her supplier and for future stock, so she can receive a ‎discount and purchases will be based on sales. Through this investment she can invest ‎in future stock at lower prices and also gain the ability to return non-sold items as ‎opposed to selling them at a loss.‎

Inbal has made a strong connection with an area program which provides young mothers ‎courses in the morning and toddler activities in the afternoon. She is providing some of ‎the morning courses and has gained a strong outlet for additional sales. Her goal is to ‎continue and focus on healthy financial management for the long term.‎

loans.use: To pay her supplier and for future stock, so she can receive a discount and purchases will ‎be based on sales.

loans.name: Iris

texts.en:
Iris is 31 years old, married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Iris has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal for 3 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Arelis Del Carmen

texts.en:
Arelis is a 41 years old married woman who has two adult daughters. The whole family lives in the municipality of Lorica, where she has a business of food selling, recognizes the quality of the dishes and how good it tastes. This talented woman learned all that she knows thanks to her mother who taught her how to cook.

Arelis knows that her business is what supports her family and keeps them going in life, but the economy isn’t easy right now, especially for the competition in the town, where there’s a lot of food places. She is aware that the best way of standing out is to offer a good service and the best products, that’s the reason she’s asking for a loan so she can buy corn, sugar, coconuts, meat and vegetables, so she can expand her menu. 

One of Arelis’s biggest dreams is to have a successful business that she can leave to her daughters, so they have an income that helps them have a good quality of life. Help her accomplish all her drams, loan now and get her closer to that.

loans.use: buy corn, sugar, coconuts, meat and vegetables

loans.name: Allam

texts.en:
Greetings from Palestine! This is 22-year-old Allam from Al-Naser neighborhood in Gaza. He is single and living with his parents. In 2014, Allam opened his gas business in his parents' house. He got the idea of this business after seeing his parents' suffering to fill the gas cylinder of their house as there were no gas stores in his area. 

Allam says that the main challenge to his business is the stoppage of gas supplies from Israeli suppliers.

Allam required this loan in order to buy a gas filling machine and to buy additional gas cylinders. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to expand his business. In the future, Allam plans to buy a car in order to distribute the gas to wider areas than his living area. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a gas filling machine and to buy additional gas cylinders.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.en:
María is 55 years old and has two daughters.  She lives in Sincelejo, a city placed in the Colombian Atlantic coast. She has owned a recycling business since 2000, so she’s been working in that for 15 years  She’s an expert in what she does, working for around 10 hours every day. 

She loves to help the environment and especially when she can support her family doing it. She hopes someday she can offer jobs to more people and see her business become successful. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy some recycling materials and hire some people that she needs to do her job.

She dreams with giving to her daughters the best education that she can because she knows how hard is the economy now and believes that with that, they can have a better life. You can help María with this loan and let her be closer to fulfilling her goals.

loans.use: buy some recycling materials and hire some people

loans.name: Germania

texts.es:
Germania una mujer luchadora ella viene de una familia de bajos recursos económicos vive en San Miguel de los Bancos; sus padres no le pudieron dar el estudio apenas puede escribir su nombre, es madre soltera tiene un hijo de 19 años y un nieto de 11 años los dos están a su cargo se dedica al negocio de los cerdos, aprendió de esta actividad desde su niñez junto con los papas,  trabaja un promedio de 10 horas diarias entre en negocio y también trabaja lavando ropa, lavando platos en restaurantes y otros oficios varios, su vida es muy dura casi no tiene tiempo para ella porque a las 4 de la mañana sale de su casa  coge una ranchera hacia el sector de la 23 de junio donde también ordeña vacas a las 11 am regresa a su casa y se dedica a los cerdos luego sale a seguir buscando el sustento diario para ella su hijo y su nieto.
Doña Germania solicita el crédito para invertir en la ampliación y construcción de chancheras ya que las que tiene están en malas condiciones  y necesita espacio porque tiene dos cerdas madres que están por parir y necesitan espacio, con este préstamo está segura que su situación económica mejorará, la señora Germania agradece a Kiva por el apoyo y la ayuda brindada ya que es una mujer que busca salir adelante.
texts.en:
Germania is a determined woman. She comes from a family of low economic resources and lives in San Miguel de los Bancos. Her parents couldn't provide her with an education. She barely can write her name. She is a single mother and has a 19 year-old-son and an 11-year-old grandson who are in her care. She works at her pig business. She learned this work from her childhood with her parents. She works an average of 10 hours each day between her business and she also works washing clothes, washing dishes in restaurants, and a variety of other jobs. Her life is very hard and she almost doesn't have time for herself because at 4 in the morning, she leaves her house, and gets a ride to the 23 de junio sector where she also milks cows. At 11 am she goes back home and works with her pigs, later she goes out to continue seeking the daily sustenance for herself, her son, and her grandson. 

Germania asks for the loan to invest in the expansion and construction of pig sties since the ones she has are in bad condition and she needs space because she has two mother pigs that are about to give birth and need space. With this loan, she is sure that her economic situation will improve. Germania is grateful to Kiva for the support and the help offered since she is a woman who looks to get ahead.

loans.use: to expand and to build more pig sties to continue supporting her son and grandson.

loans.name: Teresa Patricia

texts.es:
Teresa es madre de 3 hijos, dos menores de edad y un adolecente, se separó de su esposo, pero en ningún momento se desmorono, acepto al realidad y busco alternativas para generar ingresos. 

Gracias a que siguió los consejos de una amiga inicio con la venta de productos por catálogo, la cual funciona de la siguiente manera, ella muestra los productos en una revista, los clientes anotan sus pedidos, ella los entrega en máximos 15 días calendario y el cliente los paga en dos cuotas quincenales.

En base a un pedido que tiene pendiente la señora Teresa quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de lociones, ropa, accesorios, artículos para el hogar y zapatos.
texts.en:
Teresa has three children. Two of them are minors, and one is an adolescent. She is separated from her husband, but she has never fallen apart. She accepted reality, and she sought ways to generate income. Thanks to the fact that she followed a friend's advice, she started selling products by catalog. This works in the following way. She shows the products in a magazine, the customers mark their orders, she delivers in 15 days at the most, and the customers makes two biweekly payments.

On the basis of a pending order that she has, Teresa wants to request a loan to buy lotions, clothing, accessories, household items, and shoes.

loans.use: to buy lotions, clothes, accessories, household items, and shoes.

loans.name: Maysa

texts.en:
Maysa is a nice young lady in her late twenties. She is married and has two boys and three girls. Her husband works in a car painting business while she stays at home caring for the children. 

Maysa wanted to do something in her free time at home, so a year ago she started a small retail business, selling clothes. At first, she got a small quantity of clothes from a city in northern Jordan called Ramtha to try her luck. She got good feedback on the quality she chose and decided to go on with the business. 

Most weekends, Maysa and her husband go to Ramtha to buy more goods to sell. It has been a year now since she started, but she is looking for other sources of clothes as Ramtha is very close to the Syrian border. It is not always safe to go and she can’t always find the quality she looks for, which slows the growth of her business.

Now Maysa is applying for a loan to buy a larger quantity of clothes with more variety to avoid visiting the city on a weekly basis.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of clothes with more variety

loans.name: Wend La Sida Group

texts.fr: Azeto, âgée de 59 ans mariée mère de 8 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle exerce son activité depuis 15 ans. Ce qui fait marcher son activité ce sont : son expérience, son accueil et respect des clients, la différence de prix avec celle des autres. Elle veut le prêt pour s’acheter des céréales (maïs, mil) à 100 000. L’utilité c’est d’approvisionner son commerce afin de renforcer son activité et satisfaire ses clients. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt 1 fois et a remboursé  à la date prévue à ACFIME.
texts.en:
Azeto, age 59, is a married mother to 8 children who have all attended school. She has been conducting her activity for 15 years, and the keys to her success are her experience, the way she greets her customers and treats them with respect, and the price difference with her competitors. 

She is seeking this loan to purchase 100,000F worth of cereals (maize, millet). This credit will allow her to stock up on merchandise, which will help to strengthen her activity and meet customer demand. 

Azeto previously received one loan that she repaid to ACFIM in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase 100,000F worth of cereals (maize, millet).

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn, age 51, sells bananas and snack food items to earn an income. She has been engaged in these activities in her town for almost 10 years, so she has gained good experience and savvy in terms of running this kind of business. This allows her to bring in more customers than her many competitors in town, due to her good salesmanship and personal approach. She has been successful over the years, and she managed to both save money and support her family. She and her husband have four grown children.

Analyn is now looking to the future by planning to buy a parcel of land in order for her to manage a new business. She will be building a small pig pen here, which will allow her to generate additional income in the near future. 

She is using her earnings from her food vending business to fund this new project. However, she needs to generate additional capital. She is therefore requesting a loan from Paglaum-MPC. She will use her loan funds to purchase 100 kilos of bananas to offer for sale.

loans.use: to purchase 100 kilos of bananas to offer for sale

loans.name: Jenefer

texts.en:
Jenefer works hard to support her family. Jenefer is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy new fishing net and other fishing materials.

Jenefer has been in this business for 1 year now.

In the future, Jenefer would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and other fishing materials

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn works hard to support her family. Jenelyn is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy new fish net.

Jenelyn has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Jenelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new fish nets

loans.name: Becerra Quintero

texts.es:
En el Recinto Andoas del Cantón Pedro Vicente Maldonado un lugar muy hermoso, su clima es cálido húmedo su gente es muy amable, trabajadora y unida, este sector es muy tranquilo 
En este Recinto vive y tiene su negocio la señora Juana  una mujer luchadora ella mantiene una sólida relación como casada de la cual tienen 7 hijos uno estudia y 6 son independientes pero viven con ellos y aportan en los gastos del hogar su esposo trabaja como operador de maquinaria pesada en el Consejo Provincial, ella tiene a su cargo desde hace 15 años el bar de la escuelita Andoas, a este negocio le dedica un promedio de 4 horas por día, aprendió del mismo por iniciativa propia ya que se le dio la oportunidad de hacerse cargo del bar.
Solicita el crédito para invertir en el negocio comprando confites para los niños que le solicita el Distrito del sector, con esta nueva inversión esperan mejorar sus ingresos para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos de la casa, la señora Juana agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidades brindadas.
texts.en:
In Andoas precinct in Pedro Vicente Maldonado canton, a very lovely place, with a warm and humid climate, the people are very friendly, hard-working and close-knit. This area is very peaceful. 

Juana lives in this precinct and has her business. She is a determined woman, she is in a solid married relationship, in which she has 7 children. One is a student and 6 are independent but live with them and contribute to the household expenses. Her husband works as a heavy-machinery operator in the provincial council. For 15 years, she has been in charge of the food stand at the Andoas school. She works at this business for an average of 4 hours a day. She learned it from her own initiative since they gave her the opportunity to be responsible for the stand. 

She asks for the loan to invest in the business, purchasing candies for the children, which the district asks of her. With this new investment, she hopes to increase her income to help her husband with the household expenses. Juana is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and to Kiva for the offered support and opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase candies for children, she hopes to increase her income and help with the household expenses.

loans.name: Marcos Tulio

texts.es:
Marcos está casado, y tiene dos hijos, Marcos se dedica a diferentes actividades para mantener las necesidades de su familia, la producción de café orgánico y productos de hortaliza 100% orgánicos son las principales fuentes de ingresos, Marcos sueña con poder darles a sus hijos las mejores oportunidades en la vida, sobre todo que tengan una buena educación.
Actualmente en la región se está popularizando la producción de maracuyá orgánica la cual se comercializa por medio de COCAFCAL de la cual Marcos es socio, el maracuyá es un cultivo novedoso ya que la región tiene las condiciones apropiadas para producirla sin mayor complicación.
Marcos solicita un crédito para plantar 0.3 hectáreas de maracuyá orgánico bajo la supresión técnica de COCAFCAL con las ganancias de la producción él quiere mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguir trabajando para formar un patrimonio familiar. 	
Un crédito ayuda a Marcos a comprar plantas de maracuyá, postes, un sistema de riego y pago de mano de obra para su plantación de maracuyá orgánico.
texts.en:
Marcos is married and has two children. Marcos works in different jobs to support his family's needs; organic coffee production and 100% organic vegetables are his primary sources of income. Marcos dreams of being able to give his children the best opportunities in life, above all that they get a good education. 

Currently, organic passion fruit production is becoming popular in the area, which is sold through COCAFCAL, of which Marcos is a member. Passion fruit is a crop of interest since in the region there are appropriate conditions to produce it without too much difficulty.

Marcos asks for a loan to plant 0.3 hectares of organic passion fruit under the technical supervision of COCAFCAL. With the earnings from the production, he wants to improve his family's quality of life and continue working to create a family legacy.

A loan helps Marcos to purchase passion fruit plants, posts, an irrigation system and to pay labor costs for his passion fruit plantings.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary materials to plant 0.3 hectares of passion fruit which are: posts, passion fruit plants, manure, to pay labor costs, and more.

loans.name: Dakan Colma 2 Group

texts.fr: Oumou, est âgée de 33 ans  mariée mère de 3 enfants dont 2 enfants scolarisés. Son mari est un chauffeur. Elle exerce son activité  de restauratrice depuis 11 ans. Ce qui fait marcher son activité ce sont : l’emplacement de l’activité dans le, marché central ; l’accueil et le respect des clients, la bonne qualité de la nourriture. Elle veut le prêt pour acheter 15 sacs de riz, 8 cartons de macaroni par mois à 150 000. L’utilité du prêt c’est de s’approvisionner en quantité suffisante afin de renforcer son activité. Elle déjà reçu le prêt plusieurs fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues.
texts.en:
Oumou, age 33, is a married mother to three children, two of whom go to school. Her husband is a driver. She has been conducting her restaurant activity for 11 years, and the keys to her success are the location of her business at the central market, the way she greets her customers and treats them with respect, and the quality of her dishes.  

She is seeking this loan to purchase 15 sacks of rice and 8 cartons of macaroni pasta per month for 150,000F. This credit will allow her to be fully stocked, which will help to strengthen her activity. 

Oumou previously received several loans that she repaid in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase 15 sacks of rice and 8 cartons of macaroni pasta per month for 150,000F.

loans.name: Bath's Group

texts.en:
Bath’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Bath makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Etab

texts.en:
Etab is a 34-year-old married woman, and she is a mother of three children. Her husband works in a private company and they are living in one of the underprivileged areas in Jordan called Southern Ghour. 

To help add more income to the family, Etab sells girl's hair pins and children's clothes. If the business is going well, she sometimes sells cosmetics and make-up products depending on the demand. 

Etab is now looking to expand her variety of products and add accessories to the children's clothing sales business, and for that she is applying for this loan.

loans.use: to expand her variety of products and add accessories to the children's clothing sales business

loans.name: Sharif

texts.en:
Sharif is a 43-year-old married man, and he is a father of six children. Although he was not able to reach high school because of their family financial situation, he made sure that his children are all going to school to get the education he couldn’t have. Now his eldest daughter is in university and the others are still going to elementary and high school.

Since he left school early, Sharif used to go to work with his father and other workshops and gained a lot of experience in the market. Then he decided to take over his father’s business running his butcher shop. 

He is applying for a loan to do some renovations to the shop to attract more customers.

loans.use: to do some renovations to the shop to attract more customers

loans.name: Lai

texts.en:
Lai is 60 years old. She is a married mother with two children living in the Takeo Province of Cambodia. For a living she and her husband run a business purchasing and selling junk materials. One of her two children is a factory worker. Together, they can earn approximately $24 per day. 

Lai’s the trailer are old, so she is now requesting a loan because she needs finances to purchase a newer trailer to transport recycle things to purchase and to sell in her community. With this loan, she will be able to afford a new a trailer to purchase and to sell junk materials in order to earn income to support her family. In the future, she wants to expand her business and build a new proper house.

loans.use: to purchase a newer trailer to transport recycled things

loans.name: Tunjung Wiguna Group

texts.en:
The Tunjung Wiguna group located in west part of Bali is where most inhabitants work as farmers and breeders. Most of them are raising cows and pigs. The group headed by Ni Ketut. Ni Ketut, 42, has 3 chidren. 2 adults and 1 school age children. From her pig raising business and farming, she can support her family needs. Ni Ketut also responsible for the payment of the Tunjung Wiguna group. After made the payment to MUK, they all agree to continue the loan to expand the business, both livestock and farming. Ni Ketut had sold her pigs after keep them for 3 months. In this loan period, she can sold them twice. And earned a satisfactory profit. 

Now is facing the dry season and to expand the business, especially in farming, the group continue the loan with the same loan size and same members. The loan use is to buy seeds which are suitable for the dry season such as nuts and cassava. They also buy insecticide and fertilizer. Although now they focus in farming, the group still maintain pigs. Ni Ketut use her portion of loan to buy seeds, insecticide and fertilizer. Ni Ketut also still maintain her rice field with her husband. She hopes she can have a successful harvest and all the profit will be saved for her families future needs. She said many thanks to lenders, Kiva and MUK for the support.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insectiside and fertilizer

loans.name: Nelis Estela

texts.es:
Nelis, vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y han procreado cuatro hijos de los cuales unos ya cuentan con su propio hogar, ubicado en la misma propiedad, tienen 20 años de habitar en el actual domicilio, no tienen ayuda económica del extranjero, la actividad económica familiar es trabajar la tierra cultivando maíz, pipían y frijol, en escases de lluvia lo hace mediante un sistema de riego, cuenta con muchos años de experiencia.
Se encuentra descapitalizada y su deseo por seguir teniendo su negocio funcionando hace que tome la decisión de trabajar con créditos para comprar insumos agrícolas y pagar costos de preparación de dos manzanas de terreno para cultivar pipián y maíz, espera sacar su cosecha en el tiempo justo para su venta.
Sueña con tener cosechas abundantes que le generan ingresos para pagar el crédito y ayudar a que toda la familia tenga una vida más digna.
texts.en:
Nelis lives in her own home with her husband, of the four children they have had, one has their own home located on the same property. They have been living in their current domicile for 20 years and they do not have any economic help from outside. The family's economic activity is working the land growing corn, squash and beans. During times of drought they employ an irrigation system, having many years of experience. 
She finds herself lacking in capital and her wish to continue her business running is behind the decision to work with loans in order to purchase farm supplies and pay the costs of preparing two blocks of land to grow squash and corn. She hopes to harvest just in time for her sale. Her dream is to have abundant harvests which will generate income to pay for the loan and help her family enjoy a more dignified life.

loans.use: purchase farm supplies and pay for the costs of preparing two blocks of land to grow squash and corn

loans.name: Ameera

texts.en:
Ameera is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of two girls and two boys. All have finished their studies and are working in their own jobs. Each one of them is helping a little to support their parents as well as build their own future.  

To make use of her free time, Ameera decided to make souvenirs for graduations, baby showers, etc. She is applying for a loan to buy the material to prepare some souvenirs for the upcoming Islamic holiday.

loans.use: to buy the material needed to prepare some souvenirs for the upcoming Islamic holiday

loans.name: Basanti

texts.en:
Basanti is a generous woman who is 42 years old and is from a small village of Kandhamal district. She is married and has two children. She is an honest, hardworking, and goal-oriented person. She has many years of practice working the land and keeping livestock helping her parents. Recently, her husband has helped her to do to business. 

Unfortunately, she lacks toilet facilities in her home and her entire family depend upon the open field for defecation and urination. She is very much concerned about her family's health and that is why she wants to build a toilet in her home and safeguard her and her family's health.

She is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR in order to build a toilet to prevent her family from getting diseases and infections.

She will be very thankful if you consider her request and provide your help to her, so that she enjoys a healthy life.

loans.use: to build a toilet.

loans.name: Pramila

texts.en:
Pramila is 35 years old, married and has three kids in school. She hails from a small town of Kandhamal district, Odisha, India. 

She has had a business selling fruits and vegetables for four years. Her business is still new. She prefers this business because it is easier to manage, realizes a good profit and at the same time, she is able to care for her family. Pramila works from 5 am to 6 pm every working day and is able to make a good return per month. 

The critical issue is that she does not have access to a latrine in her house and is facing a lot of difficulty to go outside to an open space for defecation as she feels that her privacy is getting hampered.

That is why she is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR in order to build a new latrine. Her aim is to safeguard her health and ultimately promote cleanliness and hygiene in the community.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Sanjukta

texts.en:
Sanjukta who is aged 43 years hails from a remote village of Kandhamal district. She lives with her husband and one son and one daughter in her small kutcha house which lacks basic civic amenities. 

Sanjukta is a farmer by profession and she cultivates green leafy vegetables. Her husband works as a security guard in a company in the nearby town.

As Sanjukta does not have access to toilet in her house due to inadequate funds, she is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR to build a new toilet and incorporate all the necessary sanitary equipment in it.

Sanjukta hopes to enjoy a healthy, safe and hygienic life with her family and to excel in her farming business.

loans.use: to build a new toilet and incorporate all the necessary sanitary equipment in it.

loans.name: Gertrudis

texts.es:
Gertrudis es un caficultor de 54 años se dedica a la agricultura, está casado con Irma, actualmente tienen 4 hijos bajo su cargo. Gertrudis se dedica a la producción  de café desde hace 38 años y es su principal fuente de subsistencia, Gertudis y su esposa sueñan con poder darles a sus hijos una buena educación para que en el futuro sepan aprovechar las oportunidades.
Gertrudis está en el proceso de conversión a orgánico de su finca y como parte del proceso necesita hacer algunas mejoras que le ayudaran a hacer su finca más productiva y sostenible.
Gertrudis solicita un crédito para hacer las mejoras necesarias en el proceso de conversión a orgánico, entre las mejoras están mejorar la protección del suelo de las fincas, mejorar las condiciones de acopio de las fincas y diversificar las variedades de arboles en la finca, además Gertrudis necesita comprar plantas de café orgánico, abonos orgánicos e insecticidas orgánicos para llevar a cabo el proceso, al finalizar el proceso Gertrudis podrá vender su café orgánico a mejores precios que el café convencional.
Un crédito ayudara a Gertrudis a llevar a cabo el proceso de certificación, Con las ganancias el mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia además sus hijos tendrán más posibilidades para obtener una educación de calidad.
texts.en:
Gertrudis is a 54-year-old coffee grower. He is married to Irma, and they have four children who are under their care. Gertrudis has been working in coffee production for 38 years, and it is his main source of income. He and his wife dream of being able to give their children a good education so that they can take advantage of the opportunities available to them.

Gertrudis is in the process of converting to organic production on his plantation. As part of this process, he needs to make some improvements that will allow his plantation to be more productive and sustainable. Gertrudis is requesting a loan to make these necessary improvements in the conversion process. Some of these improvements to his plantation include better soil conservation, better storage conditions, and a greater diversity in the variety of trees growing on the plantation. He also needs to buy organic coffee plants and organic pesticides in order to complete the process. When he has accomplished these things, Gertrudis will be able to sell his organic coffee for a better price than conventional coffee.

A loan will help Gertrudis complete the process of organic certification. With his earnings, he will be able to improve living conditions for him and his family, and his children will have more opportunities to obtain a quality education.

loans.use: to buy organic manure and to pay for the labor and supplies that he needs to make the necessary improvements to his coffee plantation that will allow him to begin the process of converting to organic production.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina es una mujer soltera de 51 años de edad, una mujer guerrera, luchadora que no tuvo el apoyo de muchas personas, toda su vida batallo por su sostenimiento, lo que tiene lo ha logrado con méritos propios, trabajando, vendiendo mercancía, realizando múltiples actividades, hoy tiene ubicada en su hogar una vitrina donde vende productos de uso personal, como lociones, desodorantes, cremas, entre otros productos, pero igualmente sale a la calle para, mejorar sus ingresos.

Luz Marina para trabajar usa el método de pago por cuotas, ofreciéndoles a sus clientes comodidades de paga para que se sientan a gustos y recompren.
El principal inconveniente con este método es esperar las fechas de pago, y mucho más cuando hay pedidos de por medio, es por esta razón que Luz Marina quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de productos de uso personas en gran cantidad para dar abasto a la demanda de productos que tiene actualmente, quedando con un pequeño capital para comprar futuros pedidos.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a single, 51 year old woman.  She is a fighter who didn't have the support of many people and fought for her sustenance her entire life.  Everything she has, she has earned by her own merit, working by selling merchandise and doing multiple other activities.  Today, she has a glass cabinet in her house where she sells person products such as lotions, deodorants, creams and others. She also sells in the street to improve her income.  

Luz Marina uses a payment by installment method for her work, offering her clients ease of payment so that they feel satisfied and buy again.  The main inconvenience with this method is waiting for the payment dates and when there are losses by using this method.  For this reason, Luz wants to request a loan to buy personal products in bulk quantities to meet the demands that she currently has, and maintaining a small amount of capital to buy future orders.

loans.use: to buy personal use products in bulk to meet the current demand for these products.

loans.name: Sarada Kumari

texts.en:
Sarada Kumari, who is 44 years old, is living in a community of Kandhamal district, Odisha, India. She lives with her husband who is a grocer and two sons who are grown up. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for around 20 years. 

Sarada Kumari wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan amount of 15,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Jahnabi

texts.en:
Jahnabi is 42 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture, raising poultr,y for five years. Jahnabi lives in Kandhamal district, a rural town in Odisha, India. Her family is a low-income household in the village.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is that her family does not have a latrine. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 INR to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet. Building a toilet will help to prevent her and her family from getting serious infectious diseases.

She hopes for her business to do well and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can avail herself of financial assistance for her chosen business. 

Rosie has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid back in a timely manner. 

Recently, she availed herself of a loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for her chosen business. Rosie wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins.

location.town: Calamba-Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Simantini

texts.en:
The lady featured in the photo is Simantini, aged 30 years. She hails from a small village of Kandhamal district. Simantini owns a food stall where she sells snacks, french fries, sweets, potato chips, sandwiches and junk foods. Her business runs very well and all the income that she generates is used to meet her daily expenses in the food stall as well as in her home. She is the only bread winner in the family as her husband is unable to work due to his health issues. 

Simantini lacks a toilet in her home and she and her family are facing lot of difficulties due to unavailability of a suitable toilet in her home.

Therefore, Simantini is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR in order to install a commode, a hand shower and incorporate steel water pipes in her toilet.

She is eagerly awaiting your helping hands to make her overcome her difficulties.

loans.use: to install a commode, a hand shower and incorporate steel water pipes in her toilet.

loans.name: Marisela

texts.en:
After Marisela was laid off, she had difficulty finding work that was flexible enough to allow her to raise her own children. She then had the idea to start her own home-based daycare business. 

She has always loved children and she knew this would be a way to help her husband with the household expenses. She received her training through the Chicano Federation Daycare Program. Currently, she has a very successful daycare and she is hoping one day to be able to care for 14 children, which is the most children you can care for in a home. 

Marisela has been now in the daycare industry for more than 10 years, but she is in need of some upgrades. She will use her Kiva loan to purchase new rugs and tables, and fix her fence and bathroom. With the help of Kiva lenders, she will be able to upgrade her daycare and care for more children, so that she can provide more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase new rugs and tables, and fix her fence and bathroom.

loans.name: Lilima

texts.en:
Lilima, 32 is from Kandhamal district, Odisha, India.She is a humble, simple and down to earth person living with a limited income with her husband and a seven-year-old son. 

Lilima is a farmer by profession and is engaged in betel leaf cultivation and fetches a fair amount of money from it. Her husband works as a mechanic in a garage. The total income generated by both of them is used to meet the daily household expenses and they hardly have any savings after meeting all the expenses.

Lilima is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR to Kiva's partner People's Forum in order to build a suitable toilet for her family.The loan will enable her to safeguard her family's health and to maintain cleanliness and hygiene.

Lilima aspires to purchase a cow and start a dairy business to add to her income in the very near future.

loans.use: to build a suitable toilet.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella is 51 years old and resides in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and blessed with only 1 child, who is an adult. She joined PMPC in 2014 in order to access the co-op's programs and services. Recently, she received her second loan in the amount of 4,000 PHP for additional working capital. The loan will be used to buy a variety of commodities for her existing business, which is selling a variety of food products in the local community.

loans.use: to buy variety of commodities for her grocery store

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey was been raised by a carpenter father. As he grew up, he assisted his father with carpentry works especially making furniture which has now become a source of income for Rey. 

Unable to sustain his business due to financial constraints, he signed up to Paglaum MPC for additional capital. Now that he successfully repaid all his loans without records of defaults, he has applied for an amount to expand his furniture production. 

He has asked for an amount of PHP 7,000 to purchase lumber, varnish, paints and carving tools for his furniture making business.

loans.use: to purchase lumber, varnish, paints and carving tools.

location.town: Calamba-Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Rosalin

texts.en: Rosalin, 57 years old, lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, with her husband and three children. Her husband is a construction worker. Unable to meet the needs of the family with only her husband’s income, she has found ways to attain income through snack & food vending. It began with selling a small amount of viands & snacks to their neighbors. She joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari (small grocery) store in January of 2006.
