She became a microfinance member, which is why she has received loans several times already. Now, she is applying for 20,000 PHP to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store. She hopes that her business will continue and some day become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store

loans.name: John Nicolas

texts.es:
John es un trabajador de metales ubicado en la zona de Montelibano, una tierra pujante que está cambiando su cara gracias a las personas emprendedoras y honestas que buscan que miren su municipio como una tierra de oportunidades y llena de gente guerrera.

Montó hace tres años su negocio de cerrajería ofreciendo soluciones rápidas, en todo lo relacionado con cerrojos, su experiencia adquirida en otras empresas le ha permitido desarrollar una de las principales cualidades la cual es fabricación de llaves sin copia, a partir de una chapa de llave.

Su principal ventaja en el mercado es que en Montelibano no hay muchos negocios parecidos, permitiéndole tener buen volumen de clientes, pero este  a su vez es su principal problema ya que no posee los recursos económicos para dar abasto a sus clientes, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de cerraduras, llaves, metales para potenciar su negocio y valerse solo de ahora en adelante.
texts.en:
John is a metal worker in the Montelibano zone, a thriving area that is changing thanks to the enterprising and honest people that see their municipality as a zone of opportunity full of fighters.  

He began a locksmith business three years ago, which offers quick solutions in everything having to do with locks.  The experience he gained in other businesses has allowed him to develop a principal quality, which is the creation of duplicate keys without a sheet copy.  

His main advantage is that there aren't many similar businesses in Montelibano, which allows him to have a good client volume. This is also his main problem, because he doesn't have the economic resources to meet the demands of his clients.  For this reason he wants a loan to buy locks, keys and metals which will strengthen his business and he will be able to make use of from this point on.

loans.use: to buy locks, keys, and metals to strengthen his business and make use of from this moment on.

loans.name: Meylin Jose

texts.es:
La travesía de Meylin ha sido bastante larga, pero llena de trabajos y oportunidades que le han permitido estar adonde está ahora. A sus 28 años, ya ha trabajado en Costa Rica en los plantíos de piña, pues quería independizarse, luego de haber trabajado por años con su padre sembrando trigo, maíz y frijoles. Estando en nuestro país vecino, ahorró todo lo que pudo para regresar luego a Nicaragua para comprar dos vacas y construir su propia casa. Ahora es un ejemplo a seguir para sus hermanos y de gran apoyo para su esposa.
Este agricultor y ganadero ya lleva más de diez años como agricultor y ganadero, por lo que le gusta estar pendientes de su negocio. Por esta razón, solicita un préstamo para comprar pasto o alimento para vacas y para terneros que pronto desea vender. Esto le permitirá tener una mejor producción de leche, además que el cuido de su ganado será el recomendado y así poder tener más ingresos en la venta de estos mismos. En sus planes está seguir invirtiendo en el desarrollo de su ganado.
texts.en:
Meylin’s journey has been a long one but full of work and opportunities that have allow him to get where he is right now. At his 28 years old he has already worked in Costa Rica in the pineapple plantations because he wanted to be independent after working for years alongside his father sowing wheat, corn and beans. 

While being in the neighboring country he saved all that he could with the purpose of returning to Nicaragua, buy two cows and build his own house. Now he is an example to follow for his siblings and is of great help for his wife. 

This farmer and stockbreeder has been doing these activities for over 10 years. He likes to look after his business all the time. It is because of this that he is requesting a loan to buy feed for his cows and calves that he wishes to sell soon. This will allow him to improve his milk production and the care of his cattle, and in this way increase his incomes when he sells both of these products. His plan is to keep investing in his cattle.

loans.use: to buy feed for his cows and calves.

loans.name: Elvis Manuel

texts.es: La falta de oportunidades de emplearse, obligo al señor Elvis a buscar alternativas para generar recursos. Él encontró en la venta de ropa una alternativa para llevar el alimento diario de su hogar, pero se siente desilusionado pues tiene todas las ganas y sueño de crecer pero la falta de capital ha sido su principal impedimento, por ello acude a una ayuda financiera con el ánimo de comprar surtido de ropa al por mayor para vender un buen volumen de prendas y así llevar más dinero a su hogar.
texts.en: The lack of employment opportunities forced Mr. Elvis to look for alternative ways to generate resources. He found, in clothing sales, an alternative to bring home the daily food for his home. However, he feels disillusioned because he has the desire and the dream of growing, but the lack of capital has been his main impediment. This is the reason he has resorted to requesting financial help with the intention of purchasing clothing inventory at wholesale prices in order to sell a good amount of clothes and in dong so provide more money for his home.

loans.use: purchase wholesale clothing inventory

loans.name: Mardilina

texts.en: Mardilina is driven by passion in selling. At the age of 64, a married woman in Sapang Ama, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, she runs a store that primarily supports her family. She never gets tired of tending her store. Mardilina is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has received several loans already. She always meets her obligations and has no record of default. Now, she has borrowed another loan to buy inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell

location.town: Calamba-Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Justo

texts.en: Justo, 51, is married with three adult children. He lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Justo is a hardworking farmer and a loving father to his children. He is a barangay (small administrative unit) official and has served his barangay with honesty. His wish is to send his children to school until they finish college and land a good job. He doesn't want to see his children doing back breaking work tilling and cultivating land like he does to provide their needs. As he recalls, everything has been made possible with the financial support extended by Paglaum MPC to farmers like him. To start the next cropping season, he requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to pay for land preparation like plowing and harrowing and to purchase a good variety of seedlings for a more productive harvest.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation and to purchase seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Sarun's Group

texts.en:
A 41-year-old mother of five dependent children and only one of them is in school. Nowadays, she is living in Battambang province. To overcome her family’s hardship, she raises pigs for sales and working on her co-villager’s farm for fee about ten years. Due to her pigs did not grow well, it caused her to have not enough money to support her businesses. 

Sarun has been with VisionFund for nine cycles already and completely paid back her past loans. Through those loans, her family’s living condition is better than before and she is able to save around 15,000KHR each day after offsetting her family’s expense. 

Now Sarun is leading a group of two to apply for a new Kiva loan via VisionFund to renovate her old house and take the rest of money to buy more piglets and pig feed to expand her current business. She hopes to earn more income and have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to renovate her old house and take the rest of money to buy more piglets and pig feed to expand her current business.

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es:
Yessica es una amable, carismática, servicial, sonriente joven de 23 años de edad, la cual se desempeña como artesa, adoptó esta actividad para poder pagar sus estudios universitarios ya que proviene de una familia humilde, pero su deseo de ser alguien en la vida de cambiar su realidad fue mayor y por ello en base a unos estudios y enseñanzas que adquirió de conocidos comenzó la elaboración de bisutería artesanal.

Su sueño y mayor anhelo es continuar sus estudios universitarios y de ello depende su actividad económica, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de materiales, accesorios, piedras, cueros y demás para la elaboración de sus productos.
texts.en:
Yessica is a friendly, charismatic, helpful, smiling 23-year-old.  She is an artisan. She started this business to pay for her university studies because she comes from a humble family. Her desire to be someone in life and change her reality was great.  Through some studies and training, she acquired knowledge to start making artisanal jewelry.

Her dream is to continue her university studies. To achieve this goal, she depends on her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials like accessories, stones, leather and other items to make her products.

loans.use: purchase materials like accessories, stones, leather and other items to make jewelry.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is so grateful that for the past five years she has repeatedly received loans that really sustained and grew her direct selling business. She has always repaid her loans promptly. Her income helped cover her family's basic needs and school requirements for her children. Now she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to buy more undergarments, shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, and fabric softener to sell in her business. Margie's dream, just like any other Filipina mother, is to see her children earn a college degree to allow them better opportunities in life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship, CCT* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
 
*CCT is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered on the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: to buy personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Olga Mery

texts.es:
Olga es una dama de 41 años de edad, de esas personas sonrientes, optimistas que se levantan con una sonrisa dibujada en su rostro, a despachar su pareja e hijos, se dispone a realizar los que hacer del hogar y una vez termina atiende su negocio de cría de aves y venta de huevos, es una mujer muy organizada que poco a poco va ganando terreno en el mercado. 

Olga trabaja por un sueño, uno humilde que es pagar la educación de sus dos hijos, tener un hogar estable donde no falte el alimento e ir adquiriendo cosas conforme su negocio se lo permita.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de 100 pollos y concentrado (alimento de los pollos, para engorde), al por mayor.

Este préstamo será un impulso bastante significativo para su negocio ya que aumentara considerablemente los animales en su galpón.
texts.en:
Olga is a 41 year old dame, she is one of those smiling, optimist people who wake up with a smile drawn on their face ready to get her partner and children ready for the day. She tends to the household chores and when she finishes she tends to her poultry raising and egg sales business. She is a very organized woman who little by little is gaining territory in the market. 

Olga works for her dream, a humble one, to pay for the education of her two children, have a stable home where there is no want for food and slowly acquire things as her business allows it. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase 100 chicks and concentrate (chick food for fattening) at wholesale prices. This loan will represent a significant boost for her business since it will increase considerably the animals in her shed.

loans.use: purchase 100 chicks and concentrate (chick food for fattening) at wholesale prices

loans.name: Wiguna Merta Group

texts.en:
This is the 10th loan for the Wiguna Merta group over 5 years. From the beginning, they formed a pig breeder group, and now they are succeeding at expanding their business in farming. The group's main goals are to become successful pig breeders and also successful farmers.

To make their goals come true, after making their payment, they will continue their loan to increase the number of pigs and maximize the harvest in their gardens. The Wiguna Merta group, which includes seven members, will receive the loan of 10,500,000 IDR, and they will use it to buy superior piglets, seed, insecticide and fertilizer.

After succeeding with her pigs and her corn garden, Ni Nengah continues her loan and now will use it for piglets, nut seed and fertilizer. Now is it the dry season, which is why she decided to plant nuts in her garden.

The group said they are grateful for the support they have had from lenders, Kiva and MUK. They hope all the businesses run well and that the profit can make their families happy.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, nut seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en: Socorro, 52, is married and has three children. She sells vegetables and meat to earn an income. She wants to improve her sales but has insufficient funds to buy more inventory. She is now asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy fish, chicken, meat and vegetables to sell. She wants to continue offering good products and services to all her customers. She hopes to save money for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy fish, chicken, meat and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, de 28 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar, tienen tres hijos que aún viven con él y todos son menores de edad. 

Luis, se dedica a vender dulces, maní y agua de coco en las calles y en los buses, se dedica a vender desde hace más de 12 años.- Anteriormente, trabajaba en la agricultura, su hermano ya trabajaba en ese rubro y le enseño el oficio, pero con lo que trabajaba no le ajustaba para sustentar a su familia, por esa razón decidió dedicarse a vender dulces.- El lugar donde trabaja está a un kilómetro y viaja en bicicleta, su esposa le ayuda a preparar el maní y él se levanta a trabajar a las cinco de la mañana y trabaja hasta las cinco de la tarde.

Luis, necesita el crédito para comprar una vaca y para comprar más variedades de dulces, con lo que podrá seguir vendiendo y mejorando los ingresos económicos, para poder atraer mayor cantidad de clientes. 

Luis, espera que su negocio crezca y en un futuro ampliarlo más; además desea poder darle a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar.
texts.en:
Luis is 28 years old. He has a fifth-grade education. He is married and his wife takes care of household tasks. They have three children who live with them since they are young. 

Luis sells sweets, peanuts, and coconut water on the streets and buses. He has had this business for more than 12 years. Previously, he worked in farming. His brother currently works in this field and taught him those skills. However, it was not enough to support his family. For this reason, he decided to sell sweets. The area where he works is a kilometer from home and he travels on a bike.  His wife helps him by preparing the peanuts. He wakes up to work at five in the morning and works until five at night. 

Luis needs the loan to purchase a cow and a greater variety of sweets. He will be able to continue selling products and improving his earnings in order to attract more customers. 

Luis hopes that her business grows and expands more. In addition, he wants to give his children the opportunity to study.

loans.use: purchase a cow and a greater variety of candies.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine lived in Tuao with her family. She is selling vegetables for income. She wants to improve her sales, but does not have sufficient funds to revolve in her business. She is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy vegetables, fish and meat to sell. 

She hopes to keep improving her sales for additional profits. She will save additional revenue for her family's emergency needs.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fish and meat to sell

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy finds pleasure in her gardening activities. Not only is she doing her hobby, but she earns an income as well. At the age of 26 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. 

Joy grabbed the opportunity to become a full pledge member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). She credits the cooperative for the capital needed to support her gardening activities. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. 

In the future, Joy wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns as well.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizer

loans.name: Sybel

texts.en:
Sybel is a 47-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Sybel has a personal care products business in the Philippines. Sybel requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more personal care products to offer for sale.

Sybel has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Sybel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more personal care products to offer for sale.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is the responsible mother of 1 child. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for ten years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his vehicle is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to do the necessary repairs. Therefore, Shaheen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Shaheen's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide the better transport facilities to earn profitable income. Shaheen also plans to make savings with the profits from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Shaheen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband repair his taxi.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn works hard to support seven children. She is married and has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines.

Roselyn requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Roselyn is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alexis Sheldon is 19 years old and is the second of four children in the family. His mother, Alma, supports the family through her food-vending business in the Philippines.

Alexis Sheldon is studying to earn a Bachelor of Science in Information Technology and is currently in the first year of this two-year course.

Alma is borrowing PHP 12,000 to pay the tuition fees of her son Alexis Sheldon for the first semester of the school year 2015-16.

When he graduates, Alexis Sheldon plans be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 42-year-old woman, mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession. He sells apples, bananas, grapes, etc. Her husband is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Shahida's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. Due to an unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in a position to purchase fruits for his business.

Therefore, Shahida has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purposes.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his fruit business.

loans.name: Aladino Manuel

texts.es:
Aladino es un enérgico hombre de 33 años de edad, el cual se gana la vida vendiendo frutas que ubica en una carroza la cual empuja por las calles de Planetica Rica, Aladino  vende las frutas que están en cosechan, por ejemplo está temporada está distribuyendo mamoncillo (fruta pequeña color verde), mango, fruta que vemos en vaso, junto al cliente y la manzana de agua que es la fruta color rojo.

Este estilo de vida le significa los ingresos suficientes para el sostenimiento de su hogar, este hombre aspira a tener un local propio y distribuir un mayor número de frutas y vegetales, pues a pesar de vivir en una zona de gran potencial agrícola, la mayoría de los vegetales y frutas los importan de otros municipios.

Solicita un préstamo para disponer de capital de trabajo para la compra de frutas y verduras, pronto saldrá la temporada de aguacate y quiere estar listo para abastecer su carreta y como todos los días salir a vender hasta lograr llevar la carreta vacía a su casa.
texts.en:
Aladino is an energetic 33 year old man who earns a living selling fruit in a cart that he pushes through the streets of Planetica Rica.  Aladino sells fruits that are in season, for example in this season he is selling mamoncillos (small green fruits), mango (the fruit usually seen in a glass with the client) and water apple (the red fruit).  

This lifestyle means he has sufficient income to sustain his home.  He aspires to have his own shop and distribute a larger number of fruits and vegetables, because even though his lives in a zone with great agricultural potential, the majority of the fruits and vegetables are imported from other municipalities.  

He requests a loan to have the work capital to buy fruits and vegetables, as the avocado season is coming and he wants to be ready to supply his cart and go out every day to sell until he can return home with an empty cart.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables, as the avocado season is approaching and he wants to be ready to supply his cart.

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.es:
Por más de once años, Gumercinda trabaja en como agrocultora y ganadera. Años que le han venido poniendo su nombre en alto, por lo que constantemente está invirtiendo en su negocio. Anteriormente había solicitado un préstamo para comprar abonos y otros insumos para su cosecha, los resultados fueron muy positivos y pudo cultivar y vender todo lo plantado en esa época. De manera que agradece a todas las personas que le ayudaron con ese crédito, que la ha ayudado a crecer. 
Ahora Gumercinda quiere invertir en su ganado, pues es otra fuente de ingresos muy importante para ella. Por esta razón, solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar rollos de alambre para reparar las cercas de su finca, de manera que esto le ayudará a cuidar más sus vacas y terneros que más adelante piensa vender. Ella sueña con ver su finca bien estructurada con una vista suculenta llena de cultivos de maíz y lleva de vacas.
texts.en:
For more than 11 years, Gumercinda has worked as a farmer and cattle raiser.  These years have raised her name's profile, so she is always investing in her business.  Previously, she had requested a loan to buy compost and other materials for the harvest, and results were very positive; she was able to cultivate and sell everything planted in that season.  She thanks all those who helped her with that loan, and helped her to grow.  

Currently, Gumercinda wants to invest in her cattle, which is another important source of income for her.  For this reason, she requests a new loan to buy rolls of wire to repair the fences on her farm, which will allow her to better care for the cows and calves that she will later think of selling.  She dreams of seeing her farm as well-structured, with a  succulent view of corn plants and full of cattle.

loans.use: to buy rolls of wire.

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en:
Nazeeran is a 52-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her son and two daughters. Her husband has been running his own business selling clothes for four years. Her husband is solely responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. 

Nazeeran's husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore, Nazeeran is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This way, she can assist her husband in purchasing these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband will be able to increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 

Nazeeran is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's clothing busiess

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business. In addition, she also operates a cashew nut business at the market.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer, muy emprendedora, desde temprana edad, ella encontró amor al trabajo. Ahora tiene treinta  y un años de edad, tiene su propio negocio de venta de productos plásticos, también brinda sus servicios de estilista en una sala de belleza. Antes incursiono en la venta de ropa y calzado, pero, descubrió que los productos plásticos era un negocio más rentable. 
Ella, ha recurrido a Kiva junto a MiCrédito, para que se le otorgue un préstamo que le permita surtirse de nuevos productos, que sus clientes demandan, y comprar cubiertos, platos, bolsas para basura, bandejas, todos de plástico. En un futuro desea poner otra tienda donde venda variedades de belleza, además planea estudiar y seguir utilizando sus dotes en la belleza.
texts.en:
Martha is a very enterprising woman who from a young age found love in work.  She is now 31 years old and has her own business selling plastic products and she provides stylist services in a hair salon.  She previously tried selling clothing and footwear, but discovered that plastic products are a more profitable business.  

She has returned to Kiva together with MiCrédito to obtain a loan that permits her to stock new products that her clients demand, and buy plastic silverware, plates, and trash bags.  In the future she hopes to have another store where she sells beauty products.  Furthermore, she plans to study and continue using her skills in beauty.

loans.use: to buy plastic silverware, plates and bags for trash.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is a 40 year-old-woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past 18 years. Her husband is only responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family. 

Nusrat's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities (e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items) for his business purposes. But due to financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable position to buy all of the above products for reselling purposes. Therefore, Nusrat has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and also earn maximum profitable income to manage his household and business. 

Nusrat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: increase her husband's general store business

loans.name: Bendia 27 (2) Group

texts.fr: Haoua, âgée de 39 ans marié sans enfant. Elle exerce son activité depuis 7 ans. Ce qui fait marcher son activité c’est le respect, la qualité de la marchandise. Elle veut le prêt pour acheter le matériel pour fabriquer du savon à 175 000. L’utilité du prêt c’est de s’approvisionner en quantité suffisante le matériel pour la fabrication du savon afin de satisfaire ses clients. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt une fois et à rembourser à la date prévue.
texts.en: Haoua is a 39-year-old married woman who has no children. She has been working this business for seven years. Her business does well because of respect and the quality of her goods. She is requesting this loan so she can purchase the materials to make soap, totalling at 175,000 FCFA. This loan will be used to stock up on sufficient supplies of the materials she needs to make soap so she can satisfy her customers. She has already received one loan previously and she paid it back on time.

loans.use: to purchase the materials to make soap, totalling at 175,000 FCFA

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem’s husband owns a metal shop, in which he sells metal goods, in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

His residence is near to the shop. His shop is situated in the metal market, which is a very crowded place. He uses a wooden manual trolley to carry the metal goods from one place to another. His trolley has broken due to loading and unloading. He wants to buy a new trolley, but his pocket does not allow him. 

Therefore, Tasleem requested a loan from Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to buy a wooden trolley to carry the metal goods.

Tasleem is the age of 35, a mother of a kid and living in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner’s BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a wooden trolley to carry metal goods from one place to another.

loans.name: Jharol Andres

texts.es:
Jharol, a sus 19 años de edad, es soltero. Ha vivido toda su vida en el campo con sus padres aprendiendo estos menesteres, con el paso del tiempo ha adquirido mucha experiencia. 

Tomó la decisión de independizarse y montar su propia cría de cerdos. Es por ello que solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que comprará cerdos, alimento para los mismos y materiales para la construcción de un galpón, esto le permitirá dar inicio a su proyecto productivo con el que espera mejorar los ingresos económicos.


Jharol manifiesta que su propósito es trabajar con constancia y empeño, aprovechar al máximo su experiencia para ir fortaleciendo y ampliando su negocio y, en un futuro sueña con convertirlo en un negocio muy exitoso y prospero.
texts.en:
Jharol is 19 years old and single. He has lived his whole life in the country with his parents learning skills. With the passage of time, he has acquired lots of experience. 

He made the decision to become independent and raise his own pigs. For this reason, he is requesting support from a loan to purchase pigs, food for the animals and materials necessary to build a barn. This will allow him to start his project which he hopes will improve his earnings. 

Jharol states that his purpose is to work with perseverance and determination and make the most of his experience to strengthen and expand his business. In the future, he dreams about his business becoming very successful and prosperous.

loans.use: start a business raising pigs.

loans.name: Chanura Lup Group

texts.en:
Sana is a mother of three children and owns a petty shop in her locality in Manipal. She started her own business with a small capital in order to support her family. Her husband is a cultivator who earns INR 5,500 per month. With this income, they cannot keep up with their family expenses. Sana’s petty shop business earns a profit of INR 100 to 150 per day. Due to a lack of capital funds, she cannot expand her business.

An expansion in her business would increase her income by INR 1,500 per month, so she decided to form a group consisting of five members coming from the same economic conditions and decided to avail a loan. She will use the loan to purchase and sell cereals, cosmetics, detergent powder, biscuits, etc. It will help the petty shop expand its business.

Lata, Kunje, Angangcha and Tombisana (the rest of the members of the group) also engage in income generation activities. They too run their own businesses in Manipur. Just like Sana, they lack the funds to expand their respective businesses. A loan will help the group members expand their businesses and enhance their income earning capacity. Together they seek a loan of INR 40,000. They thank their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase items such as cereals, cosmetics, etc. to expand her petty shop business.

loans.name: Yeelenbora 2 Group

texts.fr: Hedwise est âgée de 38 ans mariée mère de 6 ans. Elle exerce son activité depuis 10 ans. Ce fait marcher son activité ce sont : le respect de la clientèle, et la qualité de la marchandise. Elle veut le prêt pour acheter des pagnes (20 pagnes) à 100 000 fcfa. L’utilité du prêt c’est d’approvisionner son commerce en quantité suffisante afin de satisfaire sa clientèle. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt une fois et à rembourser à la date prévue.
texts.en: Hedwise is a 38-year-old married mother to a six-year-old child. She has been carrying out this activity for 10 years. Her business does well because she has the respect of her customers and she sells quality goods. She is requesting this loan so she can purchase 20 sheets of traditional pagne cloth for 100,000 FCFA. This loan will be used to stock up on enough supplies so she can satisfy her customers. She has already received one loan previously and she paid it back on time.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sheets of traditional pagne cloth for 100,000 FCFA

loans.name: Erika

texts.en:
Erika is a hardworking, woman entrepreneur with three children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like pig raising. Erika dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 40 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of goods to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

Ailyn has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice as well as from pig raising.

Ailyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of goods to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married with four  children three of whom attend school while the other one is still young for schooling. They live at their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a khanga (women's wraparoud cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khanga’s for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale

loans.name: Evelyn Jacqueline

texts.es:
Desde muy pequeña, Evelyn recuerda cuando ayudaba a su mamá vendiendo comida en un mercado capitalino. La experiencia fue más que suficiente para desde hace seis años ella decidiera emprender en su pulpería que va con pasos firmes. Anteriormente ella había solicitado un préstamo con el comprar materiales escolares, que le sirvieron de mucho por la entrada a clases y obtuvo grandes ganancias. De manera que agradece a todas las personas que le ayudaron con ese préstamo que le ayudó a crecer. 
Ahora con la motivación de su familia se siente segura para seguir adelante con nuevas inversiones a su negocio, por lo que Evelyn solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar huevos, gaseosas, arroz, frijoles, jugos, entre otros productos de alta demanda. Esto le permitirá tener un negocio completo con productos que tanto necesitan los compradores. En sus metas está llegar a tener una gran distribuidora e invertir en la estructura de su hogar.
texts.en:
Evelyn remembers when, from a very young age, she used to help her mom sell food in a market in the capital. The experience was more than enough for her to decide six years ago to start her own small grocery store, which is making great strides. Previously, she had requested a loan to buy school supplies, which would do very well because of the start of classes, and she earned a large profit. So she thanks all the people who helped her with that loan, which helped her to grow.

Now, motivated by her family, she feel secure moving ahead with new investments at her shop. So Evelyn is requesting a new loan to buy eggs, soft drinks, rice, beans, and juices, among other high-demand products. This will allow her to have a complete business with the products that her shoppers need so much. Among her goals is to have a large business and to invest in the structure of her house.

loans.use: to buy eggs, soft drinks, rice, beans, and juices, among other products

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman and staying together with her husband and four children. She owns a house that  has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses is food . 

For the past three years, she has operated a firewood selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of theft in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale supplier of firewood in the village. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood for resale

loans.name: Samath

texts.en:
Samath is 43 years old and a married mother of two small children, living in Kratie province. 

The sources of her family’s income are from cassava farming, feeding pigs, and teaching a small child in return for a fee. She has been involved in these businesses for 25 years and they earn her about KHR 22,000 per day. She is able to save about KHR 10,000 each day, after offsetting her family’s expenses. 

Since her crop was destroyed by a flood, it causes her to have insufficient funds to do farming for this season. Now Samath has decided to take a Kiva loan, via VisionFund Cambodia, to buy fertilizer. She will use the rest of money to buy more piglets to raise, to generate additional income. She hopes to earn more income and upgrade her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and use the rest of money to buy more piglets to raise, to generate more income.

loans.name: Panthoibi Group

texts.en:
Thoibi, is a 41-year-old entrepreneur who leads a group of 5 ambitious women. She is married to a cultivator and is the mother of a teenage child. Thoibi runs a tea stall in Manipur. She started her own business in order to support her family as her husband's income was not sufficient to afford the household monthly expenses. Out of the household monthly income of Rs.8,000, Rs. 6,000 is spent on the family expenses. 

Barely managing with the current income, she decided it was time for her to look for ways to increase her income. She realised that if her stall could sell a variety of items, other than tea, she would be able to bring home the required income. But she lacks the capital to invest in her business. Hence she has decided to take a loan so she can sell items such as momos, cutlets, chowmein, etc. and expand her income. She believes that this expansion could double her income.

Thoibi is joined by 4 other women who also seek a loan to expand their businesses. Thoibi, Tampha, Kuppi, Binarani and Ashalata need a loan of Rs. 60,000. Tampha needs the loan to expand her weaving business while Kuppi, Binarani and Ashalata need the loan to expand their petty shops. They are grateful to their lenders.

loans.use: To expand her tea stall business and sell momos, cutlets, etc.

loans.name: Koko Délali

texts.fr: Kokoé  est mariée et mère deux enfants. Habitant à Kodjoviakopé, Kokoé  fait le commerce des oignons et œufs dans son quartier. Kokoé s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché pour avoir ses produits. Ce crédit lui permettra de satisfaire le nombre croissant de ses clients et augmenter les revenus pour s’occuper favorablement des charges de la famille.
texts.en: Kokoé is married and has two children. She lives in Kodjoviakopé and sells onions and eggs in her neighborhood. Kokoé stocks up on goods twice a month. This loan will allow her to meet the growing customer demand and increase her revenues in order to be able to provide for family needs in a decent way.

loans.use: to buy 100 egg crates.

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Mao is a 49 years old mother of four children and one of them is dependent child whom she needs to look after. Mao is a rural villager living in Battambang province. Selling porridge is the main source of her family’s income for more than five years and she also spends her free time to work on her co-villager’s farm for a fee. To overcome her family’s hardship, her husband drives motor taxi to earn additional income to support her family. 

Mao has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for two cycles already and completely paid back her past loans. Those loans help her to have a better living condition. But now her business is getting not well by having lower customers and this is the main challenge for her family. 

Due to lacking of working capital, she is now leading a group to apply for a new loan to buy porridge’s ingredient to support her current business. She hopes this loan will help her to earn more income and expand her current business.

loans.use: to apply for a new loan to buy porridge’s ingredient to support her current business.

loans.name: Mon's Group

texts.en:
Mon is a 61-year-old mother of four children, and one among them is a dependent child who she needs to take care of; they live in Kampong Cham province. 

To overcome her family’s hardship, she grows cassava and cashews to sell so she can earn income to support her family. She has been involved in these businesses for forty-three years. In the previous season, her crop has not grown well and it was destroyed by insects, which is the main challenge for her. 

In order to improve her family’s standard of living, she is now leading a group to apply for a Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy a decent latrine for her family. 

She hopes to improve both her family's health and standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine for her family.

loans.name: Andrés

texts.es:
Andrés está casado y tiene 7 hijos bajo su cargo a sus 52 años Andrés sigue siendo el líder de la familia y la economía familiar depende de sus cafetales que actualmente se han visto seriamente afectados por las plagas y  la edad por lo que Andrés ve un buena oportunidad para replantar sus cafetales y convertirlos a producción orgánica, Andrés sueña con poder dejarles un pequeño patrimonio a sus 4 hijos para que no tengan que pasar por las duras situaciones que el ah tenido que pasar. 
La producción de café orgánico es algo novedoso en la región ya que ayuda proteger la biodiversidad de la región, a hacer la finca más sostenible, mejora la productividad y ayuda a optar a mejores mercados para el café, con las ganancias de su producción Andrés espera poder tener una mejor calidad de vida con toda su familia.
Andrés esta alegre ya que ve una oportunidad en el deterioro de sus cafetales para hacer algo bueno para él y para el planeta, es por eso que él está solicitando un crédito para replantar y certificar 1.5 hectáreas con el crédito el comprara todos los materiales necesarios para la replantación.
Un crédito ayudaría a Andrés a tener mejores oportunidades de mercado para su café y al mismo tiempo a mejorar su calidad de vida con las ganancias del producto orgánico vendido.
texts.en:
Andrés is married and has seven children under his care. At 52 years old Andrés continues to be the leader of the family and the family economy depends on his coffee crops which were severely damaged by virus and age. So Andrés sees this as a good opportunity to replant his coffee crops and convert them to organic production. Andrés dreams of being able to leave a small inheritance for his four children so that they don't have to go through the difficult situations he experienced.

Organic production of coffee is something of a novelty in the region as it protects the area's bio-diversity, makes the farms more sustainable, improves production and helps to select better markets for the coffee. With the profits from his production Andrés hopes to be able to provide a higher quality of living for all his family.

Andrés is pleased that he can see an opportunity in the deterioration of his coffee crops to do something good for himself and for the planet. So he is requesting a loan to replant and certify 1.5 hectares. He will buy all the materials needed to replant with the loan.

The loan will help Andrés to have better opportunities in the market for his coffee and at the same time improve his quality of living with the profits from the organic product when sold.

loans.use: to buy organic manure, organic pesticide, coffee plants and live barriers to conserve the soil, to convert his coffee plantation to organic production.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 49 years old and married with nine children, three of whom are in school. Josefina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, chips, milk, sugar, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc.

Josefina has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, Josefina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, chips, milk, sugar, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Angelita works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling chicken.

Angelita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, spices and other frozen products for her food vending business.

Angelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, spices and other frozen products.

loans.name: Ronelyn

texts.en:
Ronelyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional stock of household goods to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures, like buying and selling rice.

Ronelyn dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Meorn's Group

texts.en:
Meorn, 50, is a married father of seven children and only four of them are in school. He is a rural villager living in Kampong Cham province. His family’s living has been depending on cassava and rice farming for 32 years. Unfortunately, his crop has not grown well and its price was decreased in the market, which is the main challenge for him in earning income to support his family.

Due to not having enough money to build a private toilet for his family, he is now leading a group of five members to apply for a Kiva loan via VisionFund. This is the first loan cycle for him. As a group leader, he will use his loan portion to buy a decent latrine. Actually, he hopes that this loan will help him to upgrade his family’s living and health.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine to upgrade his family’s living and health.

loans.name: Marlon Benjamin

texts.es:
Marlon, es dueño de una carpintería, aprendió de amistades el oficio, actualmente ya tiene su propio negocio y un amigo le ayuda a realizar los trabajos, convive con su esposa y  sus hijos, solamente trabajando en la carpintería genera ingresos para cumplir con sus obligaciones.
Con el financiamiento básicamente comprara una cierra eléctrica y otros materiales para la carpintería, mejorara su equipo para agilizar el trabajo y atender mejor a sus clientes, su esperanza es seguir trabajando para salir adelante junto a su familia.
Sus deseos son resarcir la deuda, ampliar su negocio y que su familia tenga mejores oportunidades de desarrollo.
texts.en:
Marlon owns a carpentry shop. He learned the trade from friends and now has his own business; a friend helps him to carry out the work. He lives with his wife and children and generates income, through his work in the carpentry shop, to meet their expenses.

With the loan Marlon will buy an electric saw and other materials for the carpentry shop; he will improve his equipment in order to speed up his work and provide his customers with a better service. His hope is to continue working so as to get ahead with his family. He wants to repay the debt, expand his business and give his family better opportunities for development.

loans.use: to buy an electric saw and other materials for the carpentry shop, and improve his equipment in order to speed up his work

loans.name: Ruben Dario

texts.es:
Ruben es un hombre muy emprendedor y creativo, desde hace mucho tiempo ha querido ser independiente y tener su propio negocio de barbería y estética.

Actualmente puede materializar su sueño gracias su gran capacidad de trabajo, al apoyo que recibe de la Corporación Interactuar y de las personas que deseen que él salga adelante con su negocio. Manifiesta que es una muy buena idea y que se siente con la capacidad de hacer de éste un negocio sostenible.

De este negocio dependerán él y su esposa. Solicita un apoyo económico para comprar sillas de peluquería, vitrinas y un ventilador ya que cuenta con algunos insumos y herramientas de trabajo.

Con un préstamo podrás a poyar a un joven lleno de vida y empuje para salir adelante!
581027	1073988166
texts.en:
Ruben is a very enterprising and creative man. For a long time he has wanted to be independent and have his own barber shop and beauty salon.

Right now he can make his dream a reality thanks to his great capacity for work, the help he is receiving from Corporación Interactuar and from the people who want him to get ahead with his business. It is plainly a good idea and he feels capable of making this a sustainable business.

He and his wife would depend on this business. He is requesting economic support to buy hairdressing chairs, display cases and a fan as he already has some supplies and work tools.

You can support this young man full of life and drive to get ahead with a loan.

loans.use: to buy hairdressing chairs, display cases and a fan as he already has some supplies and work tools.

loans.name: Thay's Group

texts.en:
Thay is 41 years old and a married mother of four children, three of whom are in school. She is a rural villager, living in Mondulkiri province. 

To overcome her family’s hardship, Thay grows cassava on three hectares of farmland and works on her co-villager’s farm to earn additional income to support her family. Her crop has not grown well and it causes her to get a lower return than she expected. 

Thay has been with VisionFund Cambodia for one cycle already and she has fully paid back her past loan. She has better living conditions as a result of the past loan and she is able to earn about KHR 33,300 per day and save about KHR 11,000 each day. 

Now, Thay is leading a group to take a new loan to buy pesticide to protect her farm from being destroyed by insects. She hopes her crop will grow well and that she will gain a higher yield.

loans.use: to buy pesticide to protect her farm from being destroyed by insects.

loans.name: Bunrouen's Group

texts.en:
Bunrouen is age 35 years old and a married mother of a small child. She is a rural villager living in Mondulkiri province. To overcome her family’s hardship, Bunrouen grows cassava on two hectares farmland and works on her co-villager’s farm to earn additional income to support her family. Her crop has not grown well and it causes her to get a lower return than she expected.

Bunrouen has been with VisionFund for two cycles already and she has fully paid back her past loan. She has a better living condition through the past loans.

Now she is leading a group to take a new loan to buy pesticide to protect her farm from being destroying by insects.

She hopes her crop will grow well and increase her yield.

loans.use: to buy pesticides to protect her farm from being destroying by insects.

loans.name: Sivon's Group

texts.en:
Sivon is 60 years old and a married mother of a small child. She is a rural villager living in Kratie province. To overcome her family’s hardship, Sivon sells Khmer traditional medicine and grows rice to sell to earn additional income to support her family.

Sivon has been with VisionFund for three cycles already and she has fully paid back her past loans. She has a better living condition through the past loan.

Due to lack of funds, she is now leading a group to take a new loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, to pay for a plowing fee and take the rest of money to buy more Khmer traditional medicine to sell.

She hopes her crop will grow well and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, to pay for a plowing fee and take the rest of money to buy more Khmer traditional medicine to sell.

loans.name: Alamissi

texts.fr: Agée de 55 ans, Alamissi est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Alamissi vit à Tokoin pour vendre les chaussures qu’elle expose dans le quartier. Alamissi s’approvisionne au marché et demande ce crédit pour  commander des chaussures afin de  maximiser son revenu  et subvenir favorablement aux besoins quotidiens de ses enfants.
texts.en: 55-year-old Alamissi is a married mother to four children. She lives in Tokoin, where she sells shoes in her local area. Alamissi gets her supplies from market. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase more pairs of shoes so she can maximise her revenue and properly meet her children's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase 10 dozen pairs of shoes

loans.name: Dalean's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Kratie province, Dalean is 29 years old and a mother of one child. For her living, she grows cassava and rice as her main source of income. Moreover, she can get more income via growing beans and working for others for a fee. Her cassava has not grown well and she got a lower yield than last year. She has been involved her current businesses for six years.

This is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan. She got more income from her previous loan as well, to improve her living condition. She leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy organic pesticide and pay for labor fees to cut the grasses on her farmland to produce a good yield. She hopes that her cassava farm can increase her family’s income higher than before.

loans.use: to buy organic pesticide and pay for labor fees to cut the grasses on her farmland to produce a good yield.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia is thankful that she was granted a Php10,000 PHP loan which she used to buy raw ingredients needed in her food stall business. Her earnings help support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would like now to apply for Php 10,000 which she will use to buy more quantities of products like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, utensils and frozen food products to cook dishes to sell at her food stall. She is positive that her earnings will increase as she expands her business. She is thankful to the Lord and to you for the financial help that you'll extend to her.

Eulalia dreams that all her hard work will bear fruit to give her family a bright future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies

. * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is thankful that she was granted a Php 25,000 loan which she used to pay for accessories and spare parts of her jeepney. Her earnings helped cover their personal, household expenditures.

She would like to apply again for another 25,000 PHP loan which she will use to pay for registration and maintenance of her jeepney. She is thanking God for the safe trips and good turnout of her service, and the financial help, for it will surely help fund her family's everyday personal, household needs and support her child's schooling.

She prays that the Lord will keep her husband strong and healthy to be able to continue driving the jeep. She also prays to be able to save up money and buy another unit of jeepney.

She aims to give her family a more comfortable life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies

. * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance and yearly registration of her jeepney.

loans.name: Sadelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Sadelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from fishing and buying and selling rice.  Sadelyn is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, fish, etc for her restaurant business.

Sadelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 30 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah works hard to support her family. Jonah is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Jonah has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Jonah would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 30 years old and married with four children who are in school; she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap, milk, personal care products, etc..

Judith has been in this business for two years.

In the future Judith would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap, milk,  personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Jose Dionisio

texts.es:
Jose, un hombre de 64 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja y ha podido sostenerse gracias a que trabaja como productora agropecuaria en su finca. 

Solicita un crédito para iniciar su propio negocio, una pequeña empresa de cerdos los cuales criara y alimentara; la iniciativa la tomo básicamente porque desea poder tener una vejez tranquila al lado de su compañera.

Su mayor sueño es poder mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jose, a 64 years old man lives with his partner and has been able to sustain himself with his work as an agricultural producer in his farm.

He is requesting a loan to start his own business, a small business where he will raise and feed pigs. He took the initiative basically, because he wants to live peacefully into his old age next to his partner.

His main dream is to make improvements to his house.

loans.use: to start a business raising pigs

loans.name: Valeria Del Carmen

texts.en:
Valeria is 46 years old and lives in the municipality of Montería in the Atlantic Coast with her partner. She owns a store where she sell all kinds of diary consumer products, a store that she’s been running for 15 years with her partner, a business that they started because they love doing it.

She wants to increase her clients so she can have more profits and wishes that her business could be more competitive. She wants to expand her store; that’s the reason why she’s asking for a loan so she can hire employees and do some improvements to her store.

She dreams of buying a house so she and her partner can live a better quality of life. She works really hard and is looking for some support so she can accomplish her dreams; you can help her with just a loan.

loans.use: hire employees and do some improvements to her store

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en:
Sary is 33 years old and a married mother of two children; one of them is in school. She is a rural villager living in Kratie province. To overcome her family’s hardship, Sary grows cassava on two hectares farmland and works on her co-villager’s farm to earn additional income to support her family. She has been in theses business for 10 years. Her crop has grown not well and it causes her to get a lower return than expected.

Sary has been with VisionFund for one cycle already and she has fully paid back her past loan. She has a better living condition through the past loan.

Now she is leading a group to take a new loan to buy pesticide to protect her farm from being destroyed by insects.

She hopes her crop will grow well and increase her yield.

loans.use: to buy pesticide to protect her farm from being destroyed by insects.

loans.name: Hern's Group

texts.en:
Hern’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Hern does work as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Nora Irley

texts.en:
Nora is 42 years old and lives with her two daughters in the municipality of Barbosa, north of Medellín, where she has a farm and raises cattle. She started this business because her family was having some economic issues, and she decided that she would work hard to support her family. Her parents used to do the same work, so they taught her everything that she needed to know to do a good job. She wants to see her business last in time so the profits increase and she can benefit from that. She hopes one day she can offer jobs to more people to see her business grow and help those who need a way to survive.

She’s asking for a loan so she can buy some seeds and food for the animals. Nora has a lot of dreams, and she is committed to accomplishing them all. She wants to have a successful business so her daughters can keep it. She also wants to repair her house, because it is not in good condition. You can help Nora with a loan that will change her life.

loans.use: to buy some seeds and food for the animals.

loans.name: Nelie Jean

texts.en:
Nelie Jean is a hardworking entrepreneur with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from buying and selling rice.

Nelie Jean dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Sokchet's Group

texts.en:
Sokchet, 45, is a married mother of three beloved children. She is a rural villager living in the Kratie province. To overcome her family’s hardship, Sokchet grows cassava and rice and also works on her co-villager’s farm to earn additional income. 

She has worked in these businesses for twenty-seven years. Her crop has not grown well and it causes her to get lower returns than she expected. 

Sokchet has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle already and she has fully paid back her past loan. She has gained a better living condition through her past loan. She is now leading a group to take a new loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to protect her farm from insects. 

She hopes her crop will grow well and gain her more yield to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide to protect her farm from insects.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more inputs like furniture, bed sheets, mattresses and other house products

loans.name: Sreymao's Group

texts.en:
Sreymao, 31, lives with family members in a rural village of Pursat province. She is the mother of two dependent children, one of whom is in school and the other one who is too young. She can earn income to support her family’s living via rice cropping and working for others for a fee to supplement her income. Her rice did not produce a good yield because of drought.

She has been involved with her rice farm for years and she can save her daily income about 27,900 KHR per day. For Sreymao, this is her first microloan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of two, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, seeds and organic pesticide to improve her rice farmland to get a good yield. She hopes that she can earn more income from her farmland to upgrade her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and organic pesticide to improve her rice farmland to get a good yield.

loans.name: Dhailyn

texts.en:
Dhailyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her fishing business like fishing net, wood, bamboo, etc.

Dhailyn has been in this business for three years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her fishing business like fishing net, wood, bamboo, etc

loans.name: Daniela

texts.en:
Daniela is 20 years old and lives in the municipality of Bello, north of Medellín. She is a really young woman full of dreams and a hard worker. She decided to start her own business a year ago so she can support her family and go forward in life. She sells really good quality clothes and shoes for a good price. She wants to increase her profits by improving her sales, and having more to offer, so clients can have more options to choose what they want.

The problem is that right now, she doesn’t have the economic solvency to invest in her business. That’s the reason she´s asking for a loan, so she can buy inputs like pajamas and shoes. Daniela has big dreams. She’s aware of her capacities and wants to be successful in life. She knows that the best way to accomplish that is studying and preparing herself. She hopes her business lets her prepare for her professional studies. You can help Daniela to start her career on the right feet; a loan is going to let her fulfill her goals.

loans.use: to buy inputs like pajamas and shoes.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
A mother blessed with one kid living in Siem Reap province, Sina is 45 years old. To struggle with her family’s hardship, she sells porridge and dessert. Moreover, she earns extra income via pig raising. Her selling business was not as good as before, so she got a lower income than last year. She has been involved in this business for years and she can save from her daily income about 12,500 KHR per day. This is the third cycle for Sina with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has paid back her past loans completely.

With her past loans, she was able to improve her living conditions better than before. She will manage her entire loan portion to buy more land to expand on her pig-raising business to be bigger than before. She hopes that she can get more customers to buy her porridge and dessert from day to day.

loans.use: to buy more land to expand her pig-raising business to be bigger than before.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Merlina

texts.pt: A Senhora Merlina vive maritalmente na casa propria com o filho, a nora, o neto e uma sobrinha. O marido trabalha nas minas na vizinha Africa do Sul e só visita a família no final do mês. Com o presente  empréstimo pretende adquirir material de construção como, cimento e ferro. Tem sonho casar-se e ter uma casa condigna. Tem como maior desafio para casar é o dinheiro porque o amor já existe.
texts.en:
Merlina lives in a common-law marriage. She lives with her son, her daughter-in-law, her grandson and a niece in a house she owns. Her husband works in the mines of the neighboring South Africa and can only visit his family at the end of the month.

With this loan, she plans to purchase construction materials, such as cement and iron. Her dream is to get married and live in a dignified home. Her biggest challenge to get married is finding the money, because she already found love.

loans.use: to buy cement and iron.

loans.name: Jeany

texts.en:
Jeany is 50 years old and married with two children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, sugar, coffee, personal care products, etc.

Jeany has been in this business for five years.

In the future Jeany would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, sugar, coffee, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Kuvanychbek

texts.ru: Куванычбек, 49 лет, женат, есть дочь, ей 11 лет. Он ведет собственное хозяйство в качестве дохода для своей семьи, стартовав 8 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Куванычбека, в его хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, на ежедневной основе продает молоко.  Ежемесячный доход составляет около 9,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Куванычбек обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку корма для скота. Доходы от кредита Куванычбек планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и планирует накопить средства на приобретение автомобиля.
texts.en: Kuvanychbek is 49 years old, married, and has a daughter who is 11 years old. He runs his own farm to get income for his family, having started eight years ago. Thanks to Kuvanychbek's hard work, today he has two cows and sells milk on a daily basis. His monthly income is about 9,000 som (KGS). In order to develop his business further, Kuvanychbek has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 25,000 som (KGS) to buy feed for his cattle. Kuvanychbek plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in further increasing his number of domesticated livestock, and plans to save up to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy feed for his cattle in order to invest in his business.

loans.name: Pedro De Jesus

texts.es:
Con mucho empuje y perseverancia, Pedro desea iniciar un negocio de cría y levante de cerdos en su casa ubicada en el municipio de Tierra Alta.

Esta idea surge a partir de la necesidad de generar unos buenos ingresos para colaborar con el sostenimiento del hogar.

Se caracteriza por ser un joven alegre y muy colaborador, cualidades que han hecho que se gane el cariño y respeto de la gente de la vereda y, como él dice “para caminar, primero hay que gatear” y con esta frase se anima a dar inicio a este negocio.

El dinero será invertido en la compra de cerdos pequeños y en materiales para construcción de una cochera.
texts.en:
Full of drive and perseverance, Pedro would like to start a business breeding and raising pigs at his house located in the municipality of Tierra Alta.

This idea came from the need to generate good income to help sustain his household.

He is a happy and very co-operative youth, qualities which have won him the love and respect of the people of the area and as he says "in order to walk, you first have to learn to crawl". He is motivated by this sentence to start this business.

The money will be invested in buying small pigs and material to construct a pigpen.

loans.use: to buy small pigs and material to construct a pigpen.

loans.name: María Ínes

texts.es:
María, de 50 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, se casó a la edad de los dieciocho años y quedo viuda a los 39, tiene la hija menor en su casa porque está estudiando. 

María, es vendedora de productos de revista como cosméticos y perfumes, esto lo realiza desde hace 6 años y fue una amiga quien le motivo a que iniciara a vender estos productos, ahora ella vende de casa en casa por toda la comunidad donde vive y su horario es de 10:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m.

María, necesita el préstamo para pagar un pedido de productos que hizo, porque tiene que pagar todo cuando el pedido llega, con la ayuda del préstamo podrá vender más productos a sus clientes. 

María, sueña con ser una vendedora de prestigio y que su hija pueda tener más oportunidades de prepararse académicamente.
texts.en:
María is 50 years old, she studied until the sixth grade, got married at 18 and became a widow at 39. She has a young daughter in her house who is attending school.

María sells products by catalog, such as cosmetics and perfumes. She has been doing this for 6 years, a friend motivated her to start selling these products. Currently, she sells door to door in the community where she lives. She works from 10:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.

María needs the loan to pay for products she ordered, she needs to pay everything when the products arrive. With the help of this loan she will be able to sell more products to her customers.

María dreams of becoming a recognize seller and for her daughter to have more academic opportunities.

loans.use: to pay products she ordered.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena, 45, is married with six adult-age children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 8 years already. The business helped her to meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children. She is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She already availed loans previously to purchase additional stocks and now she is re-applying for a loan for her store.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Gleirden Milena

texts.en:
Gleirden is a 32-year-old, married woman who has a little daughter who is only four years old. She lives with her family in the municipality of Bello, north of Medellín. She has owned a clothing business since 2007. This is work that she loves to do and that she took classes for in order to be more professional and to offer higher quality products. 

This devoted mother previously worked for other companies doing their clothing, but now she wants to start her own line to gain more independence and success. Accordingly, she wants to invest in her business so that she can do that. She’s asking for a loan so that she can buy a cutting machine that she needs to do the clothes for her line.

She dreams of paying for her daughter’s education so that she can have a good quality of life. She also wants to do some repairs to her house because it’s not in good condition. You can help Gleirden to accomplish all of her dreams with a loan.

loans.use: to buy a cutting machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beverages, sugar, eggs and milk to resell in his store.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru: Гулнара, 44 года, замужем, она мать 3 детей. У Гулнары среднее образование, она более 6 лет занимается торговлей женской одеждой на рынке. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 18,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) с целью развития ее бизнеса, а именно, на запрошенную сумму планирует приобрести одежду для реализации. Доходы от кредита Гулнара будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Gulnara is 44 years old, married, and the mother of three children. Gulnara has a secondary education. She has been selling women's clothing at the market for over six years. Her monthly profit is about 18,000 som (KGS). She has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) with the aim of developing her business, and specifically she plans to buy clothing with the requested sum to resell. Gulnara will invest the proceeds of the loan in the further development of her business and her son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Marcosa

texts.en: Marcosa is 62 years old, married, and has four children of adult age.  She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental (in the Philippines).
