She has a vegetable stand, where she is generating good sales.  In order to grab the opportunity, she wants to increase her inventory of vegetables, so she asked for a loan from Paglaum MPC to purchase vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, se dedica a cultivar granos básicos y a la crianza de ganado, actividades que le ensoñó su padre cuando era un adolescente, actualmente las realiza para ir generando los recursos necesarios para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, es casado y tiene dos hijos, la familia vive junta.
Necesita de un crédito para comprar abono, herbicidas e insecticidas, también invertirá en mano de obra para labrar la tierra y sembrar granos básicos, espera que la producción sea abundante para abastecer a su familia y a sus clientes así podrá tener posibilidades de mejores ingresos. Los riesgos son cuando existe un mal clima.
La visión de José es seguir trabajando para que al finalizar su crédito tener buena calificación crediticia y ayudar a que su familia tenga un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
José works growing cereals and raising cattle. His father taught him these activities when he was a teenager. He works now in order to generate the income he needs to cover the home expenses. He is married and has two children. They all live together.

He needs a loan to buy fertilizer, herbicides and insecticides. He will also pay for the labor he needs to prepare the land and sow cereals. He hopes to have an abundant harvest so that he can provide for his family and satisfy his customers’ demands. This will result in more opportunities to increase his income. His challenges are related to bad weather conditions.

José plans to continue working in order to pay off the loan and have a good credit rating, and help his family to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides, and pay for the labor needed to prepare the land to sow cereals.

loans.name: Argelia Saraí

texts.es:
Argelia, de 29 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos, estudio hasta bachillerato, porque no le dieron la oportunidad de seguir estudiando, actualmente vive con sus tres hijos y los abuelos.

Argelia, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo desde hace cuatro años, este oficio se lo enseño una amiga y desde entonces sigue con este trabajo.- Anteriormente, se le otorgó un crédito para comprar ropa y sigue vendiendo ropa, al igual que los productos por catálogo, pero también hoy en día se dedica a la venta de refrescos en su casa. 


El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar ropa para vender, porque cuando ella sale a vender productos de revista, aprovecha para llevar la ropa para vender, ella considera que esto le dará más ingresos, para que sus hijos puedan estudiar y salgan adelante.

Sus sueños son, establecer un local en donde pueda vender la ropa, que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales y ubicarse muy bien en el puesto del mercado.
texts.en:
Argelia is 29 years old and the single mother of three children. She only has a high school education because she didn’t have the opportunity to continue her education. She currently lives with her three children and their grandparents.

Argelia sells beauty products via catalog and has done so for four years. She learned this from a friend and she has been doing this work since. She had a previous loan that she used to buy clothing that she continues to sell, along with the catalog products. She also sells soft drinks out of her home.

She is asking for this loan to buy clothing to sell because she takes advantage of the time when she goes out to do her catalog sales, to take clothing to sell with her.  She believes that this will increase her income so that her children will be able to get an education and get ahead.

Her dreams are to establish a store where she can sell clothing and for her children to become professionals and set themselves up in the marketplace.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Roza

texts.ru: Роза, 31 год, замужем, мать 4 детей, образование средне, на протяжении многих лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Роза добилась очень хороших результатов, у нее есть 2 коровы, 25 овец. Также 1,65 ГА поливной земли, где она выращивает люцерну. Ежемесячный доход Розы составляет около 5,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Роза обратилась в Банк «Бай - Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. На прибыль от кредита Роза планирует увеличить своё хозяйство и накопить на перестройку дома.
texts.en: Roza is 31 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She has a secondary education. She has been rearing animals and growing crops for many years. Roza has achieved very good results, and has two cows and 25 sheep. She also has 1.5 hectares of irrigated land where she grows alfalfa. Roza's monthly income is about 5,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, Roza has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) to buy some sheep. Roza plans to increase her farm using the profits, and to save up to rebuild her house.

loans.use: to buy some sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Seina's Group

texts.en: Seina’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Seina makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Chantha’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Chantha makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en: Roberto is 58 years old and has two children. He's separated from his wife and is the sole supporter of his children. To earn a living, he operates a motorcycle transport business. He has been doing this for more than three years and earns good income from this business. Recently, Roberto took out a new loan to buy tires for his motorcycle. Roberto finds ways to save more money to improve his family's living condition and support the educational needs of his children.

loans.use: to buy new tires for the motorcycle he uses for his transportation business.

location.town: La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 57-year-old widow with 4 adult-aged children.  She is from the village of Calamba, Misamis Occidental (in the Philippines).  In 2009, Elizabeth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  

Elizabeth runs a vegetable store, which she has been operating for 11 years, and she earns monthly net income of 8,200 PHP.  She is requesting a loan (her 9th) of 18,000 PHP to expand her existing business by purchasing vegetables and spices to sell.  She has successfully repaid her previous PMPC loan of 10,000 PHP, which was used for personal purposes.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and spices to sell.

loans.name: Micgael

texts.en: Micgael is a hardworking mother from Calamba, Misamis Occidental (in the Philippines).  She is 34 years old and a businesswoman who makes copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production).  She buys whole coconuts for her business, and she has applied for a loan to buy whole coconuts to make copra.  Micgael hopes to succeed in this business to continuously provide for her family.  Also, she has signed her membership with the cooperative to gain access to insurance and credit.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts to make copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production).

loans.name: Annalen

texts.en:
Annalen is a hardworking entrepreneur.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She supplements this income with earnings from her pig-fattening business.

Annalen dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Vannoy's Group

texts.en: Vannoy’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Vannoy makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help both of these women in Vannoy's Group safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Mehwish

texts.en:
Mehwish is 26 years old woman and mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is fruit seller by profession, who sells fruits e.g. apples, bananas, grapes etc.

Mehwish's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling purpose, so that her husband can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, he is not in a condition to purchase fruits for his business purpose.

Therefore Mehwish has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. So that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purpose. 
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's fruit business

loans.name: Im's Group

texts.en: Im’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Im makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Sreymech's Group

texts.en: Sreymech’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sreymech makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria has put forth considerable effort in preparing for the post-harvest operations of her palay in Calamba, Misamis Occidental.  She wants to ensure that she will have ample time for the threshing, drying, storage, and processing of her harvest to make way for another cropping season.  She presented her proposal to Paglaum MPC for a loan.  Victoria hopes to see all her children finish their degrees and have stable careers.

loans.use: to pay for post-harvest operations.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 50 years old, married and has one child. To earn for living, she runs a piggery business. She raises pigs and sells them to the market. She aims to earn more income so she requested a loan to buy feed for the pigs. That will produce a good quality of pigs, meet her customers' demand and
result in increased income. Delia's plan for the future is to save money to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita has been a microfinance member of Paglaum MPC for almost 10 years.  She and her husband have been tilling their own land for farming activity that primarily supports her family's needs.  However, Lolita found out that their income from farming is insufficient to meet all of the family's needs, especially when her eldest child enters college.  

As a hardworking farmer, she works hard to repay her loans from the cooperative.  Previously, she decided to expand her farm and asked for financial support from Paglaum MPC.  She successfully repaid the loan and is grateful for the trust the coop extended to her in enabling her to buy the neighboring parcel of land.  This time, she wants to renovate their house, so she asks for another loan for the completion of their house.  The 10,500 PHP loan is intended to be used to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials and tools for nail treatments, gel nails, wax, cosmetics, two chairs for ‎treatment stations, and additional salon materials.‎

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de campo y madre de 1 hija por la que ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia.
Desde hace tiempo ha querido montar un negocio de cría y venta de cerdos.

Es por eso que solicita un gran aliento económico para comprar algunos cerdos para cría y materiales para la construcción de una cochera.

Con este nuevo negocio podrá generar ingresos para su familia que es todo para ella y podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposo y sus hijos.

Trabajara todos los días para impulsar su negocio y hacerlo una actividad sostenible y rentable.

Apoya a una mujer trabajadora con un préstamo!
texts.en: Ana is a woman of the countryside and has one daughter, for whom she has had to overcome many obstacles in life. However, she has always been strong to move ahead and to continue progressing with her family. For some time, she has wanted to start a business raising and selling pigs. This is why she is requesting a financial incentive to buy some pigs to raise and materials to build a shed. With this new business she will be able to generate income for her family, which is everything for her, and to improve the quality of life of her husband and children. She will work every day to push her business and make it a sustainable and profitable job. Support a hardworking woman with a loan!

loans.use: to start a business of raising pigs.

loans.name: Narlie

texts.en:
Narlie is so grateful that she has received and repaid numerous past loans. It is important that she has regular funds to properly maintain her tricycle for safe and efficient service.

Narlie trusts that she can again take out a 19,000 PHP loan to pay for the regular maintenance of her tricycle. There are times that her unit will stop in the middle of the road due to its worn out tires. She will use the proceeds to pay for new tires, gas and oil for her tricycle. She is thanking God for your continuous support of her livelihood. 

Narlie hopes to buy one more tricycle to improve her income. She wants to help some of her married children who still struggle making ends meet and to see her remaining single child finish schooling. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for new tires, gas  and oil for her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Soung's Group

texts.en: Soung’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Soung works as a farmer and he also does extra work as a farm laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Elcy Ester

texts.es:
Elcy tiene 35 años de edad, es madre de cuatro hijos y vive en unión libre con su pareja. 

Viene desde hace un tiempo con la idea de generar ingresos para su hogar; aprovechando los conocimientos adquiridos en su casa cuando era niña, desea iniciar una producción de alimentos en su casa.

La cliente es una mujer emprendedora, con visión y muchas ganas de salir adelante; se motiva para solicitar el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de utensilios de cocina e insumos como carne, verduras, granos, entre otros, de esta manera podrá darle inicio a su proyecto de negocio con el que espera generar ingresos suficientes para aportar a la economía de su hogar y velar para que sus hijos puedan disfrutar de un mejor bienestar. 

Es así como Elcy desea avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su principal sueño y es pagar la educación de sus hijo0s y mejorar las condiciones de su vivenda.
texts.en:
Elcy is 35 years old. She is the mother of four children and lives in a common-law marriage. She has been thinking of generating income for her family. Making use of the knowledge she acquired when she was a little girl, she wants to start selling food at home. She is an enterprising and visionary woman, with a strong will to get ahead.

She decided to apply for a loan to buy kitchen utensils and supplies such as meat, vegetables and cereals, among other things. This will help her to start her business, which she hopes will help her to generate the income she needs to contribute to the family’s economy and guarantee the well-being of her children.

This is why Elcy wants to take a step towards the fulfillment of her dream, which is to pay for her children’s education and improve her home.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils and supplies, such as meat, vegetables, and cereals.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.pt:
O senhor César de 31 anos de idade é casado, comerciante, pai 3 filhos, estes ainda sem idade escolar, vivem em casa própria.
A cliente tem um negócio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade, com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar refrescos, arroz, omo, açúcar, amendoim, feijão, farinha, óleo, cocos, para reforçar o seu negócio.
Tem como sonho ampliar o seu negócio para responder as necessidades dos seus clientes, melhorar as condições da sua casa e construir um estabelecimento em casa para a venda dos seus produtos.
Os principais desafios são financeiros mas tem estado a trabalhar e pretende tomar mais vezes o credito para suprir as suas dificuldades e alcançar os seus sonhos
texts.en:
César is 31 years old and married. He is a businessman and the father of three children, who go to school. They own the house where they live.

César owns a store where he sells essential products. With the loan, he plans to buy beverages, rice, laundry detergent, sugar, peanuts, beans, flour, oil, and coconuts to strengthen his business.

His dream is to expand his business in order to better meet his customers’ needs, improve his home, and build a store at home to sell his products.

His main challenges are of a financial nature, but he has kept working and plans to apply for more loans in order to overcome the difficulties and fulfill his dreams.

loans.use: to buy beverages, rice, laundry detergent, sugar, peanuts, beans, flour, oil, and coconuts.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is 65 years old and married. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. 

As a micro-finance member of Paglaum MPC, Florentina is given priority to alleviate her present financial conditions with the necessary financial literacy and other trainings in which she has actively participated. 

Florentina saw the changes in her general living conditions from the moment she signed up to be a member of the cooperative. 

This time, she asks for a loan of PHP 14,900 to buy additional bags of animal feed.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of animal feed.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en: Elvie looks forward to the next cropping season. She wants to prepare well, especially the much-needed land and seedbed preparations. She wants to have enough supply of corn fertilizer, for which she applied for a loan from the Cooperative. Elvie hopes to save enough for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy corn fertilizer for more produce.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma has been vending fruits and vegetables for quite some time and sufficiently supports her family's needs. She is a microfinance member of Paglaum MPC, where she accesses various services of the cooperative. Currently, she is availing herself of another loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase additional fruits and vegetables for her inventory.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits and vegetables for her inventory

loans.name: Andrea Marcela

texts.es:
Andrea siempre ha sido una mujer fuerte y perseverante, desde que era adolescente se sentaba a imaginar cómo sería su futuro, se veía trabajando en una oficina, dirigiendo una empresa y este sueño la llevó a estudiar administración de empresas. Hoy, está a un paso de recibirse de su carrera y de cerrar con triunfo esa etapa de su vida. Ella desde hace un par de años se encuentra trabajando en su área de estudio y gracias a esto ha podido solventar los gastos que le generaba estar en la universidad. 
Sin embargo, solicita un crédito para pagar los gastos de su curso de titulación y pagar un curso de inglés. Esto le será de ayuda porque podrá obtener su título universitario que le permitirá tener muchas oportunidades de empleo. Asimismo, al estudiar inglés podrá aplicar a puestos laborales que soliciten de este idioma tan demandado en la actualidad. Entre los planes a futuro de Andrea esta estudiar una maestría.
texts.en:
Andrea always has been a strong and persevering woman. Since she was a teenager she imagined what her future could be. She saw herself working in an office running a business, and this dream led her to study business administration. Today, she is one step closer to this career and succeeding in this stage of her life. She has been working in this field of study the last couple of years and because of this could cover the expenses generated while she is in college.

Nevertheless, she is applying for a loan to pay for her degree course expenses and also pay for a course in English. This will be helpful because she can obtain her university degree, allowing her to have more opportunities for employment. Also, studying English will enable her to apply to job positions as this language is in demand today. Among her future plans are to study for a master's degree.

loans.use: to pay for her degree expenses and also pay for a course in English.

loans.name: Ermida Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ermida en su búsqueda por un futuro prometedor y unas buenas oportunidades para salir adelante, decidió iniciar un negocio que según ella le dará todo eso que siempre ha soñado.

Montará un negocio de tienda de abarrotes en su casa en el municipio de Montería, con el cual planea sostener a su familia compuesta por sus tres hijos.

Su principal dificultad es la falta de capital para trabajar.

Para lograr esto necesita la ayuda de un préstamo con la Corporación Interactuar que le permita comprar un enfriador, estanterías, vitrinas y surtido de productos básicos de la canasta familiar como abarrotes, granos, galletas y otros alimentos para abastecer e iniciar su negocio.

Apoya a los sueños emprendedores de una Colombiana con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
In search of a promising future and better opportunities for moving forward, Ermida decided to start a business that, according to her, will give her everything she has always dreamt of.

She will set up a grocery store business in her home in the municipality of Montería, with which she plans to support her family consisting of her three children.

Her main problem is the lack of resources to work.

To achieve this, she needs the help of a loan with Interactuar, which will allow her to buy a cooler, shelves, glass cabinets and an assortment of basic everyday products such as groceries, grains, cookies and other items to start and stock up her business.

Support the dreams of an enterprising Colombian woman by making a loan today!

loans.use: to buy a cooler, shelves, glass cabinets, and an assortment of basic everyday products such as groceries, grains and cookies.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 53 years old, a married woman and mother of four children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and do a little bit of engine maintenance on his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide a better transport service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

Razia gives thanks to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband in repairing the rickshaw so he can continue his services.

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos, de 24 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está soltero y vive con sus padres y dos hermanos.

Carlos, trabaja en la apicultura desde que tenía 11 años de edad, ya que el padre se dedicaba a esto y cuando terminó de estudiar, decidió ejercer la misma actividad para seguir el trabajo de familia.- Actualmente, está trabajando con un apicultor, pero está considerando la posibilidad de construir su propio apiarío, actualmente inicia a trabajar a las 6:00 a.m. hasta las 2:00 p.m. y en sus tiempos libres, se dedica a la agricultura. 

Carlos, necesita el crédito para comprar 5 sacos de abono, para preparar la tierra para sembrar, esto le ayudara para que cuando llueva, la milpa crezca y proporcione una buena producción.

Los sueños de Carlos, son tener su propio negocio con las colmenas y que cuando decida casarse pueda tener todo lo necesario para su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 24 years old and has a high school education. He is single and lives with his parents and two siblings.

Carlos has worked in beekeeping ever since he was eleven years old. His father worked in this business, so when he finished school he decided to do the same and continue the family trade. He is currently working with another beekeeper but he is considering the possibility of building his own apiary. He currently starts working at 6:00 am and stays until 2:00 pm. 

During his free time, Carlos also works farming. He needs this loan to buy five sacks of fertilizer. This will help his corn to grow during the rainy season, so that he can obtain a good crop.

Carlos' goal is to start his own beekeeping business with his own beehives so that he can have everything he needs for his family whenever he decides to get married.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Yun's Group

texts.en:
The members of Yun’s Group live in a rural village in the Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. 

Yun makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. 

In Yun's village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter in Yun's home will help these women safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses. Additionally, they will save time since they will not have to collect fuel and boil water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Rozina

texts.en:
Rozina is a 29 years old woman and mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, where her husband is a vegetable seller by profession. He  sells vegetables e.g. onions, potatoes, tomatoes etc. 

Rozina's husband needs to purchase different types of vegetables for reselling purpose so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn the maximum profit. But due to an, unfavorable financial position her husband is not in condition to purchase vegetables for his business purpose.

Therefore Rozina has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. So that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purpose. 
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's vegetable business

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 34 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are currently in school. For the past five years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her bar, which sells beers and soda. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sodas and beers, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and have a bigger business. Sarah hopes that in the future, she will be able to open up her own pub. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sarah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more soda and beers.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 31-year-old married Syrian man who opened almost a year ago snack to cover his family's needs and expenses. He has a long experience in this domain and has a good reputation in his region.
 
Ahmad is a hard worker and ambitious man who is trying to develop his business. Today, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary foodstuffs and to expand his shop. 

Ahmad hopes to keep on expanding his snack shop in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy the necessary foodstuffs and expand his shop

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is from Trinidad, Bohol. She is married and has seven adult children. Teodora operates a small store where she sells different types of toys for children and home accessories. 

Teodora is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy more toys like cars, bells, and legos, and also home accessories. The income that she will generate will help supplement her husband's income from farming. In the future, she would like to make her store bigger and sell additional types of toys to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy different toys and home accessories to sell.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto is 33 years old and married with two children of school age. He is from Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental.

During his childhood, he experienced extreme poverty to the extent that they had nothing to eat for the entire day. He said to himself that when he has a family of his own, he will not allow his children to experience the same.

Having a meager amount in his pocket, he ventured into selling balut to the town.. After having good sales and able to keep money, he signed up for membership with Paglaum MPC and accessed financial assistance.

Ernesto believes that he will gain more if he will produce his own balut to be sold. Now that he has more customers, he employs his friends as balut vendors. Expanding his business requires additional capital; that's what he is asking for from the cooperative: the amount of PHP 20,000 to purchase more eggs for his balut making business.

Ernesto still strives hard to exploit the good fortune he has now and continuously hopes to increase his income so that he can build a decent house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more eggs for his balut making business

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia is 53 years old and married with two children of adult age. She owns a vegetable stall at their local market, which gives her sufficient income for her family. She wants to restock her stall with enough inventory of vegetables to meet her customers' needs. Therefore, she is availing herself of a loan to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter is a resident of Teso bar in Lira town, aged 26 yrs and single.  He takes care of his mother and four siblings since his father passed away in 2012, so he takes full responsibility for educating his siblings and providing the financial assistance to the family.

Walter operates a moble MTN money business in Lira town,   Due to the increasing demand and high number of the people in the area, it has boosted his business and this has made him to apply for the loan of 1,500,000 in order to serve his clients well.

He is very grateful to UGAFODE MICROFINANCE AND Kiva funders for their support.

loans.use: to add more money as cash float for his mobile MTN money business

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman and staying together with her husband and two children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past six years, she has operated a paraffin selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase fifty liters of paraffin for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase fifty liters of paraffin for resale

loans.name: Kol's Group

texts.en: Kol’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Kol does work as a farm laborer and a farmer to support his family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Mut's Group

texts.en: Mut’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Mut does work as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses ,and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es: Maria de Jesus o (Chusita) como cariñosamente la llaman las personas que la conocen, es de san Martin jilotepeque y actualmente tiene 31 años de edad y junto a su esposo tienen una librería y venta de cristalería, chusita tiene la ventaja de que solo ella tiene librería en la comunidad donde vive y esto le ha ayudado a tener muchos clientes además de prestar una buena atención a sus clientes. Tiene dos niñas y esa es la razón por la cual lucha diariamente y así poder tener ingresos para comprarles leche y medicinas cuando se enferman. Este es el tercer crédito que solicita y ha realizado sus pagos según su plan de pagos. Chusita está bien agradecida con el apoyo que le han dado los inversionistas ya que ha surtido más su negocio y esto ha generado más ventas y ganancias. Solicita el crédito para comprar láminas ilustrativas, cuadernos, y resmas de hojas para su libreria.
texts.en:
Maria de Jesus, or Chusita, as she is affectionately known, is from San Martin Jilotepeque. She is currently 31 years old and runs a store alongside her husband. They sell paper products as well as glassware. Chusita's advantage is that hers is the only bookstore in the community where she lives, so this has helped her serve a large customer base. She also provides good service. She has two little girls, and they are her reason to work hard every day in order to make enough income to buy milk for them and medicine when they are ill. This is her third loan request and she has complied with her payment terms thus far. 

Chusita is very grateful for the support she has received from lenders because it has allowed her to further stock her business, which has generated more sales and higher profits. She is requesting this loan to buy educational posters and cards, notebooks, and reams of paper for her bookstore.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her bookstore.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is an entrepreneur from San Miguel, Bohol. She is a mother to five children, ages 11-19. She also operates a sari-sari (general store) and rice farming business in order to help her husband raise and provide for their children.

She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP from CEVI to buy fertilizer, pesticides, seasoning, condiments, and toiletries. These items are always in demand at her store and the farming materials will help ensure that her crops will be healthy. In the future, she plans to make her business more successful.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, seasoning, condiments, and toiletries.

loans.name: Jacqueline Liseth

texts.es:
Jackeline, de 32 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, actualmente está casada y su esposo trabaja como jornalero limpiando una lotificación, tiene dos hijos que viven con ella y solo uno asiste a la escuela.

Jackeline, tiene una pequeña tienda que inició hace aproximadamente un año, decidió colocar este negocio porque las personas de su colonia, tenían que viajar hasta el mercado para comprar y ahora ella quiere tener a la venta, los productos básicos para el hogar; antes solo hacía el oficio doméstico, pero ahora también atiende la pequeña tienda y de ahí obtiene los ingresos para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, ella abre la tienda desde las 5:00 am.m hasta las 7:00 p.m.

El préstamo solicitado lo necesita para comprar más mercadería como maíz, frijol, azúcar, jabón, pan, galletas, etc. y luego seguir aumentando en las ventas para mejorar sus ingresos. 

Su sueño es tener a largo plazo un mini-super, que le permita obtener ingresos suficientes para apoyar a su hijo en el estudio, para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Jackeline is 32 years old. She went to school up to the ninth grade. Now she is married and her husband works as a laborer, clearing land. She has two children who live with her and only one is in school. 

Jackeline has a small store that she opened approximately a year ago. She decided to start this business because people from her neighborhood had to travel to the market to shop. Now she sells staple products for the home. Previously, she only took care of the home, but now she also tends to the little store and from that obtains income to help her husband with the household expenses. She opens the store from 5:00 am until 7:00 p.m.

She needs the loan she has asked for to buy more merchandise such as corn, beans, sugar, soap, bread, cookies, etc., so that she can increase sales and improve her income.

Her dream for the long term is to have a mini-supermarket, which will allow her to obtain enough income to support her children's education, so they can graduate from college.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as corn, beans, sugar and soap.

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en: Sophy’s Group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sophy makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Hugo Armando

texts.es:
Hugo es agricultor desde que recuerda, casado con Bessy con quien ah procreado dos hermosos niños que aparecen en la foto junto a él. Hugo trabaja duro cada día para poder sacar adelante a estos pequeños se dedica a diferentes actividades de la agricultura como ser: producción de café y miel. Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos puedan tener una buena preparación académica. 
La producción de miel es una actividad novedosa en la región, Hugo tiene 9 años de experiencia en el área. Posee un apiario bastante amplio y está feliz porque ahora la comercialización es mucho más fácil gracias a COCAFCAL.
Hugo está solicitando un crédito para alimentos orgánicos para sus colmenas, con el crédito Hugo espera alimentar sus colmenas para evitar que emigren o que muera además una buena alimentación asegura una buena cosecha para el próximo año, con las ganancias obtenidas por su miel Hugo cubre los gasto de las escuela de sus hijos.
El crédito ayudara a Hugo a mantener su apiario y hacerlo más productivo para el próximo año.
texts.en:
Hugo has been a farmer ever since he can remember; he is married to Bessy, with whom he has fathered two beautiful children, who appear in the photo with him. Hugo works hard every day to be able to provide for these little ones. He devotes himself to various agricultural occupations such as coffee and honey production. His greatest dream is that his children may have a good education. 

Honey production is a new activity in the region; Hugo has nine years of experience in the area. He has quite a large apiary and is happy because now selling is much easier thanks to COCAFCAL.

Hugo is requesting a loan for organic food for his beehives. With the loan Hugo hopes to feed his hives to prevent the bees from migrating or dying, besides which a good diet ensures a good harvest for the next year. With the profits from his honey Hugo covers his children’s school fees.

The loan will help Hugo maintain his apiary and make it more productive the following year.

loans.use: buy organic food for his beehives.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 47 years old and married and has six children to provide for. Her husband is a farmer and he owns a farm; he is the one working on it, while Lilibeth has her own business also.

She started the business four years ago and is asking for a loan to buy raw ingredients to prepare food for sale. This will allow her to keep her business open in order to continue serving more variety of delicious recipes to satisfy her customers' tastes and needs.

This loan will result in higher sales and a higher income for Lilibeth. She tells us that her biggest desire is to continue working at her cafeteria, offering better service to her customers. By doing this, she will have more financial stability and can enjoy a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her new recipe to sell and to purchase additional kitchen utensils to be used in her cafeteria

location.town: Campo 4, Ramon MAgsaysay Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Khea's Group

texts.en: Khea’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Khea makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a seller to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Angelena

texts.en:
Angelena is so encouraged by having been able to access loans in the past and has not once failed to pay on time. The loans have certainly helped sustain her store and thus have helped provide her family's daily sustenance.

She is again humbly asking for a 19,000 PHP loan to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, and rice noodles, which she sells at retail. Her store means a lot to her since it has been her source of income for the past two years and has sustained her family's basic needs. Although there are times she encounters difficulty in collecting her receivables, her cash sales are enough for their daily needs. 

Angelena's simple dream is for her store to grow, and she aspires to live a good and godly life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups, each composed of 15 to 30 community partners, that gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, beverages, and toiletries.

loans.name: Ranohon

texts.ru: Раънохон, 21 год, замужем, есть сын. Она уже 2 гоза занимается полеводством. У Раънохон среднее образование. В хозяйстве имеет земельный надел - 1,0 ГА собственной земли, где она выращивает морковь для реализации. Прибыль Раънохон составляет около 11,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений, что позволит ей развить бизнес за счет выращивания экологически-чистой моркови и увеличить в будущем размер земельных угодий.
texts.en: Ranohon is 21 years old, married, and has a son. She has been growing crops for two years. Ranohon has a secondary education. She has a plot of land: 1.0 hectares of her own land where she grows carrots for sale. Ranohon's profit is about 11,000 som (KGS) per month. She has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for aloan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy fertilizer, which will enable her to develop her business by growing organic carrots and to increase the size of her land in future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to cultivate her land and grow organic carrots.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Nga's Group

texts.en: Nga’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Nga makes a living cultivating rice and selling fishes and she also does extra work as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sarorn's Group

texts.en: Sarorn’s Group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sarorn makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women in Sarorn's Group safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Vanny's Group

texts.en: Vanny’s Group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Vanny makes a living cultivating rice and selling fish. She also does extra work as a farmer to support her family. In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help both of these women in Vanny's Group safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Tach's Group

texts.en:
Tach’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Tach makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs and she also does extra work as a farmer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of her family and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Khern''group

texts.en:
Khern’s group lives in a rural village in the Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Khern grows rice to support her family. The village has no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Steven

texts.en:
Steven is a 28-year-old maried man who lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala region of Uganda. For the past 4 years, Steven managed his retail shop.

To help expand his business, Steven has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar, bread, soap,  salt, and detergent, and will help Steven to generate greater profits and expand his business. Steven hopes that in the future he will be able to meet customer demands. 

Steven is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Steven who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy  sugar bread, soap,  salt, and detergent.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with three children, all attend school.She owns a house without electricity and running  water.Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a home-based soap selling business.  Transportation is a major challenge in her business. She will use the loan to purchase some chemicals to make soap.

She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to boost her business .

loans.use: to purchase chemicals.

loans.name: Richard

texts.es: Richard es un comerciante de 29 años que lleva casi la mitad de su vida laborando en esta actividad y ha logrado solventar económicamente a su familia, él reside en compañía de su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en el municipio de Barranquilla, en donde se concentran la gran mayoría de sus clientes a quienes les ofrece prendas de vestir, calzado, artículos del hogar y productos de aseo personal. Todos los días se programa para realizar visitas a sus clientes y buscar oportunidades de ventas,  En la actualidad está necesitando surtir su negocio y para ello solicitó su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en nuevas colecciones de prendas de vestir, calzado y tendidos para cama.  Con esta inversión continuará ofreciéndole bienestar a su familia y se acercará a la meta de adquirir su propio local.
texts.en:
Richard is a 29-year-old merchant who has spent nearly half his life working in this occupation and he has managed to support his family. He resides with his spouse and two children in the city of Barranquilla, where the vast majority of his customers are concentrated, to whom he offers clothing, footwear, household goods and personal care products. 

He schedules every day to visit his customers and seek sales opportunities. He is currently in need of stocking his business and for this he has applied for his first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo (Mario Santo Domingo Foundation), to invest in new collections of clothing, footwear and bedspreads. With this investment he will continue providing for his family’s welfare and he will come closer to his goal of acquiring his own business locale.

loans.use: invest in new collections of clothing, footwear and bedspreads.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 35 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past 10 years, Paul has been working hard to manage his charcoal business. 

To help expand his business, Paul has requested a loan of 4,000,000 UGX (Ugandan Shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more bags of charcoal, and it will help Paul to generate greater profits and have a bigger business. Paul hopes that in the future he will be able to own a lorry for the business. 

Paul is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Paul, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Mairash

texts.ru: Майраш, 49 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. Образование у нее среднее, занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Майраш в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 5 коров, 20 овец, лошадь. Прибыль в среднем 26,500 сом (KGS) в месяц. Майраш обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. На полученные доходы от кредита Майраш планирует и дальше развивать ее бизнес, также она хочет построить магазин возле дома
texts.en: Mairash is 49 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She has a secondary education. She rears animals. Thanks to Mairash's hard work, today she has five cows, 20 sheep and a horse. Her profit averages 26,500 som (KGS) per month. Mairash has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy some livestock to increase her herd. Mairash plans to keep developing her business with the proceeds she will receive from the loan, and she also wants to build a store by her house.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Elnura

texts.ru: Элнура, 32 года, замужем. У нее среднее образование. Элнура занимается сельским хозяйством, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 6 овец, 3 лошади. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота.  Доходы от кредита Элнура планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и накопить на замену крыши дома.
texts.en: Elnura is 32 years old and married. She has a secondary education. Elnura is a farmer. Today she has three cows, six sheep and three horses. In order to develop her business further, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy some sheep to increase her flock. Elnura plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in further increasing her number of domesticated livestock and saving up to replace the roof of her house.

loans.use: to purchase some sheep in order to increase the size of her flock.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назира, 28 лет, замужем. У нее - средне-специальное образование, работает бухгалтером в Восковой части. В месяц Назира получает около 15,000 сом (KGS). Все накопленные средства она старается вкладывать в улучшение благосостояния семьи. Назира обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на проведение ремонтных работ в доме за счет покупки окон, дверей и строительных материалов.Свои доходы Назира и дальше будет вкладывать в улучшение жилищных условий семьи.
texts.en: Nazira is 28 years old and married. She has a secondary technical education and works as an accountant for the military. Nazira earns about 15,000 som (KGS) per month. She tries to invest all of her savings in improving her family's well-being. Nazira has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to carry out renovations in her home by buying windows, doors and construction materials. Nazira plans to keep investing her income in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy doors and windows in order to make some improvements to her house.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Sokha is a 36-year-old woman with two children, both attend school; they live in Battambang province. She raises pigs and works on her co-villager’s farm for a fee. She has been involved in these businesses for three years and earns  23,000 KHR per day.  She is able to save about 13,000 KHR each day. 

Her pig became ill and her income decreased as a result. She needs to meet medical expenses for her piglets and does not have enough working capital to support her business.  She lead a group to apply for a new Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy 5  piglets and  feed. She hopes to earn more income and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy 5  piglets and  feed.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 37-year-old married woman living with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband owns a chicken selling shop. His daily practice is to buy broilers from the market and sell them from his shop. Recently he spent a huge part of his income to pay utility bills, which diminished his purchasing power for new inventory.

Therefore, Samina has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can buy broilers to sell from his shop. Her dream is to provide all facilities of life to her children.

loans.use: to buy broilers for her husband's chicken selling shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stock of cosmetics and skin care products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Chhum's Group

texts.en: Chhum’s Group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Chhum makes a living cultivating rice and she does extra work as a farmer and farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women in Chhum's Group safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Thern's Group

texts.en: Thern’s Group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Thern makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men in Thern's Group safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Someoun's Group

texts.en:
Someoun’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Someoun makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of her family and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Kilombero Group

texts.en:
Sajida is in her early 40s and is single with one young child.  She has sold fried fish and run a general business for fifteen years.  She works from 7am to 8pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Sajida's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy fish and restock  out of stock items in her store.  She dreams of owning a motorcycle.

Sajida will share this loan with her loan group  Kilombero.  It consists of three members who  hold each other accountable for repaying  the loan.

loans.use: to buy fish and restock  out of stock items.

loans.name: Delis Damaris

texts.es:
Delis, a sus 52 años de edad, es una mujer soltera. 

Siempre ha querido tener un negocio que le permita tener una independencia financiera, por eso quiere iniciar con un negocio de venta de comidas como almuerzos y desayunos en su propia casa.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos como carne, verduras, granos, utensilios de cocina y materiales para la adecuación de su cocina.

Su principal sueño es poder mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Delis is 52 years old and single.  She has always wanted to have a business that would allow her to have financial independence.  For that reason she wants to start a business selling food, such as breakfasts and lunches, from her home.

She seeks a loan to buy supplies such as meat, vegetables, grains, cooking utensils and other products to upgrade her kitchen.  Her primary dream is to be able to improve the condition of her home.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as meat, vegetables, grains, cooking utensils and other products to upgrade her kitchen.

loans.name: Sanoat

texts.ru: Саноат хозяйственная и добродушная женщина. Она родилась в селе Куруш. Она заботливая мать пятерых детей. И любимая бабушка шестерых внуков. Так как она родилась в сельском местности с детства ее учили трудолюбию. И она не смотря ни на что всегда стремилась добиться всего  своими силами и трудолюбием. После окончании средней школы ее отдали замуж за дехканина. И он занимался выращиванием сельхозкультур. Она не хотела сидеть дома сложа руки и тратить заработок мужа.  А хотела помочь мужу в содержание семьи и с сэкономив его деньги начать дополнительный бизнес по откорму и купле  продажи скота.   Но к сожалению ее муж  погиб в автокатастрофе и она осталась вдовой в самом рассвете своей жизни.  И все ее планы, мечты рухнулись в одно мгновение.  Она долго не смогла прийти в себя и поверить произошедшее. Так как Саноат была женщина сильна духом, поняла что она нужна своим детям. И она должна воспитывать их и дать им образование и по таджикским традициям женить их. Она работала из-за всех. Дала им образование и женила их.  А теперь ее дети стали опорой для нее. И мечты Саноата создать бизнес дома возобновились. Все ее сыновья работают  дехканами.  И Саноат сидя дома откармливает скот.  И теперь она хочет увеличить объем поголовье скота. И обратилась в Арванд за кредитом. Получив кредит она купить КРС для откорма и перепродажи.
texts.en:
Sanoat is a house-proud and kind-hearted woman. She was born in the village of Kurush. She is the caring mother of five children, and the beloved grandmother of six grandchildren. Since she was born in a rural location, she has been used to hard work since her childhood. And in spite of everything she has always striven to achieve everything through her own efforts and hard work.

After graduating from secondary school she was married to a farmer. He used to grow crops. She did not want to sit at home with idle hands and spend her husband's earnings; she wanted to help her husband in supporting the family and, having saved his money, to start an additional business fattening, buying and selling cattle. But unfortunately her husband died in a car accident and she was left a widow at the very dawn of her life, and all her plans and dreams collapsed in a single moment.

She was not able to recover for a long time and to believe what had happened. Since Sanoat was a woman strong in spirit, she understood that her children need her and that she must raise them, educate them, and marry them off according to Tajik tradition. She worked for everyone's sake. She gave them an education and married them off. Now her children have become a support for her, and Sanoat's dreams of creating a home business have been renewed. All of her sons work as farmers. Sanoat stays at home and fattens cattle. Now she wants to increase her herd of cattle, and she has applied to Arvand for a loan. On receiving the loan, she will buy some cattle for fattening and resale.

loans.use: to buy some cattle.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is a 55-year-old mother with four children who lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son is a wood turner. He works at a lathe machine and manufacturesspare parts of vehicles. He renews turbines  and radiators. He has done this business for many years and up to now, it has been very steady.

Due to continuously working over the lathe machine, some important parts have been tearing off and now need to be replaced. Without the replacement of parts, the whole mechanism of the lathe machine is compromised.

Her son is a poor person and does not have sufficient cash to buy spare parts to fix the lathe machine or buy cutting tools. 
Therefore, Zarina requests a loan for her son to fix the lathe machine and buy cutting tools.
 
Zarina hopes that this loan will prove productive for the business..

loans.use: to help her son repair the lathe machine and  buy cutting tools.

loans.name: Sokheng's Group

texts.en:
Sokheng’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. He makes a living cultivating rice and also does extra work as a seller to support his family. 

In Sokheng’s village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Nem's Group

texts.en: Nem’s group lives in a rural village in the Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Nem grows rice to support his family. Their village has no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these members to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Lupercio

texts.en: Lupercio has a banana and rice farm in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. This farm is the primary source of income for his family. Lupercio makes it a point to have good land preparation and enough inventory of high-quality rice seeds to ensure maximum yield and good income. Recently, he requested a loan from Paglaum MPC to purchase rice seeds that will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. Lupercio wishes to sustain his business and be to able to supply rice grains to the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings

loans.name: Maria Disned

texts.es:
Maria tiene 18 años de edad y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Con el ánimo de mejorar los ingresos familiares, ella desea iniciar su propio negocio; es por ello que comenzará una venta de mercancía en el municipio de Taraza, aprovechando la ventaja de no poseer competencia fuerte en el sector y la afluencia de gente que transita por el lugar, pues es una zona residencial. 

Esto la motiva a solicitar el apoyo de un crédito, el cual será invertido en la compra de ropa para dama y caballero, así podrá dar inicio a su proyecto emprendedor, con el que pretende mejorar sus ingresos para solventar los gastos y necesidades básicas del hogar. 

Maria es una mujer pujante y luchadora, además es consciente que debe trabajar arduamente para lograr los objetivos que se propone con este nuevo negocio. 

Esto le da la posibilidad de seguir adelante, luchando por cumplir su principal sueño que es comprar vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria is 18 years old and lives with her partner in a common law marriage.  With the goal of improving her family finances, she wants to start her own business.  Toward that goal, she will sell merchandise in the town of Taraza, taking advantage of the lack of strong competition in that sector and the affluence of the people who pass through, as it is a residential area. 

This is her motivation for seeking a loan.  She will invest the money in the purchase of men's and women's clothing in order to start her entrepreneurial project, thereby increasing her income in order to meet the expenses and basic needs of her home.  

Maria is a hard working, vigorous woman.  She is aware that she must work hard to achieve the objectives she proposes with this new business.  This will give her the possibility of moving forward, fighting to achieve her primary dream of buying a home.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's clothing in order to start her entrepreneurial project.

loans.name: Chuok's Group

texts.en:
Chuok, 59, is a farmer who lives in Banteay Meanchey province, and he is a married father of six children, one of whom depends on him.

To make a living, this industrious father grows rice as his main source of income. He earns additional income to better support his family by working for others for a fee and growing garlic. These businesses have been practiced for about 30 years until now. Living far away from a source of water and being under threat of drought, he cannot get good crop yields as ever before.

Chuok, the new client to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), is now leading a group of two members to apply for a loan to save his business. As the group leader, he will use his loan to buy organic fertilizer to enhance the business. He hopes that this loan will enable the rice crops to produce more yields so as to fulfill his dream of starting a new business (selling grocery items).

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to enhance his business.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
Jose es padre de 1 hijo pero no vive con la madre de este. 

Por falta de oportunidades de empleo y debido a la difícil situación económica por la que atraviesa su familia, decidió buscar opciones para generar ingresos por cuenta propia, por eso, desea iniciar su propio negocio; una distribuidora de alimentos como verduras y algo de carne; con esta actividad podrá aprovechar la ventaja que tiene, pues en la zona donde estará ubicado, no hay otro negocio que ofrezca estos productos. 

De esta manera desea comenzar nuevamente a generar ingresos para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hijo.  El cliente tiene un espíritu emprendedor y creativo que lo ayuda a encontrar nuevas oportunidades para progresar, además es consciente que debe trabajar con mucho esmero y dedicación para lograrlo. 

Esto lo motiva para solicitar el crédito con el que comprará un enfriador, una mesa, carne, cuchillos y otros insumos; con los que podrá dar inicio a su idea de negocio. 

Jose sueña con poder tener un negocio sostenible y pagar la educación de su hijo.
texts.en:
Jose is the father of a 1-year-old boy, but doesn't live with the child's mother. 

Due to the lack of employment opportunities and the difficult economic situation that his family is going through, he decided to look for ways to earn income on his own. Because of this, he wants to open his own business distributing food such as vegetables and meat. This will allow him to take advantage of his situation: in the area he will be located in, there isn't any other business that offers these products. 

This will be a new way to start generating income to meet the basic needs of his son. He has a creative and enterprising spirit that helps him find new ways to improve. On top of that, he is aware that he will have to work with care and dedication in order to succeed. 

This is what motivated him to request a loan, with which he will buy a cooler, a table, meat, knives, and other goods. With these supplies, he will be able to start his business.

Jose's dream is to be able to have a sustainable business and pay for his son's education.

loans.use: to buy a cooler, a table, meat, knives, and other goods, with which he will be able to start his business.

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
A windowed mother of three schoolchildren living in Battambang province, Srey is 48 years old. To struggle with her family’s hardship, she grows cassava on five hectares area as the main source of income. Moreover, she works for others for a fee to supplement her income. She can save her daily income about 27,400KHR per day and she has been involved with her cassava farm for ten years. 

For Srey, this is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has paid back her past loan completely. Her previous loan earns her with a decent income to upgrade her condition well. In a group of two, she is the group leader. She will use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay the laborers fee to plow her cassava farm. She hopes that she can gain her income to improve her family living in a good condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay the laborers fee to plow her cassava farm.

loans.name: Daimer Santiago

texts.es:
Deimer, a sus 19 años de edad, es soltero y actualmente se dedica a estudiar; desde hace un tiempo ha querido ser independiente, por lo que desea iniciar una venta de ropa para generar ingresos adicionales que le permitan apoyar con la carga económica en su casa. 

El cliente es un joven emprendedor, activo y se proyecta hacia el cumplimiento de sus objetivos, esto lo lleva a solicitar el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor como blusas, jeans, chaquetas, camisas, entre otros, así podrá aprovechar la oportunidad de comprar a bajo costo, lo que le permitirá mejorar el margen de utilidades que recibe por la venta de los productos y, de esta forma, Deimer podrá seguir avanzando hacia el cumplimiento de su principal meta que es consolidar y fortalecer su propio negocio para que sea rentable y perdurable en el tiempo y que le genere una estabilidad económica favorable.
texts.en:
Deimer, at 19 years of age, is single and currently a student. For a while now he has wanted to be independent, for which he wishes to start a clothing sales business to generate additional income that would allow him to contribute to household expenses.

The client is an enterprising young man, active and projected towards meeting his objectives. This leads him to request the loan in order to invest it in the purchase of wholesale merchandise such as blouses, jeans, jackets, and shirts, among other items. He will thus be able to take advantage of the opportunity to purchase at low cost, which will allow him to improve the profit margin he receives from the sale of the products. And in this way, Deimer will be able to continue advancing toward meeting his main goal, which is to consolidate and strengthen his own business so that it be profitable and lasting over time and that it generate for him positive economic stability.

loans.use: buy wholesale merchandise such as blouses, jeans, jackets, and shirts, among other items; he will thus be able to take advantage of the opportunity to purchase at low cost.

loans.name: Cecilia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Cecilia lleva muchos años trabajando para lograr sus sueños, comenzando que lleva más de quince años vendiendo cajeta y cosméticos, todo siendo casada, con un hijo de cuatro años de edad, estudiando la licenciatura en Docencia con especialización en español y trabajando como secretaria académica. Todo por garantizarle un bueno futuro a su pequeño y cumplir con las metas que siempre ha deseado tener, entre ellas conseguir trabajo como docente.
Por esta razón, está emprendedora de 33 años de edad solicita un préstamo para pagar su curso de titulación, pues cumpliendo con esa etapa, podrá al fin tener su título como licencia y optar por ser docente. Afortunadamente ella cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien es albañil, por lo que se siente segura de seguir tras esos sueños. Cecilia también planea estudiar un curso de inglés más adelante, pues no se cansa de seguir aprendiendo.
texts.en:
Cecilia has spent many years working toward her dreams.  She has sold caramel and cosmetics for more than fifteen years, while married, and now has a four year old child.  She is studying for a degree in teaching with a specialization in Spanish, and works as an academic secretary.  All of this is to guarantee a good future for her child and to meet the goals she has always had, among them to obtain work as a teacher.

For this reason, this 33 year old entrepreneur seeks a loan to pay the final fees to register her degree.  Once this phase is complete, she will finally have her degree and can opt to be a teacher.  Fortunately she has the support of her husband, who works as a mason, which allows her to feel secure in following her dreams.  Cecilia also plans to take an English class in the future, as she never tires of continuing her education.

loans.use: to pay fees associated with obtaining a teaching degree.

loans.name: Phern's Group

texts.en:
Phern’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Phern makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. 

In the village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help both of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Makhfirat

texts.en:
This is Makhfirat, a married 25-year-old lady. She is a mother of a three-year-old child. Three years ago, Makhfirat started to work as a tailor in order to develop her living and to improve her tailoring skills. She is talented in tailoring wedding and special occasion dresses, and works hard to satisfy her customer’s needs.

Through this loan, Makhfirat intends to develop her business by buying fabrics and a new embroidery sewing machine, which will help her stay financially capable of supporting her beloved family.

loans.use: to purchase a new embroidery sewing machine.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 34-year-old married man and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Four years ago, he started selling potable water to cover his family's needs and expenses. He also works as a taxi driver as a second source of income.

Mahmoud is a hard worker and an ambitious man who is trying desperately to develop his business.

Thus today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy more gallons of water to satisfy all his customers needs and to maintain the filters to provide his customers with the best quality.

Mahmoud hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions inside the camp.
