loans.use: to buy more gallons of water and to maintain the filters to provide his customers with the best quality.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.en:
Nelida is 57 years old and married with four children.  Nelida is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. 

Nelida requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.  Nelida has been farming rice for three years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nelida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Phearum's Group

texts.en:
Phearum’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Phearum makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a seller to support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Veronica Elizabeth

texts.es:
Verónica, de 25 años de edad, está estudiando quinto año en la carrera licenciatura en ciencias jurídicas, está soltera y solo se dedica a estudiar.

Verónica, toda su vida se ha dedicado a sus estudios, gracias al apoyo económico de su familia lo está logrando; decidió estudiar está carrera porque considera que tiene vocación para hacerlo, actualmente está haciendo sus prácticas, estudia en la capital y tiene que viajar cada fin de semana, para ver a sus padres. 

Verónica, es una joven emprendedora, ha decidido dedicarse a la venta de productos de belleza y le está siendo rentable, pero necesita está solicitando el crédito para pagar el pedido de mercadería que pronto le llegará.

Los sueños de Verónica son tener su propia línea de venta, donde ella sea quien distribuya el producto a otras vendedoras, además desea terminar su carrera y formar una sociedad de abogados.
texts.en:
Veronica, 25 years old, is doing the fifth year of her undergraduate major in legal sciences; she is single and is a fulltime student. 

Veronica has devoted herself to her studies her whole life; thanks to her family’s financial support she is succeeding. She decided to study this major because she believes she has a vocation for it. She is currently doing her internship, she studies in the capital and has to travel every weekend, to see her parents.

Veronica is an enterprising young woman; she has decided to engage in the sale of beauty products and it has been profitable for her so far, but she is applying for the loan to pay for an order of merchandise that will arrive soon.

Veronica's dreams are to have her own sales line, where she would be the one who distributed the product to other vendors; she also wishes to complete her degree and form a legal firm.

loans.use: pay for an order of merchandise that will arrive soon.

loans.name: Tito

texts.en:
Tito is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past five years, Tito has been working hard to manage his retail shop. 

To help expand his business, Tito has requested a loan of 3,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy rice, posho, millet flour, cooking oil, and detergent. The capital infusion will help Tito to generate greater profits and increase his working capital. Tito hopes that in the future he will be able to enhance business. 

Tito is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Tito who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy rice, posho, millet flour, cooking oil, and detergent

loans.name: Hipolito

texts.en:
Hipolito is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, who are all currently in school. For the past five years, Hipolito has been working hard to manage his retail shop. 

To help expand his business, Hipolito has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy rice, posho and millet flour, and will help Hipolito to generate greater profits and increase capital. Hipolito hopes that in the future he will be able to enhance business. 

Hipolito is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hipolito, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy rice, posho and millet flour.

loans.name: Bahodurjon

texts.en:
Bahodurjon is a bright guy. He was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1995. He is living in village with his family. He is single. He is a hardworking and generous boy. He started to do business in agriculture three years ago. He tried to work hard in order to earn money to help his parents make a living.

This year he entered to a medical university. The business that he had was a family business, and currently his parents and brothers are doing the business. Their standard of living is poor. The money that they earn is spent on fertilizer and the medical treatment of his father.

He wants to study and be educated to help his parents and residents of his area where he lives. He appealed to IMON and Kiva, asking for financial support to pay his education costs of university.

He hopes to be supported and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to pay his education costs of university

loans.name: Doyen

texts.en:
Doyen is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Doyen is 35 years old and has two children who are in school. Doyen has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Doyen has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ambika Mission Shakti Shg-D Group

texts.en:
The lady standing to the left hand side in the photograph is Santosini. She is 37 years old and hails from a small village of Jharsuguda district. She manages a bakery shop in the market.

To make her business stall complete and gain a bigger income, Santosini supplies her stall with grocery items. She has been in the business for eight years. Her husband helps her in her shop and her only daughter is pursuing her studies in a secondary school.

Santosini has a big regret that she has been unable to provide a toilet for her family. For this reason, Santosini along with her group member is requesting a loan of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan to build a new hygienic toilet for her family.

Santosini aspires to expand her bakery business by remodeling it and adding more stocks to her shop in the future.

loans.use: to build a new hygienic toilet

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Por muchos años, Pedro fue albañil, pues le encanta construir y reparar cosas. Sin embargo, hace cuatro años decidió emprender en el mundo de la costura, pues ahora con 66 años de edad es un poco más difícil para él seguir en el mundo de la construcción. Su título es licenciado en Teología, sin embargo nunca ejerció en ello, por lo que todo el decidió trabajar en él sentía era su talento.
Pedro tiene sus metas bien claras, por lo que no duda ni un segundo en invertir en su taller de costura, pues sueña con verlo engrandecer algún día. De manera que solicita un préstamo para comprar tela, agujas e hilos, materiales indispensables para la producción de prendas que él hace. Afortunadamente él cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa e hijos, quienes lo apoyan también en sus metas de convertirse algún día en agricultor con su propia finca en las afuera de la capital.
texts.en:
Pedro was a bricklayer for many years because he likes to build and fix things. Nevertheless, four years ago he decided to get started in the world of tailoring, because it's a bit more difficult for him to keep working in construction at the age of 66 . He has a degree in theology but never practiced in that field. He felt that he was talented in everything he worked at.

Pedro has his objectives very well defined, so he didn't hesitate for a second to invest in his tailor shop. He dreams of seeing it grow one day, so he's requesting a loan to buy fabric, needles, and thread. These supplies are indispensable for the garments he makes.

Fortunately he has the support of his wife and children, who also help him in his goal of becoming a farmer with his own farm on the outskirts of the capital.

loans.use: to buy fabric, needles, and thread

loans.name: Enan

texts.en:
Enan is a 38-year-old mother of four dependent children, three of whom are in school and the other one is too young to attend school. She is now living in Kampong Cham province where she has been growing rice for 18 years to earn the main source of income and working for others for a fee for additional income. She has been involved in these businesses for years.

It was very unfortunate that she could not earn a good income from the rice farming business as the crop price declined. Consequently, she can earn only about 35,000KHR a day to support family’s needs.

Enan now is applying for a loan, which is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The loan will be used to start connecting electricity to her house and to buy a television.

She hopes that the electricity will brighten her house so that her children can study at night.

loans.use: to start connecting electricity to her house and to buy a television.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Eddielyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Eddielyn works hard to support her family. She has an Avon dealership business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling clothing.

Eddielyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more personal care products to sell.

Eddielyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Heang's Group

texts.en:
Heang, 57, is a farmer living in a remote village in Battambang province.  She a mother of five children. 

To support her family’s living conditions, she has grown rice for two years. Meanwhile, her husband is working for labor fees to earn additional income. Each day she is able to save around 25,000 KHR after offsetting expenses.  

Heang has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles already, and she has repaid her previous loans completely. She improved her lifestyle by past loans as well. 

In a group of two, she is the leader. She will spend her entire loan portion on buying seed and fertilizer and to pay labor fees to support her farmland.  She hopes that this loan will help her to earn more income so as to upgrade her living standard.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer and to pay labor fees to support her farmland.

loans.name: Manikeswari Group

texts.en:
In the year 2015, ten self-dependent women of Kerandikhunti village of M.Rampur block of Kalahandi district, Odisha, India formed a group named Manikeswari. Their main objective is to expand their existing businesses and develop their social livelihood by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation.

Nisakha is the most active and energetic lady of the concerned village and has taken the leadership to form a self-help group. The incredible lady, aged about 25 years, is standing in the first row with raised hand in the photo. She is a cheerful lady with high ambition. Her family consists of her husband and three children.

For the last five years, Nisakha has been engaged with a goatery business with the help and support of her husband. She earns monthly income of INR 8, 000 from their occupation.

But the present income is not sufficient to manage the business expenses as well as the household expenses for her family, so she decided to raise her income by increasing the volume of her business through a loan. She will purchase four or five goats for rearing. After they grow up, she will sell them at a higher price.

Through this, Nisakha hopes that she will definitely generate a handsome extra income. She has a dream to save enough for the better education of her children and construction of a good house.

The other nine members of the group also engage themselves with different small businesses like a grocery shop, tailoring, a fast food center, an egg business, vegetable vending, animal trading, etc.

loans.use: to purchase four or five goats

loans.name: Sosan

texts.en:
SOSAN is a 42-year-old married woman, who has five children. She lives in a populated area, and her husband knows about people's needs in this area. He is a market vendor, who sells seasonal fruits from his place in a central bazaar and also from his home. He has a few years of experience in this field. He not only knows customers' needs, but also has reliable providers. 

SOSAN's husband chose this business because it is profitable and brings in a stable income. People use fresh fruits every day and consider them healthy, and many national dishes are made of fruits. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can sell the maximum quantity of fruits until evening, and get maximum reward for his efforts. 

SOSAN applied for a loan so her husband can purchase more fruits, and thus increase his monthly turnover. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fresh and seasonal fruits in bulk for her husband's fruit shop.

loans.name: Dúo Estrellas De San Mateo Group

texts.es: Dúo Estrellas de San Mateo Este dúo está formado por doña María Candelaria, ella tiene 55 años de edad y se dedica a la agricultura y a la venta de productos comestibles para vender en su aldea de San Mateo Milpas Altas desde ya hace muchos años, ella está solicitando el crédito para la compra de semilla de arveja china, y abono, y compra de productos comestibles para surtir su tienda, como, pastas, golosinas, maíz, aguas gaseosas, aceites de diferentes tamaños, harinas, jabón de bola, y en polvo, su mayor deseo es tener una buena cosecha , y surtir su tienda de la mejor manera posible.es su 5to credito que solicita y les agradese por su ayuda ya que sin su ayuda ella no habria podido aumentar mas sus ventas.
texts.en:
María Candelaria, 55, is a member of Estrellas de San Mateo Duo. For many years now she has earned a living in farming and selling food products in her town, San Mateo Milpas Altas.

She's requesting the loan to buy sugar pea seeds and soil amendments. She's also going to buy food products to stock her store: pasta, sweets, corn, soda, oil in different sizes, flour, powdered and bar soap.

María Candelaria's biggest desire is to have a good harvest and stock her store as well as possible. This is her fifth loan and she's grateful for the help because she wouldn't have been able to increase her sales without it.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell as well as seeds and soil amendments for farming

loans.name: Surriyan

texts.en:
SURRIYAN is a 35-year-old married woman living with her spouse, two sons and daughter in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband owns a butcher shop; he generates insufficient income for his family. His daily practice is to buy mutton and lamb from the market and sell it from his butcher shop. Recently he spent a huge part of his income to pay utility bills, which diminished his purchasing power for new inventory for his butcher shop.

So SURRIYAN requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy billy goats and sheep for producing mutton and lamb.

SURRIYAN wants to provide a higher education to her children. She dreams to provide all facilities of life to her children.

She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy billy goats and sheep for her husband's butcher shop.

loans.name: Khoeun's Group

texts.en:
Khoen is a 26-year-old young woman who is a farmer living in Battambang province. She is a married mother of two dependent children, one of whom is in school and the other is under school-age.

Rice farming is the family’s prime source of income. Moreover, she works for a labor fee to get more income to support her family and she can earn about 26,000KHR per day. She has been involved in her business for three years.

Due to a lack of funds, she decided to lead a group to take a new Kiva loan; and this is Khoeun’s third loan cycle with VisionFund. She repaid both the previous two loans successfully. With her past loans, she could keep her kid in school as well.

As a group leader, she will manage her entire loan portion to buy rice seed to grow a good quality of crops. She hopes to gain high yields so that she could earn more money and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice seed to grow good quality crops.

loans.name: Jose Wilmer

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos muy conocido por su gran producción de ganado de leche y siembra de naranjilla en   este Cantón tienen el recinto 23 de Junio, este es un recinto pequeño pero lleno de gente humilde trabajadora y muy solidaria con sus semejantes, en este sector tiene el negocio de producción de naranjilla Don José, él mantiene una sólida relación con la Sra. Maria, es padre de 1 hija la cual está estudiando, se dedica un promedio de 8 horas diarias a su negocio lo aprendió junto a sus hermanos ya que ellos también se dedican a esta actividad.
Don José es un hombre muy responsable que solo busca el bienestar de su familia por ese motivo está seguro que este préstamo con el que comprará fertilizantes y le ayudará a mejorar las condiciones de su producción y poder llevar más ingresos a su casa para poder darle a su familia lo necesario, Don José agradece a KIVA por la ayuda que le brindan a él y su Familia
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos is well known for its large production of dairy cattle and naranjilla crops. In this canton lies the precinct 23 de Junio; this is a small precinct but full of humble, hardworking people who are very supportive of one another. In this sector Don José has his naranjilla production business. He has a strong relationship with Maria, and he is the father of one daughter, who is a student. He devotes an average of 8 hours a day to his business; he learned it with his brothers since they also work in this trade. 

Don José is a very responsible man who only seeks to assure the welfare of his family. To that end he is sure that this loan, with which he will buy fertilizers, will help him improve the conditions of his production and enable him to take home more income to give his family the essentials. Don José thanks KIVA for the help it provides to him and his family.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and improve production, and be able to provide essentials to his household.

loans.name: Karla Sujey

texts.es:
Karla es una mujer cariñosa, paciente, solidaria y bondadosa. Siempre está ayudando al que más lo necesita y por esto decidió estudiar psicología pues es una carrera que la mantiene en constante relación con las personas y desde sus saberes tiene el poder de orientarlos haciendo de ellos unos mejores seres humanos. Actualmente, está en cuarto año de su carrera a solo un paso de coronar su carrera.
Por ello, solicita un crédito para pagar los gastos de titulación y pagar un curso que es requisito para culminar sus estudios superiores. Una vez realizado ese curso, ella podrá tramitar su título y podrá comenzar a laborar en su campo profesional.  Karla se siente orgullosa de sí misma por los logros que ha obtenido pues gracias a ellos ha podido crecer como mujer y como profesional.
texts.en:
Karla is a loving, patient, supportive and generous woman. She is always helping those who need it. So she decided to study Psychology as it is a career that keeps you in constant relations with other people. With her knowledge she has the power to orientate people making them better human beings. Currently she is in her fourth year of her program, one step away from crowning her studies.

For her requesting a loan to pay for the expenses of her degree and to pay for a course is a requirement so she can complete her university studies. Once she has finished this course she can apply for her degree and start to work in her profession. Karla fells very proud of herself for the things she has achieved as thanks to them she has grown as a woman and as a professional.

loans.use: to pay for the expenses of getting her degree and pay for a course.

loans.name: Nihal

texts.en:
Nihal is a divorced woman, living with two daughters in a simple house in Ramallah City. She is a strong and independent woman. 

Four years ago, Nihal decided to open her own business. She manages and operates a nursery and kindergarten. After she divorced her husband, the kindergarten became her only source of income. Nihal took a USD loan from FATEN.  This loan enabled her to expand her nursery and kindergarten. 

She hopes that this new expansion will enable her to increase her customers, and eventually, to improve her family's conditions.  Nihal appears in the photo.

loans.use: to expand her nursery and kindergarten.

loans.name: Ambika Mission Shakti Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Pabita is a 35-year-old lady, standing to the extreme left in the photograph. She hails from a small village of Jharsuguda district, Odisha, India.

Pabita is a humble and respectful person in her community where she works in agriculture. With this, she is able to get her family ahead, where she is able to cover educational expenses for her two children, just like any mother who would want the best for her family.

Unfortunately, Pabita is unable to build a toilet for her family due to her limited income. Pabita, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount in order to build a toilet, install a commode, and incorporate water pipes and a shower, so that she no more will have to go outside the house for bathing and defecating.

Pabita hopes to lead a healthy and happy life with her small family till her last breath.

loans.use: to build a toilet, install a commode, and incorporate water pipes and a shower.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kiyinda in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past two years, Simon has been working hard to manage his photo studio business, which is operating a photo studio.

To help expand his business, Simon has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a printer, and will help Simon to generate greater profits and increase the number of photos printed. Simon hopes that in the future he will be able to earn more profits.

Simon is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Simon who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy a printer

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kiyinda in the Mubende region of Uganda. She has two children who are both currently in school. For the past six years, Victoria has been working hard to manage her retail shop.

To help expand her business, Victoria has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy household commodities, and will help Victoria to generate greater revenue and increase profits.

Victoria hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business.

Victoria is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Victoria who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy household commodities.

loans.name: Sophak

texts.en:
Sophak is a 23-year-old widowed factory worker with a dependent child in her care.  She resides in the Takeo Province in Cambodia. 

She has worked in a factory since 2014. Sophak can earn approximately $8 per day. Sophak would like to improve her family’s finances, so she needs a loan to buy cows for breeding to produce calves to sell. With this loan, she will be able to have enough money to buy cows and earn more income when the cows are able to produce calves. 

In the future, Sophak wants to expand into feeding cows, to build a proper house and to support her child to obtain higher education.

loans.use: to buy cows for breeding to produce calves to sell.

loans.name: Yessica Maria

texts.es:
Yessica, de 24 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está casada, su esposo se dedica a los trabajos de construcción, tienen un hijo de dos años de edad, el cual vive con ella.

Yessica, tiene un vivero de plantas desde hace más de diez años, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus tíos, ella decidió dedicarse al negocio de plantas y el local está ubicado en la casa de su tía en la ciudad, antes de dedicarse a la venta y producción de plantas, vendía artesanías.- Para llegar al vivero tiene que viajar en auto bus.

Los fondos serán invertidos para comprar fertilizantes, plantas frutales y ornamentales, porque con esto tendrá más variedad de plantas para la venta y obtener mejores ingresos.

Los sueños de Yessica, son hacer crecer su negocio y poder cumplir su más grande anhelo, el cual es tener su propio hogar.
texts.en:
Yessica, 24, studied up to high school. She's married and her husband earns a living in construction. They have a two-year-old child who lives with them.

Yessica has had a plant nursery for more than 10 years. Thanks to lessons from her uncles, she decided to work in the plant business. Her nursery is at her aunt's house in the city; she has to take a bus to get there. She used to sell handicrafts before she started growing and selling plants.

The funds will be invested in buying fertilizer, fruit plants, and ornamental plants. This will give her a wider variety of plants to sell and to earn a better income.

Yessica's dreams are for her business to grow and to be able to achieve her big desire of having her own home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, fruit plants, and ornamental plants

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
PARVEEN is a 50-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She requested a loan for her husband’s green grocery business.

Her husband has been selling vegetables for many years. He sells seasonal fresh vegetables in his hometown. He has been using a four-wheel manual cart to carry the vegetables from one place to another. Now he has opened a shop for selling vegetables, but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy the initial inventories to run his shop in a good manner.

His children are growing and their needs are increasing. To cope with the rapid increase in the school fees, books, utility bills and household expenses, he wants to establish his business but he does not have enough savings to buy vegetables in bulk.

Therefore, PARVEEN has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy fresh and seasonal vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh and seasonal vegetables in bulk for her husband's green grocery business.

loans.name: Et's Group

texts.en:
Et, 44, is a married mother of two children living in a remote village of Kampong Cham province. She has been rice farming and working for a labor fee to support her living condition for around 26 years. Drought has caused her crops grow to not do well, and this is the main challenge for her.

After successfully repaid the one previous loan, Et is requesting a second loan via VisionFund. She can support her family’s living from the previous loan.

In a group of five, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy rice seed and fertilizer to produce good yields.

She hopes that she can earn more income to update her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and fertilizer to produce good yields.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Ambika Mission Shakti Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Dileswari, 41, is a humble lady, standing to the middle in the photograph. She is married with three children. With two children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Dileswari hails from a small village of Jharsuguda district. Her husband is engaged in the farming business and cultivates paddy and other green vegetables on his small piece of land. The earnings of her husband are used to meet the daily household expenses and within the limited income, Dileswari finds it very hard to build a toilet which she is lacking right now.

Therefore, she, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan of 45,000 INR. Dileswari will use her portion of the loan amount to build a hygienic toilet in order to provide safety and cleanliness so that they can get prevention from harmful diseases.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet

loans.name: Lai

texts.en:
Mrs. Lai, 42 years old, is married and has two children. They are the driving force of her life, and the reason why she works so hard in her business. 

She specializes in cows, a job that she’s been doing for more than 10 years. She wants to stock up so that she can increase her profits and make the business more successful.  That’s why she wants to buy two more calves that will her increase her inputs into the work. 

She wants to see her work be sustainable over time, so she’s willing to invest more in her business. Someday, she expects to pay for her children’ s education because she believes that is the way to do better in life.

loans.use: to buy two more calves to increase her profits and make the business more successful.

loans.name: Ghazi

texts.en:
Ghazi is a 28-year-old married Syrian father of two. He got employed with limited salary six years ago in the construction field, specializing in paving tiles, to cover his needs and expenses. He is a hard worker who is trying hard to improve his family's living conditions.

Today, Ghazi is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a motorcycle which will help him move to his work areas easily.

Ghazi hopes to start his own business in the future to increase his income and stay capable of providing his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle which will help him move to his work places easily.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
ROSEMARY, who is in her early 40s, is married with four children who are still in school. She has been selling charcoal for three years now. She works from 06am to 08pm daily and is able to make a a fair monthly profit.

This will be ROSEMARY's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to open another charcoal store and add to her first store; she was able to pay back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loans, put electricity in her house and covered household expenses.

She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal to sell. She dreams of buying a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Hermie

texts.en:
Hermie is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Hermie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of clothing to sell for her clothing retail business.

Hermie has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Angelica is 27 years old and has one child in school.

Angelica has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. Angelica requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of clothing to resell.

Angelica has been in this business for five years. In the future, Angelica would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothing to resell.

loans.name: Chanly

texts.en:
Chanly is 35 years old living in Kampong Cham province’s Kampong Siem district and she is a mother of one child who is in school. Nowadays, she grows rice and raises piglets to support her family’s living condition for around fifteen years. Recently, her business does not grow well as the pigs got sick and she could able to sell them at a high price as before. 

After successfully repaid all the previous four loans, Chanly has request for the fifth loan cycle of 1,800,000KHR from VisionFund. She will use her loan to buy seed and pay for labor fees to support her business. She hopes to get more income so as to upgrade her living standard.

loans.use: to buy seed and pay for labor fees to support her farming business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Horn's Group

texts.en:
Horn is 47 years old living in Kampong Cham province and a mother with one dependent kid who is in school. Growing rice is the family’s prime source of income. Meanwhile, her husband is working for a labor fee to earn additional income to support her family. She has been involved in her job for around twenty-nine years. Recently, her crops did not grow well because they were destroyed by insects. 

Horn has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle already and she completely paid back the loans. Through her previous loan, her living life style is improved. As a group leader, she will manage her loan portion to buy fertilizer for supporting her rice farming. She hopes this second loan will enable her to grow good quality rice so as to earn more profits and thereby allow her to improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for supporting her rice farming.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Mrs. Nga is a hardworking woman, who is 28 years old. She is married and has a baby. 

She is in the business of buying and selling livestock. She likes her business and takes good care of her livestock. She wants to widen her business and is planning to buy additional livestock. She appealed to QB WDF, asking for financial support to buy livestock. 

She hopes to expand her business and earn money to help her family.

loans.use: to widen her business and buy additional livestock.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is 33 years old and lives in the town of Mubende in the mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children with non of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Justus has been working hard to manage his restaurant business, which operates with cooked food, soft drinks. 

To help expand his business, Justus has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy food items and drinks and will help Justus to generate greater profits and get more customers. Justus hopes that in the future he will be able to expand to a big restaurant. 

Justus is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Justus who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy food items and drinks for his restaurant

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 64 years.He is married and has 5 children to support.

He has been in this field for the last 8 years earning an income of KES 10,000 per month.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase farm tools such as suckers for pruning his tea, jembes and pangas for work efficiency. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and the surplus to buy a dairy cow for milk production.

His hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase farm tools such as suckers for pruning his tea, jembes and pangas for work efficiency

loans.name: Al Tadamon Group

texts.en:
Ghada is the featured borrower for Al Tadamon Group. She joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Ghada is a 40-year-old married mother of three children who started three years ago embroidering to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She is working hard to improve her family's living conditions.  

Thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate her house furniture to make it a healthier place for her family. Ghada is the first lady on the left of the photo.  Zainab is the lady in the middle, and Mirvat is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to renovate her house furniture to make it a healthier place

loans.name: April Joy

texts.en:
April Joy is 27 years old, married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

April Joy has a food vending business in the Philippines. April Joy requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

April Joy has been in this business for three years. In the future, April Joy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jose Nicolas

texts.es:
Nicolás, de 67 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a la crianza de especies menores como pollos, cerdos, patos y conejos, tiene 5 hijos, cuatro con la esposa y uno fuera del matrimonio, todos los hijos trabajan y con él solo vive una nieta.  

Nicolás, se dedica a varios oficios, entre los cuales está la producción y venta de café (vivero y finca), tiene cinco años de dedicarse a este negocio, lo aprendió gracias a su madre, porque ella tenía una finca, cuando era niño y le gusto el trabajo que hacia la mamá, por ello ha decidido dedicarse a este trabajo; pero además del café se dedica a la albañilería y la agricultura, en el trabajo hay épocas que tiene que contratar empleados, para agilizar la preparación de las plantas de café. 

Los fondos serán invertidos para comprar bolsas, fertilizantes y otros preparativos para la siembra de café y gracias al apoyo del préstamo podrán incrementar la cantidad de plantas de café en el vivero.
   
Nicolás, desea que sus hijos cuiden lo que él está creando y que sus nietos se beneficien del trabajo que está haciendo.
texts.en:
Nicolás, 67, studied up to fourth grade. He's married and his wife works raising small animals such as chickens, pigs, ducks, and rabbits. He has five children, four with his wife and one outside his marriage. All the children work, and only a granddaughter lives with him.

Nicolás works various jobs, including growing and selling coffee (a nursery and a farm). He has been in this line of work for five years. He learned it thanks to his mother, because she had a farm when he was little and he liked the work she did. Because of that he decided to devote himself to this work. There are periods in this work during which he has to hire workers to speed up the preparation of the coffee plants. He works in bricklaying and farming as well as in coffee.

The funds will be invested in buying sacks, fertilizer, and other necessities to prepare for planting coffee. Thanks to the support of the loan he'll be able to increase the number of coffee plants in his nursery.

Nicolás wants his children to take care of what he's creating and his grandchildren to benefit from the work he's doing.

loans.use: to buy sacks, fertilizer, and other necessities to prepare for planting coffee

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
NASREEN is a 38-year-old woman, living with her three children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  Her husband is a driver by profession, and provides transportation services by using a three wheeled auto rickshaw. 

With the help of savings, he has purchased a used auto rickshaw.  Its engine quality is good, but the body is totally damaged. He does not have sufficient money to buy a new body and seat covers. He wants to start driving, but is looking for a lump sum amount to buy the rickshaw body.

Therefore, NASREEN has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy the new rickshaw body and seat covers, and can drive the rickshaw smoothly. NASREEN hopes that now her husband will be able to earn more income. 

NASREEN is very happy about receiving this loan.  She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw body and seat covers for her husband's transportation services business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer in order to grow vegetables

loans.name: Shavkatjon

texts.en:
Shavkatjon was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1982. He is living in village with his family, is married and has 2 children. He is an active, hardworking and wise man. He has land and livestock and does business with them. He grows and feeds livestock and then sells them at extra prices. Also he plants wheat and cereal on his land and sells his harvest at the domestic market. 

He has an old and sick mother. Recently, she was at the hospital and getting medical treatment. He has not the money to pay medical service, now. He is asking financial support from Kiva and IMON to pay his mother’s treatment at hospital. He hopes to be understood and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his mother’s treatment at a hospital

loans.name: Cruz Monserrate

texts.es:
En el cantón El Carmen se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del Grupo de Crédito Granito de Esperanza, donde una de las fuentes principales de ingreso es el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete 
En este lugar VIVE la señora Cruz, tiene 50 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 4  hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Ella vive en casa propia.
Doña Cruz es asistente doméstica en la casa de una amiga, pero está incursionando en  la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local. Trabaja todos los días como asistente domestica desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00 y se dedica a sus ventas 2 o 3 horas diarias, deja a crédito a sus clientes y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la comprar  cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene poco tiempo a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños;  ocupara otra parte para hacerse un chequeo médico. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 2 años, a ella la invito la presidenta del grupo y le gusta porque el grupo es unido. Su sueño es tener un negocio propio para no tener que trabajar fuera de su hogar.
texts.en:
The members of the "Granito de Esperanza" communal bank meet every fortnight in El Carmen canton where the principal source of money is the cultivation of the Barraganete varietal of banana.

Cruz lives in this place. She is 50 years old, is a widow and has four adult, independent children. She lives in her own house.

Cruz is a domestic assistant in a friend's house and she is venturing into the sales of clothing of all types. Her method of sales is from door-to-door and she also sells from her house where she has a small store. She works every day as a domestic assistant from 8 am until 5 pm and spends two or three hours a day with her selling. She leaves merchandise on credit and collects every fortnight. She buys merchandise every two weeks or every month depending on her needs. She hasn't been in the business long and things are going very well for her.

She will use this loan to buy merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing and the other part will be used for a medical check-up. She has been in the communal bank for two years, joining on the invitation of the president of the group. She likes it as the group is very close. Her dream is to have her own business so that she doesn't have to work outside her house.

loans.use: to have a medical check-up and buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Sokhum's Group

texts.en: Sokhum is 57 years old, a mother of four children and lives in a rural area of Kratie province. Sokhum grows cassava and sells grocery items to earn a living. She has been involved in these businesses for 10 years. Her crops have not grown well, which is the main challenge for her business. This is Sokhum’s second loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. Due to a lack of working capital, she decided to lead a group to ask for a new loan. She will use her entire loan portion to buy pesticide and fertilizer for supporting her cash crops. She hopes to gain higher yields so that she can receive a good profit and improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and fertilizer for supporting her cash crops.

loans.name: Layal

texts.en:
Layal is a 32-year-old married mother of one. Nine years ago she started working as a teacher to help her husband cover the needs and expenses of their children. She is a hard worker and sacrificing mother who is trying desperately to improve her family's living conditions. 
Layal is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate her home's outside entrance for the safety of her family. She hopes to stay capable of providing her children with a better life.

loans.use: to renovate her home's outside entrance for the safety of her family

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 38-year-old married woman living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
Her husband owns a shop where he sells bed sheets, pillows, foam mattress, blankets, etc. Recently, he spent a huge part of his income to pay utility bills which diminished his purchasing power to buy new blankets. Now, customers want blankets because the winter season is going to start. Farzana has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband's business. Her husband will use the loan to buy bed sheets, pillows, foam mattress and blankets.
Her dream is to provide a good life for her children. 
Farzana is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets, pillows, foam mattress and blankets for her husband's clothing shop.

loans.name: Sokheap's Group

texts.en:
Sokheap’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sokheap makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farm laborer to support her family.

 In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Yehowa A Dzo Wo Group

texts.en:
Esther is 34 years old, married, and has four children. She is in the business of selling cosmetics and fresh okro (vegetable). She is enterprising, consistent, kind, strong, careful, responsible, and hard working. She conducts her business at the market in the Accra region, which is located in the center part of Accra and has commercial activity, recreation, restaurants, a lorry (truck) park, and more.

She shares her life with relatives who work together. She lives with her family in a house built of brick and cement with aluminum roofing and concrete floors. The house has electricity. 
Because of the need to improve her business, she joined a group of entrepreneurs with businesses in second-hand clothing, porridge, grocery and general goods who are seeking loans to improve their activities. 
Esther’s business is selling cosmetics and fresh okro in the market. She says, selling cosmetics and fresh okro for several years has allowed her to know her customers very well and also identify new customers.  The advantage of her business is that sales are continuous throughout the year. This is her fifth loan from the institution in her 12 years of working at this business.

For these reasons, Esther is applying for a loan to purchase more cosmetics and fresh okro to stabilize and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics and fresh okro (vegetable) to stabilize and improve her business.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 27-year-old engaged man and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low social and financial situations of Palestinians in Lebanon, he got employed three years ago in Gypsum decoration field with limited salary to cover his needs and expenses. 

Ahmad is a hard worker and ambitious man who is trying desperately to improve his living conditions. Today, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to continue building his own house through finishing windows and doors installations. This loan is very important to Ahmad for it will help him get married soon and build his own future family. 

Ahmad hopes to start his own business in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to continue building his own house through finishing windows and doors installations

loans.name: Genoveva Margarita

texts.es:
En el cantón El Carmen se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del Grupo de Crédito Granito de Esperanza, donde una de las fuentes principales de ingreso es el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete 
En este lugar vive la señora Genoveva, tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos de 17, 11 y 8 años que estudian en colegio  y escuela. Ella vive en casa de sus padres.
Doña Genoveva es una mujer muy luchadora que puso un pequeño restaurante en su casa, ahí vende hamburguesas, papas fritas, papi pollos (papas con pollo) y otros productos elaborados (colas, aguas, jugos, etc.). Trabaja todos los días, desde las 10h00 hasta las 17H00 o hasta que se termine lo que se preparó. Trabaja con la ayuda de su hijo mayor el cual después de hacer sus tareas le ayuda en lo necesario para dar una buena atención a los clientes. Tiene 6años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar aceites, carne, embutidos, huevos y utensilios  de cocina. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 6 años y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos a más de ser la presidenta del grupo.  Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio, darles una buena educación a sus hijos y tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, the members of Grupo de Crédito Granito de Esperanza meet in the El Carmen district, where one of the main sources of income is the cultivation of plantain of the Barraganete variety. In this place lives señora Genoveva. She is 39 years old, and she is a single mother of 3 children ages 17, 11 and 8 who are in school. She lives in a house with her parents. 

Doña Genoveva is a very determined woman who put a small restaurant in her house. There, she sells hamburgers, french fries, potatoes with chicken ("papi pollos") and other products (sodas, water, juices, etc.). She works every day, from 10:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. or until she runs out of what she made. She works with the help of her oldest son who, after doing his homework, helps her with whatever she needs to provide good customer service. 

She has been working in this for six years, and it's going very well for her. She is going to use this loan to buy oil, meat, cold cuts, eggs and cooking utensils. She has been part of the Grupo de Crédito for six years, and she likes it because the loans are quick -- in addition to being the president of the group. 

Her dream is for her business to be successful, and to give a good education to her children and have her own house.

loans.use: to buy oil, meat, cold cuts, eggs and cooking utensils.

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
Thy’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Thy makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Thai's Group

texts.en:
Thai’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia.  Thai makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as seller to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Benita De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Benita, de 42 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está soltera, pero tiene tres hijos, de los cuales dos viven con ella.

Benita, se dedica a trabajos agrícolas y a la producción de vegetales desde hace más de 25 años, el trabajo lo aprendió de sus padres, quienes le enseñaron a valerse por sí misma, además de la producción agrícola, trabaja en los oficios domésticos y en los trabajos agrícolas se involucran sus hijos.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar materia prima para los cultivos, como: bolsas, semilla, fertilizantes y fungicidas; con esto ella tendrá una mejor producción y podrá obtener los ingresos económicos necesarios, para seguir trabajando y mejorando la calidad de vida.

Los planes que tiene Benita, son mejorar la vivienda en donde reside y hacer crecer la producción de granos básicos y vegetales.
texts.en:
Benita, 42, studied until sixth grade. She is single but has three children, two of whom live with her. 

For more than 25 years, Benita has worked in farming and vegetable production. She learned the job from her parents, who taught her to be good at it herself. In addition to agricultural production, she works in the home and her children take part in the agricultural jobs.

She needs a loan to buy raw materials for farming, like: bags, seed, fertilizer and fungicide. With this, she will have a better production and will be able to earn the necessary income to continue working and improving the quality of life.

The plans that Benita has are to make improvements to the dwelling where she resides and to make her production of basic grains and vegetables grow.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for farming, like: bags, seed, fertilizer and fungicide.

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.ru: Гулноза молодая женщина в возрасте 32 лет, она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Гулноза является живет в сельской местности, как и многие сельские жители она занимается животноводством. С юных лет она помогала отцу ухаживать за животными. Благодаря отцу она набралась опыта и смогла заняться этой профессией самостоятельно. Начинала она с одной коровы которую купила на отправленные мужем деньги из России. Постепенно она начала увеличивать поголовье скота и на данный момент у нее одна корова и два молодых бычка. Ее бизнес стал для семьи Гулнозы основным источником дохода. На данный момент ее бизнес переживает не лучшие времена из за упадка цен на скот. Ей нужно закупить корм для скота, а продать скот из за низкой цены она не может. С данной проблемой она решила обратиться в "АРВАНД" за поддержкой. На полученные деньги она планирует закупить корм для скота и молодой скот по низкой цене.
texts.en:
Gulnoza, age 32, is a young married woman and the mother of three children.  She lives in the countryside and, like many local residents, she makes a living by raising livestock.  Ever since she was a young girl, she has always helped her father and taken care of farm animals.  Thanks to him, she has acquired a good deal of experience and she now has her own business.  

Gulnoza bought her first cow with some money sent from Russia by her husband.  Gradually, she has been able to increase her livestock headcount and she currently has one cow and two young bulls.  Her business is now the family's main source of income.  At the moment, though, her farming business is going through some difficult times due to the decline of cattle prices.  Gulnoza needs to buy livestock feed, but she cannot afford to sell any of her animals because of the current low prices.  Faced with this difficult situation, she has decided to turn to MDO Arvand for some support.  She is planning to use her loan to buy animal feed as well as a young cow at a low price.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and a young cow.

loans.name: Abdujalil

texts.ru: Абдуджалил  мужчина в возрасте 47 лет , проживающий в сельской местности .  Абдуджалил   женат и имеет  3 детей. Так как  Абдуджалил  вырос в малоимущей семье он не смог получить достойного образования. Ему приходилась много работать в детстве,  чтобы помогать родителям обеспечивать семью. Постепенно набравшись опыта,  Абдуджалил   стал самостоятельно заниматься животноводством. Опыт,  который он получил от отца,  очень ему помог в увеличении поголовья скота. На данный момент у Абдуджалила 7 голов крупного рогатого скота. Так как сейчас цены на скот упали, Абдуджалил   хочет купить несколько голов молодого скота. Но из-за того что все его сбережения вложены в бизнес у него нет возможности купить скот. С данной проблемой он решил обратиться в «АРВАНД» за поддержкой. На полученные деньги  Абдуджалил  планирует купить скот.
texts.en:
Abdujalil is 47 years old and lives in the countryside. He is married and the father of three children. Since he grew up in a low-income family, he was not able to get a decent education. As a child, he had to work very hard and help his parents provide for the family. Gradually though, he acquired a good deal of experience and he now has his own animal husbandry business.

The experience Abdujalil acquired from his father really helped him increase his cattle headcount and he currently has seven cows. Since cattle prices are very low at the moment, he wants to buy a few additional young cows. However, because he has invested all his savings in his business, he cannot afford to buy any cattle at the moment. Faced with this situation, he has decided to turn to MDO Arvand for some support. Abdujalil will be using his loan to buy some cattle.

loans.use: to buy some cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing and fruit to sell.

loans.name: Alosious

texts.en:
Alosious is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kiyinda in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has six children, with four of them currently in school. For the past four years, Alosious has been working hard to manage his retail shop.

To help expand his business, Alosious has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sodas, water, plastic buckets, basins, and cooking oil and will help Alosious to generate greater profits and increase sales. Alosious hopes that in the future, he will be able to expand his business.

Alosious is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Alosious who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy sodas, water, plastic buckets, basins, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Rocio Doroty

texts.es:
En el cantón El Carmen se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del Grupo de Crédito Granito de Esperanza, donde una de las fuentes principales de ingreso es el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete 
En este lugar vive la señora Roció, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos que estudian en escuela. El cónyuge es comerciante. Viven en casa de los papás.
Doña Roció realiza el crédito para que su esposo  utilice en su trabajo, él se dedica a la venta de llantas rencauchadas desde hace unos años, ella le ayuda y trabajan de 8h30 hasta las 18h00 de lunes a sábados
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar llantas ya reencauchadas o llevarlas a reencauchar.  Lleva dos ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta ya que el grupo es unido, la invito una amiga que está en el grupo. Su sueño es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, members of Grupo de Crédito Granito de Esperanza meet in the El Carmen district, where one of the main sources of income is the cultivation of plantain of the Barraganete variety. In this place lives señora Roció. She maintains a common-law marriage from which she has two children who are in school. Her common-law husband is businessman. They live in her parents' house.

Doña Roció is requesting a loan for her husband to use in his job. For some years, he has been selling retreaded tires. She helps him and they work from 8:30 to 6:00 p.m., Monday through Saturday. 

She will use this loan to buy already retreaded tires or bring them to be retreaded. This is her second cycle with Grupo de Crédito and she likes it because the group is close. She was invited by a friend who is in the group.

Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy tires.

loans.name: Sai Ram Group

texts.en:
Sai Ram Group was started in the year 2015 at Rekhapur village of M. Rampur block of Kalahandi district, Odisha, India. These are 13 active, self-dependent women, with an objective to develop their existing businesses as well as their livelihoods. All the members of this group have their own professions and businesses.

Niru is one of them who has taken a great role in her development and the group members’ source of revenue improvement. She is standing in the front line with a raised hand in the photo. She is about 23 years old and living with her small family, her husband and only one son.

Niru has been engaged in the clothing business for the last four years. Her husband is also helping her in the business. Through this business, she earns a monthly income of 8,000 INR. Her opinion is that, from this small income, it is very difficult to maintain her family. After that, to get sufficient surplus to reinvest in the business is practically impossible. In the current market situation, the competition is also very high. Another big investment is necessary for the expansion of her business. Fund scarcity is the main concern, so she formed a group for strengthening social relations and to access a loan for the expansion of her business.

She planned to purchase a big range of dress materials for kids and ladies as per the demand of the customers. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for reconstruction of her house, and she wishes to enroll her child in English medium school.

The other twelve members of the group are also smart at their professions and also are actively engaged with different professions like a paddy business, vegetable vending, bangle business, fruits business, grocery shop, livestock business, etc.

loans.use: to purchase a big range of dress materials for kids and ladies as per the demand of the customers.

loans.name: Mawanda

texts.en:
Mawanda is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has three children with none of them currently in school. For the past five years, Mawanda has been working hard to manage his retail shop.

To help expand his business, Mawanda has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase soap, eggs, salt, detergent, sugar, and creams, and will help Mawanda to generate greater profits and buy produce for the shop. Mawanda hopes that in the future, he will be able to increase his daily sales.

Mawanda is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mawanda who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: purchase soap, eggs, salt, detergent, sugar, and creams.

loans.name: Zeina

texts.en:
Zeina is a 38-year-old married mother of four children. She started fifteen years ago selling shoes to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She is a hard worker and an ambitious woman who has a good reputation in her region.

Zeina is trying hard to develop her business; thus, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with a new collection of summer shoes to satisfy her customers' needs.

Zeina hopes to keep on expanding her business to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of summer shoes.

loans.name: Jennipher

texts.en:
Jennipher is 44 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is widowed and has three children, with none of them currently in school. For the past five years, Jennipher has been working hard to manage her accommodation business, which operates rental units.

To help expand her business, Jennipher has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to build another block, and will help Jennipher to generate greater profits and improve on quality. Jennipher hopes that in the future she will be able to put up more rentals.

Jennipher is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jennipher who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to build another block.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 33 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala region of Uganda. He has no children. For the past five years, Joshua has been working hard to manage his salon, which provides hairdressing. 

Joshua is requesting a 2,500,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to buy shavers and after-shave cream, hair relaxers, rollers, and a dryer. He will use his loan to expand his business and generate greater profits. In the future, he hopes to open up a beauty school. Joshua is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP) which primarily serves small entrepreneurs who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy shavers and after-shave cream, hair relaxers, rollers, and a dryer

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala region of Uganda. She has one child. For the past four years, Christine has been working hard to manage her salon business, which provides hairdressing. 

Christine is requesting a 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda to buy mirrors. Her loan will help her generate greater profits and provide manicure services. Christine hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her salon. She is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP) which primarily serves small entrepreneurs who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy mirrors for her salon

loans.name: Dora Elizabeth

texts.es:
En el cantón El Carmen se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del Grupo de Crédito Granito de Esperanza, donde una de las fuentes principales de ingreso es el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete 
En este lugar vive la señora Dora, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 3  hijos de 15, 11 y 7 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es chofer y hace fletes.
Doña Dora para obtener sus propios ingresos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos que genera mantener el hogar y los estudios de sus hijos hace 12 años instaló en su casa un salón de belleza en el cual realiza diversidad de trabajos como tinturados, cortes de cabellos, pintado de uñas entre otras cosas. Trabaja todos los días si sus clientes requieren de sus servicios, no tiene horario definido. Además también vende productos de belleza,  el cual lo hace al mismo  tiempo cuando realiza sus otros trabajos.
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar tintes, permanentes, esmaltes entre otras. Lleva 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios, la invito la hermana al grupo. Su sueño es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean profesionales
texts.en:
The members of Granito de Esperanza Loan Group meet every two weeks in El Carmen Canton, where one of the main sources of income is growing plantains of the Barraganete variety.

This is where Dora lives. She's 41 years old and married, and they have three children, ages 15, 11, and 7, who attend school. Her husband is a driver and he carries cargo.

Dora started a beauty salon in her home 12 years ago to earn her own income and help her husband with the household expenses and their children's education. She provides a variety of services, including dyes, cuts, manicures, and others. She doesn't have a fixed schedule; she works every day if her customers need her services. She also sells beauty products at the same time she's carrying out her other tasks.

She's going to use this loan to buy dyes, permanents, nail polish, and other items.

Dora has been in the group for four years and she likes it because of the help and her earnings. Her sister invited her to join the group. Her dream is for her children to finish school and be professionals.

loans.use: to buy dyes, permanents, nail polish, and so on

loans.name: María Fernanda

texts.es:
En el cantón El Carmen se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del Grupo de Crédito Granito de Esperanza, donde una de las fuentes principales de ingreso es el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete 
En este lugar vive la señora María Fernanda, tiene 29 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 2 hijos, uno de 10 años que estudia en la escuela y un bebé de 3 meses. El cónyuge es mecánico.
Doña María Fernanda con la intención de ganarse algo por su cuenta se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local. Trabaja todos los días desde las 9h00 hasta las 18h00, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar  cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene 8 años a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y otra parte es para el esposo compre repuestos para la mecánica. Es socia desde hace 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito, ella es la tesorera del grupo. Sus sueños es tener una casa en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Colorados.
texts.en:
In the canton of El Carmen, the members of the credit group Granito de Esperanza meet every 15 days, one of the principal revenue sources of which is the cultivation of a variety of plantain called Barraganete. It is here where María Fernanda lives. She is 29 years old, and lives in a common law marriage from which she has two children. One is 10 years old and attends school, and the other is a three-month-old baby. Her partner is a mechanic.

Doña María Fernanda wants to earn a living herself, so she works at selling clothing of all kinds. Her means of selling is from door to door, and she also sells out of her house, where she has a small store. She works everyday from 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM, and allows her clients to buy on credit, which she collects on every fifteen days. She purchases her merchandise every fifteen days or every month, depending on what she needs. She has been doing this work for eight years, and it's going very well.

The loan will go towards purchasing more merchandise, like pants, blouses, and shirts. Another portion will be for her partner to purchase spare parts for the mechanic business.

María Fernanda has been a member of the credit group for four years, and is the treasurer. Her dream is to have a house in the city of Santo Domingo de los Colorados.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, shirts, and spare parts.

loans.name: William Manuel

texts.es: William es un joven que gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres ha logrado salir adelante, el gusto de ayudar a las personas que se encuentran enfermas al proporcionarles la medicina adecuada es de gran satisfacción para William. Para seguirse especializando William solicita un crédito para estudiar un posgrado en Farmacia y de esta manera crecer en este ramo y ser el orgullo de sus padres. William se ve como un gran profesional orgulloso de apoyar a quienes lo necesitan.
texts.en: William is a young man who thanks to the sacrifice and support of his parents, has succeeded in moving forward. The joy of helping those who are sick by providing them with the appropriate medicine gives William great satisfaction. In order to continue his specialization, William is requesting a loan to study for a graduate degree in Pharmacy, grow in this branch, and make his parents proud. William sees himself as a great professional proud to support those who need him.

loans.use: to study for a graduate degree in Pharmacy.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 42 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has three children and two of them are currently in school. For the past 15 years, Joseph has been working hard to manage his retail shop. 

Joseph is requesting a 3,000,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to buy household commodities. His loan will help him generate greater profits. Joseph hopes that in the future he will be able to open up another retail shop. He is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP) which primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joseph who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy household commodities

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Issa is 34 years old and lives in the town of Bundibugyo in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, with three of them currently in school. For the past four years, Issa has been working hard to manage his retail shop.

To help expand his business, Issa has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase soap, eggs, salt, and detergent, and will help Issa to generate greater profits and expand his business. Issa hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business.

Issa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Issa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase soap, eggs, salt, and detergent.

loans.name: Masudi

texts.en:
Masudi is 49 years old and is married with five children, four of whom are currently in school. He lives in the town of Bundibugyo in Uganda. For the past seven years, Masudi has been working hard to manage his stationary shop where he sells stationary items. 

Masudi is requesting a 3,000,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to buy more stationary items. His loan will help him generate greater profits. Masudi hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. He is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise Program (SEP) which primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Masudi who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy stationary items

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Doña Rosa  vive y trabaja en el Recinto San Bernabé, es una emprendedora de 60 años es viuda actualmente vive con sus 5 hijos todos son mayores de edad e independientes, se dedica al ordeño de vacas en su finca; sus hijos también le ayudan en esta actividad ya que son una familia muy unida,  esta actividad la aprendió con la ayuda de su difunto esposo ahora ella le dedica un promedio de 8 horas diarias ya que también debe limpiar los potreros.  

La señora Rosa solicita el crédito para comprar dos vacas lecheras y de esta forma acabar de construir su casa y poner seguridad a la misma.  

Doña Rosa agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la ayuda que le brindan ya que es una institución que ayuda a las personas para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Doña Rosa lives and works in the San Bernabé community. She is an enterprising 60-year old widow who currently lives with her five children who are independent adults She earns her living milking the cows on her farm. Her children also help her in this business, as they are a very close family. She learned this activity with help from her late husband. Now, she works an average of eight hours a day, as she also has to clean the corrals.

Señora Rosa is requesting the loan in order to buy two milk cows, and by doing so, complete the construction of her house and make it secure.

Doña Rosa is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and to Kiva for the support and the help that they give her, as it is an institution that helps people get ahead.

loans.use: to buy two more milk cows and increase her production. With that income, she would like to finish building her house.

loans.name: Umar

texts.en:
Umar is 28 years old and lives in the town of Bundibugyo in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past two years, Umar has been working hard to manage his salon business, which deals in hairdressing.

To help expand his business, Umar has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy hair products, and will help Umar to generate greater profits and invest in the business. Umar hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business.

Umar is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Umar who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy hair products.

loans.name: Chance

texts.en:
Chance is 38 years old and lives in the town of Hima in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, with three of them currently in school. For the past 15 years, Chance has been working hard to manage her produce business, which deals in produce sales.

To help expand her business, Chance has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.
