The loan will be used to buy sacks of produce, and will help Chance to generate greater profits and improve her standard of living. Chance hopes that in the future, she will be able to increase her stock.

Chance is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Chance who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy sacks of produce.

loans.name: Franis Yanira

texts.es:
Yanira, de 41 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, dejó sus estudios por los peligros que tenía que pasar a causa del conflicto armado, fue por esa razón se dedicó a ayudar a su madre en los quehaceres del hogar, luego se casó y han procreado dos hijos, uno estudia octavo grado y el mayor estudia segundo año en la universidad y es por ellos que junto a su esposo trabajan duro todos los días.

Yanira, es una persona muy trabajadora, tiene una tienda que atiende a para generar ingresos para ayudar en los ingresos de su hogar. 

Este crédito será destinado para comprar mercadería para su tienda, porque tiene mucha demanda y quiere surtir de diversos productos para tener más variedad.

Yanira, sueña con ampliar más su tienda y seguir mandando a estudiar a sus hijos para que puedan ejercer una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Yanira, who is 41 years old, went to school through third grade. She left school because of the dangers that she had to go through because of the armed conflict. It was for this reason that she worked at helping her mother with the household tasks. Then she married and had two children. One is in eighth grade, and the older one is studying in the second year at the university. It is for them that she, together with her husband, works hard every day.

Yanira is a very hard-working person. She has a store that she tends in order to generate income to help with the household income.

This loan will be destined for buying merchandise for her store, because she has a lot of demand and wants to stock various products in order to have more variety.

Yanira dreams of expanding her store more and continuing to send her children to school so that they can practice professional careers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store, such as rice, beans, and soft drinks, among other items.

loans.name: Manimegalai's Group

texts.en:
Manimegalai is 48 years old and makes her living working as a laborer in agricultural fields. She is the group leader of a four-member loan group in Kulithalai, Tamil Nadu. The women in her group have no access to toilets and therefore have to resort to open defecation using the false privacy of nearby fields and surrounding shrubbery. Due to the lack of sanitary facilities, their families are at risk of infection. They often fall ill, spending a significant portion of their savings on medical expenses each month. In addition, the women and daughters in the loan-group families are exposed to the additional risk of molestation. 

Manimegalai’s group is requesting a 56,000 INR loan to build toilets in their homes. Your loan will provide these four families with the privacy of using their own toilets which is large step toward improving their living standards. Higher hygiene standards will also lead to reduced medical expenses, and hence, more savings in the long run.

loans.use: to build toilet in her home

loans.name: Indira Del Carmen

texts.es: Con empeño y dedicación Indira ha logrado a salir adelante también gracias al apoyo de sus padres y su tía. Indira estudia farmacia y está a punto de terminar su carrera es por esta razón solicita un crédito para pagar su curso de titulación y coronar su carrera. Una vez finalizada su carrera se sentirá satisfecha porque podrá comenzar a ayudar a las personas que más lo necesitan.
texts.en:
With effort and dedication, Indira has managed to get ahead, also thanks to the support of her parents and her aunt. Indira is studying pharmacy and is at the point of finishing her program. It is for this reason that she is applying for a loan to pay for her degree course to culminate her program.

Once her course of study is complete, she will feel satisfied, because she will be able to begin to help the people who need it most.

loans.use: to pay for her degree course.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 41 years old and lives in the town of Hima in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with one of them currently in school. For the past five years, Agnes has been working hard to manage her retail shop.

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sodas, eggs, sugar, water, snacks, bread and will help Agnes to generate greater profits and increase stock.

Agnes hopes that in the future she will be able to improve her standard of living.

Agnes is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Agnes who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more sodas, eggs, sugar, water, snacks and bread.

loans.name: Bessy Cristina

texts.es:
Bessy, de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, porque la mamá no pudo ayudarla para que siguiera estudiando, está separada desde hace 5 meses, tiene 2 hijos en esa relación, por el momento no asisten a la escuela. 

Bessy, tiene 3 años de dedicarse a la venta de frutas, porque ese fue el oficio que su madre le enseñó, ya que es un negocio que da buenos ingresos, pero también la mamá le ha enseñado a trabajar en la agricultura, porque desde pequeña la llevaba a que trabajara en la tierra, para que ella aprendiera muy bien el oficio y supiera defenderse en un futuro, el trabajo lo realiza desde las 6:00 a.m. a 10:00 a.m.

Bessy, está solicitando el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, pesticidas y fertilizantes, porque junto a su madre tiene sembrados 7,000 metros cuadrados y por motivo de las lluvias no han podido abonar.
   
Los sueños de Bessy, son un día poder conseguir un trabajo, para sacar adelante a sus hijas y darles el estudio.
texts.en:
Bessy, who is 25 years old, studied up through high school because her mother couldn't her support her with her studies. She has been separated for 5 months now, and has 2 children from that relationship. Her children do not go to school for the time being.

Bessy has ben working in the sale of fruit for the past 3 years as this was the trade her mother taught her, and it's a business that generates good income. Her mother also taught her how to work in agriculture as she would take Bessy with her to work the land from an early age so she could learn the trade well and she would be able to maintain herself in the future. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 a.m.

Bessy is requesting a loan for the purchase of agricultural supplies such as manure, pesticides and fertilizers, which she needs as between her and her mother they have sowed 7,000 square meters of land, and due to the rains they have not been able to fertilize them.

Bessy's dreams are to one day be able to get a good job so she can get her daughters ahead in life and give them the opportunity to study.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as manure, pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 25 years old and lives in the town of Hima in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past three years, Wilson has been working hard to manage his retail shop.

To help expand his business, Wilson has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase soap, eggs, salt and detergent and will help Wilson to generate greater profits and improve his standard of living.

Wilson hopes that in the future he will be able to increase his stock.

Wilson is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Wilson who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase soap, eggs, salt and detergent.

loans.name: Maria Hortencia

texts.es:
En la Parroquia de Pacto barrio la Florida con un clima cálido lleno de gente amable y trabajadora tradicionalmente se realiza las festividades por el aniversario de la misma, este sector es un atractivo turístico muy visitado por su clima y por los lugares turísticos que existen. 
En Pacto vive la señora María una mujer luchadora, de 63 años vive con sus esposo el mismo que se dedica a las labores de campo tiene hijos pero son mayores de edad e independientes, tiene a su cargo dos nietos de 14 y 18 años los cuales son su apoyo incondicional.
La señora María  se dedica a vender comida en el mercado de Pacto tiene la ventaja en este negocio ya que ella mismo cria en su finca gallinas, conejos, cuyes, etc.  a eta actividad le dedica un promedio de 8 horas ahora está solicitando  el crédito para invertir en una cocina nueva para su negocio de esa forma podrá acabar de construir su vivienda.
Con esta inversión podrá ayudar a sus nietos a tener un mejor futuro y que no tengan que pasar por todas las necesidades que ella paso, agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad que le están brindada para salir adelante.
texts.en:
In the la Florida neighborhood of Pacto parish with it's warm climate and friendly and hard-working people, festivities traditionally are held on it's Saint day. This area is a tourist destination due to it's climate and tourist attractions.

María lives in Pacto. She is a 63 year old fighter who lives with her husband. He works doing agricultural labor. They have children but they are grown and independent. She takes care of two grandchildren aged 14 and 16 years old whom she supports unconditionally.

María works selling food in the market in Pacto. She has an advantage in this business of raising her own chickens, rabbits, guinea pigs, etc. on her farm. She works an average of 8 hours per day at her business.

She is requesting a loan to invest in a new kitchen for her business and in this way she can complete construction on her house. With this investment she will be able to help her grandchildren to have a better future so that they don't have to experience all that she did. She is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for their support and the opportunity she is being offered to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy a new kitchen to prepare her food and with this investment she should be able to help her grandchildren have a better future.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 52 years old and lives in the town of Hima in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has no children. For the past three years, Margret has been working hard to manage her retail shop.

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase soap, eggs, salt and detergent and will help Margret to generate greater profits and improve her standard of living.

Margret hopes that in the future she will be able to increase her stock.

Margret is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Margret who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase soap, eggs, salt and detergent.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 39 years old and lives in the town of Bwera in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has three children with one of them currently in school. For the past three years, Joshua has been working hard to manage his retail shop.

To help expand his business, Joshua has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy bananas, eggs, detergent and other items, and will help Joshua to generate greater profits and improve his standard of living.

Joshua hopes that in the future he will be able to improve his business.

Joshua is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joshua who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy bananas, eggs, detergent and other items.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 40 years old and lives in the town of Bwera in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has four children with two of them currently in school. For the past three years, Jackson has been working hard to manage his retail shop.

To help expand his business, Jackson has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sodas, beer and juice, and will help Jackson to generate greater profits and provide for family members.

Jackson hopes that in the future he will be able to improve his business.

Jackson is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jackson who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy sodas, beer and juice.

loans.name: Semerita

texts.en:
Semerita is 36 years old and lives in the town of Bwera in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past four years, Semerita has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which deals in baby clothes.

To help expand her business, Semerita has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more baby items, and will help Semerita to generate greater profits and provide for family members.

Semerita hopes that in the future she will be able to increase stock.

Semerita is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Semerita who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more baby items.

loans.name: Teresa Del Jesus

texts.es:
En el cantón El Carmen se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del Grupo de Crédito Granito de Esperanza, donde una de las fuentes principales de ingreso es el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete 
En este lugar vive la señora Teresa, tiene 52 años de edad, es viuda y de esta relación tiene 4  hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Vive en casa propia.
Doña Teresa con la intención de ganarse algo por su cuenta se dedica a la venta de productos de temporada y productos naturales. Su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta recorriendo los barrios y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local. Trabaja todos los días cuando se desocupa de sus labores de la casa,  la mercadería la deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la comprar cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene treinta  años a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más productos naturales. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace 4 años y le gusta la fundación porque son serios y el promotor esta siempre pendiente. Su sueño es tener una pequeña finca junto a la vía y tener un negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the Granito de Esperanza [Small Grain of Hope] credit group get together every 15 days in the neighborhood of El Carmen, where one of the main sources of income is the cultivation of the "Barraganete" banana. This is where Mrs. Teresa, who is 52 years old, lives. She is widowed, and from that relationship has 4 adult children who are independent. She lives in her own home.

With the purpose of making some money of her own, Doña Teresa works in the sale of seasonal and natural products. She sells door to door around her neighborhood, and also sells from directly from her home. She works every day after she is done with her housework. She allows her clients to pay in installments, and she charges them every 15 days. She buys her merchandise every 15 days or every month, depending on what she needs. She has been working in this field for 30 years and she is doing fine.

She would use this loan to buy more natural products. She has been in the Credit Group for the past 4 years. She likes the foundation because they are professional and the promoter is always available to help. Her dream is to have a small farm by the road and to have a business.

loans.use: to buy natural products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Dora Concepcion

texts.es:
Dora, de 47 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de asistir a la escuela porque estaba muy lejos, se acompañó y con su pareja procrearon dos hijos, pero por diversos problemas su pareja la abandonó y es madre soltera, pero esto no fue un obstáculo para  sacar adelante a sus hijos y ahora cada uno tiene su propio hogar.

Dora, es una persona muy trabajadora que se dedica a vender nances, anonas, frutas y verduras y también hace tamales y pan para vender; además tiene una pequeña tienda, la cual ha puesto con las ganancias que le quedan de sus ventas diarias.
 
El crédito será destinado para comprar mercadería para su tienda y para comprar verduras para salir a vender, de esa manera desea tener más ingresos y seguir haciendo lo que con todo orgullo y honradez ha hecho, para llevar el sustento a su casa.

Dora, sueña con ampliar más su negocio, para mejorar su vivienda y estar en un ambiente más segura.
texts.en:
Dora, who is 47 years old, did not have the opportunity to go to school because it was very far away. She married, and she and her husband had two children, but because of various problems, her husband abandoned her, and she is a single mother. But this was not an obstacle to raising her children, and now each of them has his own household.

Dora is a very hard-working person who sells nanches [a small, yellow, tropical fruit], sweetsops, fruits, and vegetables, and she also makes tamales and bread to sell. In addition, she has a little store that she has set up with the earnings from her daily sales.

The loan will be used to buy merchandise for her store and to buy vegetables to go out to sell. In this way, she wants to have more income and continue doing what she has done with great pride and integrity in order to bring sustenance to her home.

Dora dreams of expanding her business more in order to improve her home and live in a more secure environment.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store and to buy vegetables to go out to sell.

loans.name: Maclovia Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Maclovia una mujer luchadora de 62 años ella es madre soltera tiene un hijo de 13 años por el cual día con día lucha y se supera, lleva varios años siendo cabeza de hogar y gracias a sus negocios a logrado superar todas las barreras que se le han presentado.
Ella se dedica a la producción de pollos aprendió de este negocio por iniciativa propia al venir de una familia de bajos recursos no pudo prepararse y tuvo que buscar formas de sobrevivir y salir adelante junto con su hijo, a este negocio le dedica un promedio de 5 horas por día. 
Ella vive y tiene el negocio en el recinto Tulipe el mismo que se encuentra ubicado noroccidente de la provincia de Pichincha vía a la parroquia de Pacto un lugar de clima cálido lleno de gente amable la gran mayoría de personas se dedican a la producción como pollos panela y otros. 
Solicita este crédito para invertir en el negocio en la ampliación y arreglo de los galpones también comprara alimentos para los pollos, con esta nueva inversión mejoraran sus ingresos económicos y darle un mejor futuro a su hijo.
La señora Maclovia agradece a Fundación Alternativa a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidades brindadas.
texts.en:
Maclovia is a fighter.  She is a 62 year old woman and single mother who has a 13 year old son.  She struggles everyday to get ahead for his benefit.  She has been the head of the household for many years and thanks to her business she has been able to overcome many obstacles that have presented themselves. 

She works raising chickens.  She learned the business on her own initiative because she came from a low income family and was not able to attend school.  She had to look for ways to survive and to help herself get ahead along with her son.  She dedicates about five hours each day to her business. 

She lives and runs her business in the town of Tulipe, which is located in the Northwestern province of Pichincha close to the Parish of Pacto, a place known for its warm climate and full of kind people.  The majority of people work raising chickens, growing panela (a type of sugar cane), and other items. 

She is asking for a loan in order to invest in growing her chicken business and arranging the chicken coops, as well as purchasing feed for the chickens.  With this new loan she will improve her economic situation and offer a better future to her son.

Maclovia thanks Kiva and Kiva's partner the Fundación Alternativa for the support that has been offered.

loans.use: to invest in growing her chicken business and arranging chicken coops, as well as purchasing feed for chickens.

loans.name: Marta Beraly

texts.es:
Marta, de 36 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, no tuvo la oportunidad de seguir estudiando porque le ayudaba a su madre en los oficios del hogar, está acompañada, tiene tres hijos que aún están con ella, su pareja trabaja de cobrador en un bus.

Marta, es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral desde que vivía con su madre, pero hace tres años una fuerte lluvia, origino grandes deslaves y ocasiono el desborde de la quebrada, la cual arrasó con su vivienda y todo lo que tenía, incluyendo las aves que tenía; esa tragedia la dejó si nada, pero con el apoyo de personas solidarias hicieron una pequeña casa.

Ahora Marta, está solicitando un préstamo para comprar gallinas ponedoras, comprar concentrado y vitaminas, todo lo hace esperando obtener mejores ingresos y para darles el sustento diario a su familia.  

Marta, sueña con ampliar más su negocio y construir una galera más grande, donde pueda albergar una buena cantidad de pollos y con ello generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Marta is 36 years old. She studied up to second grade. She did not have the opportunity to continue studying, because she had to help her mother with household chores. She has a domestic partner and three children who are still living with her. Her partner works charging money on a bus. Marta is a very hardworking and enterprising person. She has raised poultry since she used to live with her mother; but three years ago a strong rain caused big landslides and the cliff to fall, which razed her house and everything she had, including her poultry. She lost everything with this tragedy, but with the support from helpful people, they built a small house. Nowadays, Marta is requesting a loan to buy laying hens, concentrated feed and vitamins. She does everything hoping to get better income and be able to support her family. Marta dreams of expanding her business and of building a bigger shed where she can keep a large quantity of chickens, and with it to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy laying hens, concentrated feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Omar Bernardo

texts.es:
Al Noroccidente de Pichincha en San Miguel de los Bancos Recinto Saloya con un clima cálido húmedo con gente muy unida, trabajadora que se dedica a las labores del campo vive Don Omar un hombre de 31 años que vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos son una familia muy unida, él ha buscado la manera de triunfar en la vida uno de sus logros es tener su negocio de venta de cerdos para tercenas del sector.
Tiene muchos sueños que quisiera concretarlos uno de ellos es darles  a sus hijos lo necesario dándoles una buena educación para que en algún momento lleguen a ser grandes profesionales y no tengan que pasar ninguna necesidad.
Don Omar desea fortalecer su negocio de cerdos ampliando de sus corrales para poder incrementar su producción ya que tiene mucha acogida, a esta actividad le dedica 3 horas diarias, tiene mucho conocimiento a pesar de que lo aprendió por iniciativa propia, está convencido que sus ingresos mejorarán la situación de su hogar debido a que siempre le pone mucha fe y dedicación a las metas que se propone. 
Don Omar agradece profundamente a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada para mejorar su calidad de vida y poder pronto cumplir con sus sueños, está convencido que esta oportunidad que se le presenta debe aprovecharla al máximo.
texts.en:
The northwest of Pichincha in San Miguel do los Bancos in the Saloya area has a hot, humid climate. It has people who are very united and hard working, and who are dedicated to farm work. 

In this place, lives Omar—a 31-year-old man, who lives with his wife and their two children. They are a very united family. He has looked for a way of triumphing in life. One of his successes is having a business selling pigs for butchering in the area.

He has many dreams, and one of them is that he wants to give his children what they need, such as offering them a good education so that they can become big professionals and lack for nothing.

Omar wants to strengthen his pig business. He plans to grow his pigpens so that he can increase his production, since he is well-known. He spends three hours on his work daily. He has a lot of knowledge, even though he learned the work by his own initiative. He is certain that his income will improve his household, because he always puts a lot of faith and dedication into the goals that he takes on.

Omar is profoundly thankful to Fundación Alternativa and to Kiva for the support and the opportunity offers to improve his quality of life and to be able to achieve his dreams. He is certain that he will take full advantage of this opportunity.

loans.use: to grow his pigpens and increase his production of pigs. This will improve the financial situation of his household.

loans.name: Maria Aliris

texts.es:
María es una mujer separada con 45 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos con 10, 14 y 22 años de edad, dedicada a la cría de pollos y venta de huevos, un negocio que con mucho esfuerzo logro sacar adelante ante la ausencia de su esposo quien la dejo hace poco.
Trabaja todos los días durante 6 horas diarias.

Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo con el cual comprara 20 gallinas ponedoras y concentrados.
El mayor sueño de esta madre es llegar a comprar una casa la cual pertenezca a sus hijos, quienes son el motor de esta mujer luchar día a día.

Sabe que con la ayuda de los colaboradores y prestamistas del portal Kiva lo lograra.
texts.en:
Maria is a 45-year-old separated woman. She is the mother of three children, ages 10, 14, and 22. She raises chickens and sells eggs, a business that she has carried forward with great effort in the absence of her husband, who left her recently. She works every day for 6 hours.

She is applying for a loan with which she will buy 20 laying hens and concentrated feed.

The great dream of this mother is to manage to buy a house that would belong to her children, who are the reason this woman strives day after day.

She knows that with the help of the collaborators and lenders from the Kiva portal, she will achieve this.

loans.use: to buy 20 laying hens and concentrated feed.

loans.name: Diana Marcela

texts.es:
Diana es una mujer separada con 27 años de edad, su labor es vender mercancía desde su casa, un negocio que le ayudado a salir adelante luego de pasar por una dura situación económica, la cual dejo se esposo quien era el sostén del hogar.
Trabaja todos los días, durante muy poco tiempo, ya que su prioridad es estar pendiente de su pequeño el cual tiene 1 año de edad.

Su deseo es abrir su primer local y lograra generara empleo a las personas que más lo necesiten.
Se encuentra solicitando un crédito el cual lo invertirá en la compra de mercancía como pijamas para dama, lociones y bisutería.

Como madre soltera su sueño es comprar una vivienda propia la cual en un futuro sea de su hijo.
texts.en:
Diana is a 27-year-old, divorced woman. Her work is selling merchandise from her home. This is a business that helped her go forward after she faced a difficult financial situation, when her husband—who was providing for the family—left her.

She works everyday for a short time, since her priority is caring for her one-year-old son. 

Her dream is to open her first store and succeed in generated jobs for people who really need them.

She is requesting a loan, which she will invest in buying merchandise, such as pajamas for women, lotions, and costume jewelry.

As a single mother, her dream is to buy her own house, which in the future will be her son’s.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as pajamas for women, lotion, and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Ciro Alfonso

texts.es:
A sus 64 años el señor Alfonso, con mucho esfuerzo, logro montar su propio negocio, una pequeña tienda en la cual vende productos medicinales naturales, un medio que le brinda los ingresos necesarios para cubrir sus necesidades básicas.
Actualmente presenta una dificulta, debido al poco surtido sus ventas han bajado, es por esto que solicita un crédito con el cual comprara productos naturales y complementos alimenticios al por mayor y una vitrina grande en la cual pueda almacenar estos productos.

Su mayor sueño es poder comprar una vivienda propia, tener una buena estabilidad económica y mejor calidad de vida.

Para esto cuenta con la ayuda de Interactuar y los colaboradores del portal Kiva.
texts.en:
At 64 years old, Alfonso, with a lot of effort, succeeded in starting his own business. It is a small store, in which he sells natural medicine products. This is a business that offers him the income he needs to pay for his basic needs.

At present, he is facing a challenge. Because of low supply, his sales have decreased. For this reason, he requests a loan to buy natural products and nutritional supplements wholesale. He will also buy a large display cabinet in which he can store these products.

His biggest dream is to be able to buy his own house, to have good financial stability, and to have a better quality of life.

For this, he relies on the help of Interactuar and the collaborators from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy natural products and nutritional supplements wholesale and to buy a display cabinet.

loans.name: Maria Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora María una mujer emprendedora de  25 años ella viene de una familia de bajos recursos económicos, y no pudo continuar con sus estudios  mantiene una sólida relación en unión libre de la cual tienen 2 hijos, el esposo trabaja actualmente en una empresa del sector, la señora María se dedica a la producción de cerdos aprendió de esta actividad junto con los padres, a este negocio le dedica un promedio de 3 horas diarias en las tardes recibe la ayuda del esposo, con este negocio y el trabajo de su esposo mantienen su hogar, ayudan en la preparación de sus hijos , para que ellos sean profesionales y tengan mejores oportunidades de trabajo. 
Ellos viven y tienen el negocio en el Recinto San José de Saloya un lugar de clima  templado, en este recinto tradicionalmente se realizan las fiestas de San José, en estas fiestas se aprovecha y se sirve el plato típico del recinto que es el cuy asado. 
La señora María solicita este crédito para invertir en el negocio, comprara más cerdos y también el alimento para los mismos, con esta nueva inversión podrá incrementar su producción y mejorar los ingresos económicos, la señora María agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en: María is a 25 year old businesswoman. She comes from a family of low financial resources, and she was not able to continue with her studies. She has a solid relationship in common-law marriage and two children. Her husband currently works at a company in the area. María works in pig production. She learned this business with her parents. She works an average of 3 hours a day in this business. In the afternoons, her husband helps her. With this business and her husband's job, they support the household and help to educate their children so they become professionals and have better job opportunities. They live and have the business in the area of San José de Saloya, a place of mild weather. The feasts of Saint Joseph are traditionally celebrated in this area. In these celebrations, the traditional dish, baked guinea pig, is served. María is requesting this loan to invest in the business. She will buy more pigs and also the food for them. With this new investment, she will increase her production and improve her income. María is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the given support and opportunity.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and food for them, and be able to increase her production and improve her income.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is 33 years old and lives in the town of Entebbe in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, with none of them currently in school. For the past two years, Winfred has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which deals in ladies' clothes and bags.

To help expand her business, Winfred has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Winfred to generate greater profits and expand her business. Winfred hopes that in the future, she will be able to become a wholesaler.

Winfred is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Winfred who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Faridah

texts.en:
Faridah is 35 years old and lives in the town of Abaita in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has five children, with three of them currently in school. For the past six years, Faridah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which operates in retail items.

To help expand her business, Faridah has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy bags of rice, sugar, beans, and posho, and crates of soda, and will help Faridah to generate greater profits and complete her rental units. Faridah hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her business.

Faridah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Faridah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, sugar, beans, and posho, and crates of soda.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 36 years old and lives in the town of Abaita in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past five years Francis has been working hard to manage his retail shop.

To help expand his business, Francis has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from Kiva's field partner BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more saucepans, buckets, charcoal stoves and cups to sell and will help Francis to generate greater profits and educate his children. Francis hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business.

Francis is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program. The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Francis who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more saucepans, buckets, charcoal stoves and cups to sell

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.es: Jeannette es modista de profesión, inicio a los 22 años como una necesidad de obtener ingresos porque tenía a su hijo y era madre soltera. Poco a poco ha ido incrementando su negocio junto a la ayuda de su hijo y de otras ayudantes que tiene en el negocio, para seguir creciendo solicita un crédito para comprar materiales como telas, agujas e hilos, de esta manera podrá surtir la demanda de sus clientes y obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Jeannette is a tailor by profession. She began at 22 years old out of the necessity to earn money because she had a son and was a single mother. Little by little she grew her business with the help of her son and others who are part of the business. To continue growing she requests a loan to buy materials such as fabric, needles and thread, so that she will be able to supply the demand of her customers and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy materials like fabric, needles and thread.

loans.name: Rodrigo De Jesus

texts.es:
Rodrigo es un hombre casado con 57 años de edad, padre de cinco hijos ya mayores, por necesidad económica este señor se dedicó a realizar labores de campo, como lo es cultivo de frutas, una actividad que aprendió gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres.
Este negocio le permitió salir adelante después de pasar por una dura situación económica la cual vivió luego de quedarse sin empleo, de allí se generan los ingresos suficientes para cubriré las necesidades básicas que  su hogar amerita.
Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo con el cual comprara abonos, riegos y semillas de diferentes frutos.
Su mayor sueño es comprarse una vivienda propia y poder ayudar a sus hijos económicamente en sus estudios.

Usted puede ser parte de este sueño, anímese y aporte a la vida de este hombre con un préstamo.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is a married man of 57. He is the father of five children who are already adults. Because of economic necessity, this man did farm work, such as raising fruit, work that he learned thanks to the teachings of his parents.

This business allowed him to get ahead after passing through a difficult economic situation, which he experienced after being left without employment. From this, sufficient income is generated for him to cover the basic necessities that his household deserves.

He is applying for a loan with which he will buy compost, irrigation, and seeds of various fruits.

His great dream is to buy his own house and be able to help his children economically with their education.

You can be part of this dream. Be inspired and support the life of this man with a loan!

loans.use: to buy compost, irrigation, and seeds for different fruits.

loans.name: Florentino

texts.es: Don Florentino, tiene 65 años de edad, es casado, tiene 5 hijos y vive en el municipio de Gracias, Lempira. Toda su vida la a dedicado a la agricultura, cultiva maíz, frijol y café. La producción de café la vende en grano seco despulpado en la misma zona. Ha solicitado varios prestamos para sus cultivos, actualmente solicita otro por 8,200 Lempiras para comprar abono y pago de mano de obra para darle asistencia al cultivo de café. Su objetivo es mejorar la producción para obtener buenas ganancias y darle calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Florentino is 65 years old, is married, and has five children.  He lives in the city of Gracias, Lempira, Honduras.  His entire life has been dedicated to agriculture.  He grows corn, beans, and coffee.  He sells his coffee crop dry processed and pulped in the same area where he lives.  He has asked for several loans for his crops.   Currently he is asking for 8200 Lempiras (Honduran currency) in order to purchase fertilizer and pay for manual labor in order to care for his coffee crop.  His goal is to improve his coffee production in order to obtain better income and offer a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for manual labor in order to care for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
Una mujer llena de vida, trabajadora y muy humilde, así es la señora Eugenia, a sus 68 años de edad, se dedica a la cría de pollo y posteriormente venta de pollos, un medio por el cual logro salir adelante luego de pasar por la dura perdida de su esposo, quien falleció hace poco.
Trabajo 2 días a la semana durante 6 horas.

Actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de pollos de engorde y cuido de levante.
A pesar de las circunstancias tan duras por las que ha pasado esta mujer, no se rinde, quiere seguir luchando y trabajando hasta cumplir el sueño de remodelar su casa, ya que esta con el tiempo se ha ido deteriorando y sus condiciones para habitarla no son las mejores.

Aporte al sueño de Eugenia, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
A woman full of life, hard-working, and very humble -- this is Señora Eugenia. At the age of 68, she raises chickens and then sells them. This is a means through which she managed to get ahead after experiencing the difficult loss of her husband, who died recently.

She works two days a week for six hours.

Now she is applying for a loan that she will invest in the purchase of chickens to care for and raise.

In spite of having passed through such difficult circumstances, this woman does not give up. She wants to continue striving and working to complete her dream of remodeling her house, since it has been deteriorating with time, and its conditions for habitation are not the best.

Support the dream of Eugenia, be inspired, make a loan!

loans.use: to buy chickens to care for and raise.

loans.name: Martha Nubia

texts.es:
Nubia es una señora soltera con 57 años de edad, que por necesidad económica monto su propio negocio, un taller de confecciones a terceros, el cual ubico en una de las piezas de la casa donde reside, esta actividad la por medio de unas clases a las cuales asistió.

Actualmente su negocio presenta una dificulta, tiene cantidad de pedidos por cumplir, los cuales  no ha realizado por falta de capital, es por esto que pide un auxilio económico con el cual comprara telas de alta costura al por mayor, con esto espera realizar sus trabajos y que sus clientes la sigan buscando por calidad, economía y buen servicio.

Para esta señora no hay nada imposible, quiere seguir trabajando hasta cumplir el sueño de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, pues esta con el tiempo se ha ido deteriorando y su estado no es el mejor.
texts.en:
Nubia is a single woman who is 57 years old. Out of economic necessity she started her own business, a dressmaking workshop for third parties, which is located in part of the house where she lives. [She learned] this activity through some classes which she attended.

Her business is having some difficulties right now. She has a number of orders to fill, which have not been completed due to a lack of capital. For this reason she asks for economic assistance with which she will buy high-fashion fabrics at wholesale. With this she hopes to complete her work so that her customers continue seeking her out for quality, value and good service.

For this woman, nothing is impossible. She wants to keep working until she achieves her dream of improving the conditions of her home, which over time has deteriorated and is not longer in the best condition.

loans.use: to buy high-fashion fabrics at wholesale

loans.name: Thangammal's Group

texts.en:
Thangammal is a 47-year-old lady, who lives in a family of four in a village in Tamil Nadu, India. She has formed a self-help group with her friends in Kulithalai, in the rural part of Karur, in Tamil Nadu. All four group members work hard to support their families, and save diligently. However, their finances are not adequate for them to access basic necessities like toilets in their homes.

They have to trek long distances at dawn to use the fields to relieve themselves. Due to this lack of sanitation facilities, their families are at risk of infection and fall ill often, spending a significant portion of their savings on medical expenses each month. The women and daughters in their families are exposed to the additional risk of molestation.

Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for Thangammal and her family. It will also mean they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick. So, together, they seek a loan of INR 56,000 to build a toilet at home. Your loan will help their families access basic sanitation, improved health, and safety.

loans.use: to build a toilet at home.

loans.name: Elsa Holanda

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Para La Ayuda De La Mujer se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas donde la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Elsa, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y de esta  relación tiene 6 hijos mayores de edad, una hija aun viven en su casa. El marido  se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Elsa realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice en su trabajo, su esposo tiene una embarcación y junto a sus hijos se dedican a la pesca, ellos salen en la mañana y regresan después de tres días con los productos que el mar les da, una vez en la playa entregan los productos a comerciantes mayoristas o ellos mismos venden por la ciudad, de esta forma el y sus hijos se ganan la vida honradamente. 
Este crédito es para  comprar redes piolas, combustibles y alimentos para los días que salen a pescar. Lleva 12 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los servicios que brinda la institución. Sus sueños es que nunca le pase nada malo a su familia.
texts.en:
The Loan Group for the Support of Women meets every 15 days in the Jaramijo region.  This place is known for its beautiful beaches, where the majority of its inhabitants are very hard-working and engaged in sea-related work.

Elsa lives in this place.  She is 56 years old, is married, and from this relationship has six grown children.  One of her daughters still lives at home.  Her husband is a fisherman.

Elsa is taking out a loan for her husband to use in his work.  Her husband has a boat, and makes a living by fishing together with his children.  They leave in the morning and return after three days with the products that the sea gives them.  Once on the beach, they deliver the products to wholesalers or they sell them in the city.  In this way, he and his sons earn an honest living.

This loan is to buy nets, fishing wire, fuel, and food for the days that they go out to fish.  Elsa has been in the Loan Group for 12 years, and she likes the services that the institution provides.  Her dream is that nothing bad ever happens to her family.

loans.use: to buy nets, fishing wire, fuel, and food.

loans.name: Sonia Isabel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Para La Ayuda De La Mujer se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas donde la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Sonia, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta  relación tiene 2 hijos de 17 y 14 años que estudian en colegio. El marido  se dedica a la pesca, ella hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la localidad.
Doña Sonia es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado ganarse lo suyo y así ayudarle a su marido a salir adelante, para esto hace más de 20 años instaló un pequeño taller de costura en su casa, allí ella confecciona todo tipo de prendas pero de preferencia de damas y niños, en ocasiones elabora uniformes de escuelas y colegios pero esto en temporada de inicio de clases. Trabaja todos los días unas seis horas dependiendo de lo que tenga que confeccionar, gracias a sus ganancias ella se gana algo por el bien de su familia. 
Este crédito lo va  emplear en comprar telas, cierres, hilos y materiales para la  costura. Lleva más 17  años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos sale adelante. Sus sueños son  ver que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Grupo De Credito Para La Ayuda De La Mujer [Loan Group for the Aid of Women] meets every 15 days in the canton Jaramijo. This area is known for its beautiful beaches where the majority of the inhabitants work very hard making a living from the sea.

In this area lives Sonia. She is 45 years old and married, and from this relationship she has two children who are 17 and 14 years old and study in the high school. Her husband makes a living fishing, and she learned to cut and make clothes many years ago in a local academy.

Sonia is a woman who has always liked to earn her own income and thus help her husband get ahead. For this purpose she installed a small sewing workshop in her house over 20 years ago. There she fashions all types of garments but preferably for women and children. Occasionally she makes school uniforms but only in the back-to-school season. She works every day about six hours depending on what she has to sew. Thanks to her income she earns something for the wellbeing of her family.

This loan will be used to buy fabric, zippers, thread and materials for sewing. She has over 17 years with the Grupo de Crédito [Loan Group] and likes it because with the loans she can get ahead. Her dream is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy fabric, zippers, thread and materials for sewing.

loans.name: John Bosco

texts.en:
John Bosco is 37 years old and lives in the town of Entebbe in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past three years John Bosco has been working hard to manage his retail shop.

To help expand his business John Bosco has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more household goods to sell and will help him to generate greater profits and increase capital. He hopes that in the future he will be able to set up another shop.

John Bosco is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program. The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like him who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more household goods to sell
